Dama has been working for the last year braking up and selling charcoal. She buys the product in various cities in the interior of the country and sells it broken up in various sized bags.

She requests the loan to buy larger amounts of charcoal so that she can buy it at a better price and earn higher profits to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of charcoal

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, 33 years old, is from Gaza. He is married and has four children.

He has owned a shop for furniture making since 2009 and has one employee.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy carpentry machines. Through this loan, he will be able to increase his work and improve his income to provide his kids with a better life and education.

loans.use: to buy carpentry machines

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is coming to Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit to be able to supply her business with top quality products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has a food pantry in her house. Thanks to the good variety she offers, she has been able to establish a good clientele. She is a hardworking individual and says that she wants to continue growing in her current profession. For this reason, she strives to do her best.

Fatuma is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products so that she can continue offering her customers the variety that they are accustomed to having.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Kunyetta

texts.en:
Kunyetta is a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning, because she begins her work day very early.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy bundles of fish, fruits and vegetables to re-sell so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fish, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and buy a new billiards table.

loans.name: Amjd

texts.en: Amjd is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He is an educated person, living in a poor area in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a traffic policeman who serves his country and receives a low salary. His house is very old and in a miserable situation. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. It is known that house renovation needs a lot of money. He has started renovating his house but now he is short of money. He needs to complete the renovation task, so he asked for a youth loan of 199,999.92 YER to buy cement and bricks. He hopes that after completing the house renovation, he can start to accumulate money to improve the living conditions of his family and open a saving account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to renovate his house

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is 35 years old from Gaza. He is married with two daughters.
He has owned a clothing workshop since 2000, and has 12 years' experience. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy sewing machines. He hopes that this loan will help him increase productivity and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha travels to Mombasa and brings back articles of clothing, which allows her to continue offering good prices. The articles of clothing that she sells most are those for women and children such as blouses, t-shirts, shorts, sweatshirts, and lingerie. She is requesting assistance so that she can buy articles of clothing that are in season. Aisha wants to be well stocked with these items so that she can offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing that are in season.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en: She really wants to finish constructing the wall of her house, since finishing the construction will make her home more secure. She is asking for a loan for this project, and is grateful to Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva for their help.

loans.use: to purchase bricks to finish building the wall of her house.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a very hard-working person who explains that, thanks to her effort, she has been able to get ahead. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to her and she is very grateful for it.

Today, she comes again, to be able to supply her general store with basic staples such as beverages, soft drinks, food products, canned goods and more, with which she will be able to continue offering a good variety and good prices to her clients. She is again grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples such as beverages, soft drinks, food products, canned goods and more.

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es: Las Exitosas, es un Banco Comunal que se ubica en la ciudad de Concepción, y acá encontramos a la señora Ximena, que en la foto se encuentra parada al costado derecho de blusa color sandia y pelo negro liso largo. En el Banco Comunal de Las Exitosas hay diversos rubros entre los cuales encontramos venta de ropa nueva y usada, tornería mecánica, perfumes, joyas, panadería, cremas y maquillaje. La señora Ximena vende ropa, accesorios como cigarreras, además de cremas reductoras y para el pelo. Hace tres años renuncio a su trabajo y fue el impulso para que  trabajara de manera independiente, en ese tiempo se dedico a vender joyas, maquillaje, masajes reductores, cremas reductoras,  y empezó con un capital de solo $20.000, aunque tuvo una buena llegada los problemas fueron apareciendo en el momento de que las clientas le pagaran porque muchas personas le compraban pero no le pagaban de inmediato y al momento en que Ximena les iba a cobrar, ellas ya no trabajaban en ese lugar o simplemente se habían cambiado de casa, ese fue un gran problema al principio cuando estaba empezando con su pequeño negocio, pero eso de todas maneras le ayudo para aprender y así fortalecer de a poco su negocio; además de no tener competencia en su rubro, por lo cual es un negocio seguro ya que, por el tiempo que lleva trabajando, ha podido hacerse de clientas . Ximena nos cuenta que el préstamo lo ocupará para comprar ropa y así poder ampliar aun mas su rubro, que tiene que ver con ayudar a que la mujeres se sientan aun más bonitas. Ella espera y tiene todas las ganas de que al momento de recibir su crédito, éste le ayude para que sea un buen año y exitoso, además de estar completamente agradecida con Fondo Esperanza por no solo entregarle ayuda económica, sino también por ser una ayuda integral en donde además las capacitan y siempre están pendientes de la ayuda que necesiten para poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en: "Las Exitosas" is a communal bank located in the city of Concepción. It is here that we meet Ximena, who, in the photo, is standing on the right, with long, straight dark hair.  In this communal bank there are various types of business, including selling new and used clothing, a machine shop, and members selling perfumes, jewellery, bread, creams and make-up.  Ximena sells clothes and accessories (such as cigar cases) as well as muscle-relaxing creams and hair products.  Ximena quit her job three years ago and was motivated to start working independently.  At the time she made a living selling jewellery, make-up, massages and creams for pain relief.  She started with $20,000 of capital though she had many problems with payments as, while customers were buying her products, they did not pay immediately and when Ximena later went to collect the payments people had changed address.  This was a big problem in the beginning when she was starting out but it still helped her to learn and to strengthen her business little by little.  She also has no competition for her business so it is quite secure and since she has started working she has been able to  attract clients.  Ximena tells us that she will use this loan to buy clothes, thus expanding her business mission which is to do with helping women to feel even more beautiful.  Ximena hopes and really wants that the loan will help her to have a good and successful year.  She is very grateful to "Fondo Esperanza" for not just providing financial resources but also for being an important help in providing training.  "Fondo Esperanza" is always on the lookout to see how they can help people fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe, tiene un pequeño hijo de 8 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Cesar pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho, en sus ratos libres le gusta ir al campo con su pequeño y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cesar trabaja como encargado de un centro académico de su ciudad, adicionalmente en las tardes dicta clases particulares como profesor de lengua y literatura, Cesar tiene una gran vocación por la enseñanza y cree que por esta razón y por su responsabilidad le va bien.
Cesar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijo, como compra de uniformes y compra de útiles escolares, de esta manera el podrá contar con los materiales necesarios para cursar adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues Cesar seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un colegio donde pueda ayudar a los más necesitados a instruirse.
texts.en:
Cesar is 41 years old and lives in Guadalupe in Chiclayo.  He has an eight year old son whom he loves and who is his main reason for living.  Cesar is very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic and puts all his efforts into making his son prosper.  Thanks to the efforts and support of his own parents, Cesar was able to study law.  In his spare time he likes to go out into the country with his boy and, on occasion, he cooks a delicious "tallarines" (a spaghetti dish from Peru) to share with his family.

With his own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Cesar now works as a manager at an education centre in the city.   In addition, in the afternoon he gives private classes in language and literature.  Teaching is what Cesar was born to do and he thinks this, along with his sense of responsibility, is why it's going so well.

Cesar is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support provided, he will be able to cover the costs of his son's education.  The costs including buying uniforms and school materials and with this loan his son will have all the necessary items to undertake his studies.  And Cesar will continue working and putting in the effort so he can achieve his big dream of starting a school where poor children can come for an education.

loans.use: to pay for school costs for his son.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Файзулло житель района Вахш. Ему 21 год. Он женатый молодой человек. Файзулло занимается земледелием уже три года и в основном выращивает арбуз. Так как сейчас сезон посева, Файзулло обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит для приобретения семян арбуза и минеральных удобрений. Он надеется получить богатый урожай.
texts.en: Faizullo is a resident of the Vakhsh region. He is 21 years old, he is a married young man. Faizullo has been doing land cultivation for three years now and mainly grows watermelons. As the season for sowing is now Faizullo has come for a loan. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds of watermelon and mineral fertilizer. He hopes to get a rich harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds of watermelon and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Muzigamyi Group

texts.fr:
Antoine fait partie du groupe Muzigamyi et   habite à Gitega. Il a 30 ans et est marié à Evelyne, une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils sont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 11 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, sel,…) depuis  10 ans.

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz, sel,…)  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Antoine is part of Muzigamyi Group and lives in Gitega. He's 30 years old and married to Evelyne, a cultivator. Together, they have four children, aged 1 to 11. Out of them, two go to school.

Antoine has been retailing beans, rice, salt, … for ten years. This is his first loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. With it, he will bolster his working capital and buy lots of products (beans, rice, salt, …) to resell in his shop, in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans, rice, salt...

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: Francisca est présidente du collectif d’affaire Ahadi, entrepreneur âgée de 48 ans, mère de 10 enfants dont 4 étudient et d’autres sont mariés. Son conjoint est un maître mâcon constructeur. La cliente est vendeuse des légumes (sombe). Elle expose ses produits au long de la rue. Elle commença cette affaite avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 13 ans, que, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les légumes (sombe) à marchander. Cette vendeuse de légumes connait de perte énorme lors qu’il ya plus de soleil (la sécheresse) qui s’abat sur ses produits. Dans le futur, elle souhaite accroitre son capital et voir ses enfants terminent leurs études. Ainsi, elle remercie hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en:
Francisca is the leader of the Ahadi business group. She is a 48-year-old entrepreneur and the mother of 10 children, 4 of whom attend school and some of whom are married. Her spouse is a master builder.

Francisca sells vegetables ("sombé", cassava leaves). She displays her products along the roadside. She started her business with her own funds, received from her husband. She has been in this line of work for 13 years. This new loan will be used to buy cassava leaves for resale. This vegetable-seller suffers great losses when there is a drought and too much sun shines down on her products. In the years to come, she would like to increase her capital and watch her children complete their studies. She would also like to thank Hekima for its financial support (microloans).

loans.use: to buy vegetables ("sombé", cassava leaves).

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is married with three school-going children and has been a member of Yehu Microfinance Trust since 2003. She buys and sells coal and gas pouches for a living.

She started her business with a wooden wheelbarrow, which she still owns. But over time she bought other work tools, eventually acquiring an open motorcar for her sales activity and product delivery to customers. The problem was that rainy days posed inconveniences. She now has bought another motorcar, covered this time, so she can deliver products, come rain or shine.

She is requesting a loan to buy coal to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy coal to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is married and has seven children. She has a charcoal store on her own premises. She says that she started out with a small stall, a fast food business and vegetable sales. She always dreamed of having larger premises so that she could have her own general store and butcher's shop.

Nyamvula has a lot of customers, which motivates her to continue working hard every day in order to make progress. She is a very honest, unassuming, hard-working woman but, above all, she is very responsible.

Nyamvula is requesting a loan to buy sacks of charcoal that she needs to stock her business so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula has been a merchant for a retail shop at home where she does everything she possibly can because it’s her family’s source of support. She started out with a small space selling household items, which gradually grew with her work and help from her family. 

She comments that nowadays business is difficult because there is a lot of competition and one must struggle to retain customers with good prices, variety, and above all charisma and good customer treatment for all who patronize her shop.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Rubercinda

texts.es:
Rubercinda es una mujer de 29 años de edad en un estado civil (unión libre) emprendedora, luchadora con muchos sueños y deseos de superarse. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad de primaria no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron seguirla apoyando con sus estudios. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar en el cultivo de café como ser: siembra, poda, fertilización, corta de cosecha y la mecanización del cultivo. Ella agradece infinitamente a sus padres por haberle enseñado a trabajar en esta actividad ya que ha sido medio de sustento para su familia y en la actualidad para su hogar del cual pueden cubrir las necesidades básicas como ser: alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas con muchas restricciones, etc. Su familia es muy numerosa y está compuesta por 7 hijos los cuales están en la escuela y en el colegio ellos ayuda en algunas tareas del hogar al salir de sus actividades escolares con algunas actividades en el campo. Por ellos es que trabajan fuertemente en el cultivo de café junto a su pareja para que tengan una mejor vida. Las tierras donde cultivan son obtenidas por herencia y están ubicadas a una distancia de 150 metros de su casa de habitación aproximada mente por lo cual se trasladan a pie y les permite estar al pendiente de la asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café ya que esto permitirá que se mantenga sano y limpio de cualquier plaga y enfermedad.

Su sueño es lograr graduar a sus hijos de las carreras que ellos puedan escoger para su beneficio y dedicación ya que eso les permitirá ser mejores cada día, con mejores oportunidades en la vida, y puedan mejorar su estilo de vida ya la tierra que ellos actualmente trabajan será su herencia para que ellos puedan generar empleo y crear su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Rubercinda is 29 years old and is in a civil partnership. She is entrepreneurial and a fighter and has many dreams and wishes to fulfil. 

She finished the third grade of primary school because her parents lacked the financial resources and couldn't afford to support her studies. It was her parents who taught her about the coffee-growing business: how to plant, prune, use fertilizers, harvest and use machinery in the cultivation process. 

She is infinitely grateful to her parents for teaching her about this business because it has been her family's main source of income and currently, her own family's  main source of support. Through her business she can cover basic needs such as food, clothing, prescription medicine etc. Her family is large and she has 7 children who are all either in school or college. They help her with domestic work when they get out of school and also sometimes help out in the fields. She works hard growing coffee with her partner so they can have a better life. 

The land they cultivate is inherited and is located 150 metres from the family home, meaning that they can walk there, allowing them to always be available to take cares of the crops.

At the moment she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and compost to maintain her coffee crops because this will allow her to keep them healthy and free from diseases or insect damage. 

Her dream is to put her children through university in the courses they choose because then everyday they can improve and it will afford them better opportunities in life. They can also improve their lifestyle, as they will inherit the land they work so they can create work for themselves and build up their own businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost to maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Maria no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Maria trabaja como mucama en un hotel de su ciudad, adicionalmente los fines de semana brinda servicios de limpieza en un salón de belleza, Maria trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Maria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos, como compra de uniformes y compra de útiles escolares, de esta manera ellos podrán contar con los materiales necesarios para cursar adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues Maria seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un negocio independiente.
texts.en:
Maria is a 48 year old woman. She lives in the city of Nazca with her three children, whom she loves and who are her main reason for living. She is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts all of her efforts into getting her family ahead, because she is both mother and father for her children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and out of a need to work since she was very young, Maria was unable to to study nursing. In her free time, she likes to watch television and on occasions she cooks a delicious carapulcra with sopa seca to share with her children.   

On her own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Maria works as a maid in a hotel in her city. On weekends, she also offers cleaning services at a beauty salon. Maria works every day for approximately 8 hours and she thinks it is going well for her because of her responsibility and the friendly way she treats others.  

Maria is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to cover her children's education expenses, such as buy uniforms and school supplies. This way, they will have the materials they need to continue their studies. Maria will keep working and striving to achieve her big dream of having an independent business.

loans.use: to cover her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro, de 60 años de edad es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Primitiva y sus hijos en la casa que compró hace 16 años. Alejandro se dedica a la agricultura y  la compra y venta de animales .Lleva más de 30 años dedicandosé a estas actividades y se esfuerza mucho con a sus animales entre ellos ovejas y vacas, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y paciencia, ya que depende mucho de ello su carne, el cual vende en el mercado a sus clientes fijos. Pero la agricultura es su medio de ahorro, comenta que siembra en grandes terrenos ubicados en una zona fértil a 2 horas de viaje, sus sembríos de maíz, papa y demás alimentos le proporcionan buenos ingresos económicos, pues los vende a mayor precio secando el maíz. Ahora desea mejorar sus sembríos pues pronto llegará el mes de mayo y en ese mes suben los precios
Alejandro, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de maíz y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 60 years old. He is a hardworking man. He lives with his wife Primitiva and their children in the house he bought 16 years ago. Alejandro is a farmer and he buys and sells animals. He has been doing these activities for more than 30 years. He works very hard with his animals, among them sheep and cows. He cares for them with much dedication and patience, since the meat they produce depends a lot on it. He sells the meat in the market to his regular customers. But farming is the way he saves money. He says that he plants on large plots of land located in a fertile area 2 hours away. His corn, potatoes and other crops bring him good income. He sells them at a good price, drying the corn. Now he wants to improve his crops because it will be May soon and during that month the prices go up. 

Alejandro will invest S/.3,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to feed his crops. He is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is 31 years old and has been married for 15 years.  She has three school aged children who attend school.  Twelve years ago she started a charcoal store in her home.

At the moment, the whole family works in the store.  It’s located in the most important part of the Samburu.  The business is growing, thanks to Scolasica’s and her husband’s hard work.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing her business and being the center of shopping in town.

She is asking for this loan to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is from Samburu, Kenya.  She's a merchant and the owner of a food stall business.  She has been doing this work for more than four years and she has become very well known among the customers who go there.

Marcelina is a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead.  That's why she works so hard.  She works from very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells and she returns home late at night.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes.  This is what she most needs and uses every day.  She's grateful for this opportunity because with it she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama  y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jose no pudo estudiar la carrera militar que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por el campo y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cuy Chactado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jose trabaja como obrero en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de dos andamios, una mesa y abarrotes en general, de esta manera Jose con el apoyo de su esposa podrán iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes en su hogar, así pues podrán generar mayores ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para lograr su gran sueño de tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Jose is a 44 year old man. He lives in the city of Pisco with his wife and their three children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. Together with his wife, he puts all of his efforts into getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and out of a need to work since he was very young, Jose was unable to have the military career he wanted to have. In his free time, he likes to spend time in the countryside and on occasions, cook a delicious cuy chactado to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with much hard work and dedication, Jose works in a municipal business in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and he thinks it is going well for him because of his hard work and the friendly way he treats others. 

Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy two shelves, a table and some general groceries. This way, Jose. with his wife's help, will be abel to start a small business selling groceries from their home. This will be very useful for them to achieve their dream of having a mini-market.

loans.use: to buy two shelves, a table and some groceries.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu says that thanks to the previous loan that she received from Kiva, they were able to provide better products to their customers and they were able to grow sufficiently.  They are very grateful for this support.

Today they are once again interested in asking for further assistance.  They want to invest again in their store to be able to stock it with more products and a variety of supplies such as beverages, dairy products, vegetables, and other supplies.  She is very grateful for the new opportunity that she's receiving since it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to stock the store with more products and a variety of supplies such as beverages, dairy products, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 41 years old and is a business woman.  She is married to Abdalla.  They have three young children and all of them attend school. 

Little by little Asha began increasing her sales since she herself goes out to offer her products in the zone.  She sells mostly clothing for women and children like blouses, shorts, undergarments, t-shirts and sweatshirts.  One of her great dreams is to have her own store in the town center.  She is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing.  This will help her greatly with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
34-year-old Saumu is from Samburu, Kenya.  She worked as a dressmaker from a very young age, then after she got married, she set up a grocery store which she still runs.

Saumu has a well-established customer base in the area surrounding her neighborhood.  Through her work, she has been able to improve her home and help her husband with their daily expenses.

Saumu needs this loan to buy basic household products with which to stock her store: sugar, noodles, beans, vegetables, etc.  She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance Trust for the opportunity that they have given her as it will be a great help.

loans.use: to stock her store with sugar, noodles, beans, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Duo San Francisco Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN FRANCISCO
La encargada de este grupo es la señora Telma , quien se dedica a la confección de blusas de vestir.  Ella tiene dos hijas y al lado de su esposo siguen luchando por sus sueños.  Ella tiene varios pedidos de blusas, pero la tela que utiliza para trabajarlas no le alcanza por ese motivo ella nuevamente pide otro crédito para poder comprar la tela por rollos valorados en Q. 1100.00 cada una.  Su compañera Jeimy quien tiene 22 años de edad tiene una venta de variedades, fantasía y ropa americana. Y desea comprar varias cosas más para la venta pero el dinero no le alcanza.
texts.en:
San Francisco Group.
The leader of this group is Telma, whose business is making blouses.  She has two children and both she and her husband work hard to achieve their dreams.  Telma has several orders for blouses but she doesn't have enough fabric to make them.  For this reason, she is requesting a new loan to buy bolts of the fabric she needs at 1,100 quetzals each.  Her fellow group member, Jeimy, is 22 years old and sells miscellaneous goods, costume jewelry and American clothing.  She would like to buy some additional goods to sell but doesn't have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make blouses

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi est un homme de 43ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et mère de 04 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé est âgé de 17ans et le dernier 10ans. Depuis 1995, il exerce comme activité le jardinage et est aidé par 08 personnes. Avec son second crédit, mr Koffi  veut acheter des matériels, des graines de semence et des fumiers pour avoir une bonne récolte. Le profit tiré de la vente lui servira d’élargir son champ et de s’occuper de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Koffi is a 43-year-old man. He is married to a retailer and the mother of 4 children who all attend school. The eldest child is 17 years old and the youngest, 10. He has run a gardening business since 1995 and is assisted by 8 people. Koffi would like to use his second loan to buy equipment, grains, seeds and fertilizer, so that he has a good harvest. The profit he makes from his sales will be used to expand his field and take care of his children's education.

loans.use: to buy equipment, grains, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stall in the market

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Djiguisseme est composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 34 ans, 4 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Chakabougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de chaussures, de condiments, d’arachide et d’articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé le précédent. 
La cliente N’DJA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter une dizaine de paire de chaussures en plastique avec les grossistes de Dioïla et de Fana pour ensuite revendre sur place dans le village.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de chaussures en plastique.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is entirely made up of married women who have an average age of 34 and, on average, 4 children, and who all live in traditional, extended families in the village of Chakabougou, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through family and neighbourly relationships, and friendships. They sell shoes, condiments, groundnuts and various other shop items. The women of the Djiguisseme group are on their second group loan, having properly repaid the previous one.

N'Dja, the woman standing in the middle of the back row, plans to buy a dozen pairs of plastic shoes from the wholesalers of Dioïla and Fana, so that she can resell them locally in her village. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 5 000 francs, part of which will be used to meet her family's needs and part of which will be reinvested in her plastic shoe-selling business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Triunfadoras está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 9 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir sus ingresos son muy bajos.  Ellas se están esforzando por ir mejorando y ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma cuenta que hace Bordado de zapatillas y bijouterie, también se debe destacar el trabajo y el esfuerzo que ella hace por crecer y salir adelante. Ella es muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y sueña con poder mejorar su vida y sus ingresos.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de una máquina de coser  lo que la ayudará en sus bordados, y de esa forma poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group’s name is Mujeres Triunfadoras [Triumphant Women]. Its members took part in the “poverty elimination” survey and nine were found to be living below the poverty line, i.e. their income is very low. They are struggling to improve and help their families.

One of the members is Mrs. Norma. She says that she decorates shoes with embroidery and makes jewelry. She works hard and makes a big effort to progress and get ahead.

Norma is a hardworking and enterprising woman who dreams of improving her life and income. She is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to work on her embroidery, which will help her to improve her income and continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es:
Emigdio tiene 64 años, está casado con Nélida, tienen 2  hijos, quienes ya son mayores de edad, profesionales e independientes, los cuales criaron con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, y hoy tienen el orgullo de que sean personas de bien.
El Sr. Emigdio tiene una panadería desde hace más de 14 años, tiene muy buena clientela gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y a la excelente atención en el local que hace el Sr. Emigdio y su esposa.
Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de harinas y levaduras en general, para poder seguir dando una buena calidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emigdio is 64 years old.  He is married to Nélida and has two adult children who are professionals and live independently.  Emigdio worked hard and sacrificed a lot in order to raise his children and now he is proud of the fact that they are upstanding citizens. 

Emigdio has owned a bakery for more than 14 years.  He has a very good customer base owing to the good quality of his products and the excellent customer service that both he and his wife provide.

Emigdio has requested this loan to buy flours and yeast so that he can continue offering his customers good-quality products.

loans.use: to buy flour and yeast for making baked goods

loans.name: Jeen Joel

texts.es:
Jeen es un joven de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres Jeen pudo estudiar una pequeña carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, jeen trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, donde prepara jugos y sándwich, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 8 horas y cree que le va bien porque es conocido y trata bien a sus clientes.
Jeen se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando y atendiendo a sus clientes, así pues el dese lograr su gran sueño de tener un negocio de embutidos.
texts.en:
21-year-old Jeen is single and lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings.  Jeen is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve himself.  Through his own hard work, and with the support of his parents, he was able to study for a degree in Business Administration.  In his free time, he enjoys dancing and he sometimes cooks a delicious 'arroz chaufa' (fried rice) to share with his family.

With a lot of hard work and commitment, and with the support of his mother, Jeen works in his own small food business where he prepares juices and sandwiches.  He works around 8 hours every day and believes that his business is doing well because he is well known and treats his customers well.

Jeen is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a small stall in the central market in his city.  This will enable him to continue working and serving his customers.  His biggest dream is to own a delicatessen.

loans.use: to buy a stall

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
28-year-old Chizi is a married mother of two children from the village of Samburu. She owns a well-stocked grocery store where she serves most of her neighbors and friends by offering them a good variety of the best products at good prices.

She tells us that she works twice as hard so that she can provide her children with everything they need for living with dignity and without the deprivation she had to go through. She sacrifices herself because she wishes to see her children become well-adjusted people who are useful not only to themselves but to society as well.

Saumu requests the loan in order to purchase flour, milk, noodles, rice, sugar and other items. This will allow her to stock up her store and keep it well assorted so that she can continue to offer her customers a wide variety of merchandise. She gives thanks to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the helpful opportunity she and her children are getting which will greatly benefit them.

loans.use: to purchase flour, milk, noodles, rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina, 33, is from Samburu, Kenya. She is married and has 8 children - the eldest is 20 and the youngest is 2. Selina has been selling drinks and food products in her grocery store for about 4 years. She started with a stall in the market where she sold fruits and vegetables. Over time she was able to open a store in her home and leave her market stall. Her goal is to keep progressing this way and to get ahead.

She requests a loan to buy drinks like soda and food products like rice, sugar, tea, flour, oil and other things to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy drinks like soda and food products like rice, sugar, tea, flour, oil and other things to stock her store.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is from Samburu, Kenya. She is 62 and has been married to Mlanda for years. They have 4 children, all of whom attend school. Mjeni is a fighter. Her husband works far from the city, so she takes charge of the caring and raising of their four children.

She has run a small grocery store for 5 years. She says her husband’s work was not enough to get such a large family ahead in life, which is why she opened the store. She started the business one step at a time, and slowly grew it with the help of her kids. Her dream is to have a mini-market to offer better services to her customers.

She is requesting the loan to purchase drinks, flour, sugar, and other staples necessary to stock her store. She is thankful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity that it gives her.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, flour, sugar, and other staples necessary to stock her store.

loans.name: Ghadiyya

texts.en:
Ghadiyya is 40 years old and lives in Tulkarem. She is married and has two children. She has owned a small grocery store since May 2011.

She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more goods for her store. Ghadiyya hopes that this loan will help her increase her sales and improve her income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina de 42 años de edad, es una mujer seria. Vive en compañía de Eliazar, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Kelvin y Lizbeth, a los que cuidan en la casa que heredaron desde hace 12 años.
Mientras que su esposo trabaja como peón en una fábrica de ladrillos, donde la pagan por cada millar que realiza. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, pues es ahí donde obtiene mejores ganancias. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de ovejas, toros y vacas muy pequeños, a quienes cuida y alimenta para luego venderlos en las ferias locales de la ciudad, ya tiene mucho tiempo de experiencia. Cuenta que cotiza muy bien sus animales y si no le pagan lo que solicita los regresa a su casa para seguir alimentándolos y así obtener la próxima vez una mejor ganancia ,“no puedo rematar los animales, tengo que ser inteligente”, afirma. Ahora desea junto a su esposo alquilar un terreno amplio para poner su fábrica de ladrillos y así el pueda trabajar en algo propio y no para otras personas.
Aquilina, invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de ovejas en cantidad y si el dinero le alcanza en una vaca , a su vez agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para lograr sus objetivos ,además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .
texts.en:
42-year-old Aquilina is a responsible woman.  She lives with Eliazar, her husband of 20 years, and the couple have two children: Kelvin and Lizbeth.  They care for their children in a house that they inherited 12 years ago.

While Aquilina's husband works as a laborer in a brick factory, where they pay him for every 1,000 bricks he makes, Aquilina's business is buying and selling livestock.  This is where they make the most profit.  Aquilina buys sheep, bulls and cows when they are very young, raises and feeds them, then sells them in the local markets in the city.  She has a lot of experience in this line of work.  She says that she charges a very good price for her animals and, if people don't pay her what she asks, she takes the animals home again, continues feeding them, and puts them up for sale again later so that she can make a good profit.  "I can't sell my animals for too little.  I have to be smart", she says.  Aquilina and her husband would like to rent a large plot of land, where they can set up their own brick factory, so that he can work in his own business and no longer have to work for other people.

Aquilina will invest the 2,000 soles she has requested in buying a number of sheep.  If she has enough money left over, she will also buy a cow.  She is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving as it allows her to achieve her goals.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy sheep and a cow

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a 19 year old single man, lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future. He is working for a company and he has accumulated his salary in order to provide for his family (brothers and parents). 

The house the family lives in has been deteriorating over the past years. He is requesting a youth loan of 300,000 YER to purchase construction materials for repairing the ceiling and windows. He hopes with this loan the family can live in a more comfortable place. This will also contribute to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairing the ceiling and windows in his house.

loans.name: Duo Perlas De Ramirez Group

texts.es:
DUO PERLAS DE RAMIREZ

ESTA FORMADO POR LAS SEÑORA MARTA Y DOÑA SANDRA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL DUO PERLAS DE RAMIREZ  ES CASADA  TIENE DOS HIJAS  MENORES DE EDAD LAS CUALES ASISTEN ALA ESCUELA  ELLA INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 3 AÑOS EL NEGOCIO DE ELLA ES LA VENTA DE TAMALES Y PACHES Y CHUCHITOS Y VENTA DE COSMETICOS ELLA  LE DA PRIMERA MENTE GRACIAS A DIOS POR LA OPORTUNIDAD  QUE  FAPE  LE BRINDO Y  PIDE A FAPE LA PUEDAN SEGUIR APOYANDO  CON SU CREDITO  Y LO QUE MAS LES GUSTA ES LA FORMA DE PAGO Y LOS INTERESES QUE SON BAJOS Y DICEN QUE DIOS BENDIGA A FAPE POR EL APOYO QUE ANTENIDO DE ELLOS
texts.en:
Perlas de Ramirez group.

This group has two members: Marta and Sandra.  Sandra is the group leader.  She is married and has two dependent children who are attending school.  Sandra started her business selling tamales, 'paches' and 'chuchitos' (different types of tamales) and cosmetics three years ago.  Sandra thanks God for the opportunity that FAPE have given her and asks FAPE to continue supporting her with loans.  What she likes most is the repayment terms and the low  interest rates.  She hopes that God will bless FAPE for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tamales

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is 40 years old and from Samburu. She lives with her husband George and six children. Kasichana has a business selling basic household products such as sugar, noodles, flour, baked goods and other items, which she supplies to all her neighbors.

She comments that she has many customers and as a result, she can make the income she needs to cover her household expenses and in this way, get ahead in life. She says that her husband helps her in her business as there are days when she has many customers.

She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, noodles, flour, baked goods and other basic household products with which she can stock her store and offer her customers more variety. Kasichana is very grateful for the help that Yehu Microfinance and Kiva have given her.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, flour, baked goods and other basic household products.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a humble woman who has made sacrifices. She is a married mother of 10 children who have started their own households. 

Mwaka decided to invest in a small store in her home so that she could provide everything her children need. Her dream is to operate a well-stocked food pantry so that she can offer variety and convenience to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy food products such as rice, noodles, sugar, vegetables and other items.

She is happy for the opportunity that Yehu Microfinance has provided. This has helped her achieve part of her long-anticipated dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, noodles, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Glady's

texts.en:
Glady's is 33 years old and has six children between the ages of 18 and 3 years old. Her husband always helps her with everything in regards to her businesses.

She is a merchant. She started the business by selling food like dumplings and flat bread. After a little while she was stocking up and selling household consumer products such as noodles, sugar, flour and oil. She says that her grocery store has good earnings because she has well-established customers who always frequent her business. With her customers and her husband’s help they are able to support their children and maintain their house.

She is requesting the loan to buy noodles, cookies, rice, oil, sugar, meat and other basic items in order to stock her place and meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cookies, rice, oil, sugar, meat and other basic items.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is a merchant. She makes a living selling mainly fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 2 years and she has a place in a popular market in Likoni where she sells fresh products to her customers every day.

Elnora is a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning, because she begins her work day very early.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is from Likoni and has been selling men’s and women’s clothing and accessories from a rented shop for seven years.

She is a client of Yehu Microfinance Trust and has been for more than a year. Thanks to the help she has been receiving, she has been able to improve her business. Her dream is to be able to have her own shop someday, so that she can have a greater income.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy women’s clothing and accessories so she can sell them and continue to work.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothing and accessories so she can sell them and continue to work.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Likoni in a rental house with her husband and children. The family raises and sells chickens, and has been in this business for 4 years.

She raises the chickens at her house and sells them by taking them via motorcycle from her home to town as well as to restaurant operators.

The loan is to pay school fees for her children who attend school.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children who attend school.

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo comes from the town of Likoni. She says she runs a small and well-furnished store in her neighborhood. She has 6 children, 2 of whom are adults who are economically independent and four of whom still attend school.

She has been running her small store for many years, and she has established customers and she is really well-known thanks to the variety of products she offers to her customers. She wants to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Mwanamzungu

texts.en:
Mwanamzungu is married to a businessman. They have two children, both of whom attend school.

Mwanamzungu has been working as a street vendor, selling clothes and shoes for women, men, and children since 2011. She has an established clientele.

Mwanamzungu is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of jeans, clothes for men and women, and uniforms for elementary and high school students.

loans.use: to purchase of jeans and clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid says that she has been able to help her family through her business and that she has given them all that they need to continue having a dignified life with no deprivations. 

Mesaid wants to be able to continue working and helping her family, so she is asking for this loan to buy fruits and vegetables. This will enable her to continue working and offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kura

texts.en:
Kura lives with her husband and five children in Likoni. At a very young age, she started helping her parents by buying clothing and other products for resale. She has built a very good customer base because of her good pricing and her variety of products. For this reason, she wants to be able to invest in her business.

Kura is requesting this loan to purchase shirts, t-shirts, shorts and other garments because these are in high demand this season. She is grateful for this opportunity since the loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts and other garments.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with two children who are in school. Mariam and her husband do their best to give their children everything they need for their studies so that one day they can become successful and honest people.

Mariam is known as a seamstress. Mariam started out with some capital that she earned while working. Now she has a business where she produces sportswear for educational institutions and sports clubs. Throughout her career, she has gained many customers who visit her home in order to place their orders.

This loan will be used to buy more supplies in bulk such as different colored fabrics, thread, buttons and zippers. As a result, she will be able to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies in bulk such as different colored fabrics, thread, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old and married with two children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as soap, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and rice-farming business.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as soap, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy works hard to support her family. Mary Joy is married and has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Mary Joy has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mary Joy has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 37 years-old and married with four children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm which is a papaya production in order to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 4,000PHP every month. She has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000PHP in order to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lilita

texts.en: Lilita is 63 years old and separated with three children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a clothing shop in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 8,000PHP every month. She has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000PHP in order to purchase additional clothing to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is  49 years old and lives in Jimenez. She provides for the needs of her five children with the 5,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business. For five years this has been an aid to the income earned by her husband. However, in 2010 she became a member of GDMPC and now applies for a micro-finance loan at GDMPC for 7,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Rosalinda also wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Morena works hard to support her family.

She has a banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and buying and selling charcoal. Morena is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional stock of bananas to sell for her banana business.

Morena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael es vendedor ambulante de muchas clases de productos, este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y cuenta que gracias a su crédito anterior pude surtirse bien y cumplir con sus clientes, ya que tenia pedidos. Esta muy agradecido, ya que esta saliendo adelante.
Hoy solicita nuevamente otro crédito para la compra de zapatos, prendas, sabanas, edredones y demás, para que así pueda seguir con sus ventas y dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ismael is a street vendor of many products.  This is his second loan with Kiva and he says that thanks to the previous loan he managed to supply himself well and fulfill his customers' orders.  He's very grateful because he's getting ahead.

Today he's requesting another loan to buy shoes, clothing, sheets, quilts, and other merchandise so he can continue selling and giving his customers a good selection.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, sheets, quilts, and other merchandise

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 30 years old and married with two children.

Mildred works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods and noodles.

Mildred has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Mildred aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 30 years old and married with two children. She lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a garden to plant and harvest vegetables for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for gardening. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for gardening.

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ariunbold, 28 years old, lives with his parents, two siblings and half nephew in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His father has a disability and gets disability pension from the state. His mother has retired from work and gets state pension. His elder brother works as a salesman at a store and his younger brother studies at high school. His brother’s three-year-old daughter also lives with them. 

The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair and expansion. Because his siblings have all reached adult age and everyone has been creating their own family, the house needs more space to accommodate them all. Ariunbold is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiber glass, bricks, cements and planks for building an extension and repairing damaged components of the house, as well as installing a floor heating system into the house. As a result, this extended family can live in a comfortable and warm place.  More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his aged parents.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and install a floor heating system

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 47 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres, a quienes ama y dedica sus cuidados, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Rosa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bisutería, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella realiza sus ventas recorriendo las diversas calles de su ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, Rosa cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor variedad de bisutería, como aretes, collares, pulseras, etc,. De esta manera Rosa tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 47, is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents, whom she loves and takes care of.  She's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately Rosa wasn't able to study for a professional career because she lacked the resources and needed to work from a young age.  In her free time she likes to make a delicious ceviche to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Rosa works in her small business selling costume jewelry.  She works approximately eight hours every day.  She sells her products throughout the different streets in her city.  Rosa believes it's going well for her because of her good prices and friendly customer service.

Rosa's very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy a variety of jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, etc.  this way Rosa will better stock her business and be able to continue working and making the effort to achieve her big dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional flour, sugar, cheese and other ingredients for her bakery business.

Myrna has been in this business for five years. Myrna earns more income from a general store.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional flour, sugar, cheese and other ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is 50 years old and single. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting papaya to earn a living. He has been in his business for over 10 years and earn 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase chemicals supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase chemical supplies for papaya production.

loans.name: Dania Veronica

texts.es:
Dania es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para ayudar a su familia, Dania no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en su ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Dania trabaja en su pequeño negocio donde brinda servicios de impresiones y también vende sellos, Dania trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y facilidades de pago que brinda a sus clientes.
Dania se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus trabajos de impresiones y otros relacionados a su labor, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Dania is a 21-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings.  She loves her family and they mean the world to her.  Dania is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve herself.  Unfortunately, owing to a lack of financial resources and the need to work in order to help her family, Dania was unable to study for a degree in Business Administration as she wanted to.  In her free time, she enjoys listening to music and also sometimes cooks delicious 'tallarines rojos' (red spaghetti) to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and determination, Dania set up her own small business providing a printing service.  She also sells stamps.  Dania works every day, from early in the morning, and works for approximately 10 hours.  She believes that her business is doing well owing to her good prices and the payment terms she offers her customers.

Dania is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a computer which will help her a lot in her printing work and other related tasks.  This will enable her to continue working hard and achieve her dream of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 64 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school. 

Nora is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Nora requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur is 37 years old and married with one child. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over six years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and he has requested a loan of 8,500 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Nursuita

texts.en:
Nursuita is 37 years old, married and has three children who are in school. 

Nursuita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nursuita requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nursuita has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nursuita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is 58 years old and married with four children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle for transport to earn a living. He has been in his business for over eight years and earns 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Emercinda

texts.es: Emercinda, de 47 años, es madre soltera ; pues cuidó sola de sus 2 hijos: Ronal y Franklin , actualmente vive sola en la casa que heredó hace 26 años. Emercinda se dedica a la agricultura y la razón del trabajo arduo que realiza, son sus hijos ,pues ellos realizan sus estudios universitarios en la ciudad de Lima, a donde tiene que mandar una pensión mensual para sus gastos. Todo esto la motiva para continuar su labor diaria , en sus terrenos en donde siembra papa, alverja y maíz, vende sus cosechas integras al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde le pagan un buen precio,además cuida de animales menores como: cerdos, carneros y cuyes, los cuales después de engordarlos los comercializa a los carniceros que llegan a su casa, obteniendo así mejores ganancias. Para el futuro desea continuar con la siembra, pero en mayores cantidades y de buena calidad. Emercinda, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
47-year old Emercinda is a single mother who brought up two children, Ronal and Franklin, by herself. She now lives alone in the house she inherited 26 years ago. She is a farmer and works very hard so that she can support her sons who are at university in Lima. Every month she has to send them money for their expenses. This is the reason she works hard every day.

In her fields Emercinda grows potatoes, peas, and corn. All her harvest is sold in the wholesale market in the town of Tarma where she gets a good price. She also raises animals such as pigs, sheep, and guinea pigs. After they are fattened, she sells them to the butchers who come to her house and in this way earns more money.

As for the future, Emercinda wants to continue farming and increase production of good quality produce. With the S/. 1000 loan she will buy organic fertilizer to spread on her fields.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 59 years old and married.

Purita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Purita requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Purita has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Purita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, can goods, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 52 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.  

Remegia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  Remegia has been raising pigs for 10 years, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Remegia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Neris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Neris tiene 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella lleva nueve años trabajando como operaria en una atunera. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cambiar las paredes de su casa por unas de lámina, para cuando llueva no se moje su casa. Al mejorar su vivienda protegerá a su familia de las inclemencias del tiempo, como lluvia, frío y sol.
texts.en:
Neris, 28, has one child.  She has worked on a tuna boat for nine years.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to change the walls of her house to metal sheeting so her house doesn't get wet when it rains.

By improving her home she'll protect her family from harsh weather such as the rain, cold, and heat.

loans.use: to change the walls of her house to metal sheeting

loans.name: Edith Orbelina

texts.es:
Edith tiene 29 años de edad. Tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a realizar trabajos agrícolas; fue su padre quien le enseño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para preparar el terreno para sembrar maíz. Así, podrá cultivar en mayores cantidades y venderlas después para obtener mejores ingresos y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Edith, 29, has been doing agricultural labor for more than 10 years.  It was her father who taught her.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to prepare the land to plant corn.

This way she'll be able to grow larger quantities and sell the crop to have a better income and continue working.

loans.use: to prepare the land to plant corn

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 40 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Riza has been farming vegetables for six years, and also earns additional income from fishing.

Riza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Duo Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
CRISTO REY

Este dúo está integrado por las señoras Ingrid e Irma, son originarias de Sumpango, Sac ambas son madres de familia y además cada una tiene un negocio distinto este es el segundo crédito que están solicitando y pagado muy bien en cada cuota, este crédito lo necesitan para poder invertir en tejidos y en compra de telas  ya que siempre tienen varios pedidos. Además agradecen la ayuda de kiva pues les ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia por lo que prometen pagar puntualmente en cada cuota.
texts.en:
Sras. Ingrid and Irma are the two members of the Cristo Rey group. They are from Sumpango, Sacatepequez. Both are mothers and have separate businesses. This is their second loan. They paid off their first one very well. They need this loan to invest in their weaving businesses; they wish to buy yarn since they always have orders to fulfill. 

Ingrid and Irma are grateful for Kiva’s help which has helped their families to get ahead. They promise to make the repayments punctually.

loans.use: buy yarn

loans.name: Ruby Ana

texts.en:
Ruby Ana is 26 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby Ana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, milk, etc.

Ruby Ana has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ruby Ana would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, milk, etc.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Adan no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Tallarín Rojo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Adan se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene un pequeño cultivo de cacao, el cual con ayuda de su esposa dedican diversas labores de campo, Adan trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia  y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Adan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del mantenimiento, abono y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Adan podrá lograr que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente y logre una buena venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cosechas y la variedad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Adan is a 32-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and their two children, who he loves and who are his main reason for living.
