He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who along with this wife dedicate all their efforts to getting their family ahead.  Unfortunately Adan was not able to study the professional career of automobile mechanic but he would very much have liked to have been able to do so.  In his free time he likes to cook a very delicious “Tallarín Rojo” (noodles with red sauce) to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with a lot of determination and dedication, Adan works in agriculture.  He has a small crop of cacao and with the help of his wife they work at different tasks on the farm.  Adan works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that it is going well for him because of his experience and because of the kind treatment that he gives to others.

Adan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help provided he will be able to cover maintenance costs, fertilizer and the harvest of his crop.  In this way Adan will be able to get his crops to develop suitably and attain a good sale.  Thus he will continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of expanding his harvests and the variety of his crops.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs, fertilizer and the harvest of his crop.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
El Sr. Joel tiene 32 años, vive en pareja actualmente y no tiene hijos. Se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) hace varios años. Aparte de esta actividad también es docente. Sus ventas las realizan los fines de semana y con estos trabajos ayuda a su pareja.
Joel cuenta que sus ventas las hace por las ciudades como: Asunción, Capiatá e Itauguá en dichas ciudades lleva ropas, calzados, sobrecamas, hamacas, etc. Y las vende. El se define como una persona que desea Salir adelante y crecer.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ropas, calzados, sobrecamas, hamacas ya que está teniendo muy buenas ventas y tiene varios pedidos que cubrir.
texts.en:
Joel is 32 years old, currently lives together with a partner and doesn’t have children.  He has worked as a street vendor for several years.  Aside from this activity he is also a teacher.  His sales are carried out on the weekends and with these jobs he helps his partner. 

Joel says that he makes his sales around the cities of Asunción, Capiatá and Itauguá.  He takes clothes, shoes, bedspreads, hammocks, etc. to these cities and sells them.  He is defined as a person who wants to get ahead and grow.

The requested loan is for the purchase of clothes, shoes, bedspreads and hammocks as he is having very good sales and has several orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bedspreads and hammocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew her working capital and buy food products (cassava flour, potatoes) for resale to continue to earn a living.

loans.name: Duo Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
DUO  VISTA HERMOSA


LA SEÑORA DELFINA DE 34 AÑOS DE EDAD Y ALBERTINA DE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVEN EN PATZUN CHIMALTENANGO  SON HERMANAS  CADA UNA DE ELLAS YA CON SU FAMILIA  , PERO SE DEDICAN  AL NEGOCIO LES GUSTA TRABAJAR  LUCHAR POR SU FAMILIA  YA POR TRES AÑOS  HAN SOLICITADO CREDITO A FAPE  Y ESO LES HA AYUDADO  MUCHO YAQUE  CADA VEZ  QUE SE LES OTORGA SU CREDITO  ELLAS INVIERTEN EN SU NEGOCIO QUE ES TIENDA DE TRAJES TIPICOS  TIENDA DE ARTICULOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO. Y MUCHAS COSITAS MAS .
SUS  SUEÑOS ES DARLE LO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS QUE ELLOS CRESCAN DARLE ESTUDIO  PARA QUE CUANDO SEAN GRANDES  TENGAN OPORTUNIDADES DE SALIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Vista Hermosa Group.

Delfina is 34 years old and Albertina is 35.  They both live in Patzun, Chimaltenango.  They are sisters and each has her own family.  They both run a business as they enjoy working and strive to support their families.  They have been taking out loans with FAPE for three years and these loans have helped them a lot.  Every time they receive a loan they invest it their business: a store selling traditional clothing, groceries and many other products. 

Delfina and Albertina aim to provide their children with the best in life.  They want them to receive an education so that they will have more opportunities to make progress in life when they are adults.

loans.use: to buy clothing and basic household goods

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhtuya, 53 years old, lives with her son's family in the Kherlen district of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her son has been working at the train station since 2010 and was recently promoted to chief worker. She herself has retired from work and gets a monthly state pension. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years, and the roof, particularly, needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as fiberglass, bricks, plates, and planks. After repairing the roof and other parts of the house, the family will be able to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. More importantly, the children and the borrower, who is very old, can live in a warm and comfortable place, not chilled down to their cores in the harsh Mongolian winter climate.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and building materials

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita is 59 years old and married, with 6 children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconuts in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for the coconut farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for the coconut farm

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Erlinda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been pig-fattening for 10 years. She earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila manages a school canteen and her home-based store.She has also engaged herself in farming and hog-raising. Prescila is a widow and has four adult children.

Prescila would like to take out for a loan of PHP 40,000 allows her to buy stock of merchandise such as assorted biscuits, snacks, candies, soft drinks and ingredients for her school canteen and home-based store business .She hopes that through this loan amount she can further improve her business, enabling her to earn greater income, educate her grandchildren and improve her way of life.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise such as assorted biscuits, snacks, candies, soft drinks and ingredients for her school canteen and home-based store business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 34 years old and is married. Wilma has two children who are both in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business.

Wilma has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
Gemmalyn offers various kinds of fruits inside the public market of Cordon. She is married to a photographer, and they have been blessed with three children. Two of her children are still studying, while her youngest is still an infant.

Gemmalyn has been managing her fruit vending business for more than five years. According to her, she earns about PHP 3,000 a month. Income gained from her business goes toward their daily necessities, and allowances for her children. She is thankful because through her patience and hard work, she is able to cover their household expenses. Gemmalyn would like to keep her fruit vending business progressive, so she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy boxes of fruits such as apples, lanzones, oranges, and grapes for her fruit vending business. She hopes to get this loan amount in order to send her children on to a higher level of education and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fruits, such as apples, lanzones, oranges, and grapes for her fruit vending business

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantuya is 45 years old, and she lives with her husband and three children in an apartment in Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Erdenjav, age 48, works at a local mining company. Her son Batbileg, age 23, is a university student, while her daughter Bolortuya, age 18, and son Monhbold, age 6, go to local schools. 

Mrs. Narantuya has been working as a saleswoman since 2001. She has gained a lot of experience and many regular customers. She is now starting her own clothing sales business in a rental counter, and she is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her clothing sales business. She is a hardworking, well-experienced and honest woman who says, "Next year my two children will be university students and I need to save for their tuition from now on."

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Yolanda earns more income from dress making. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, bread, shampoo, sugar, etc. for her general store business. Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, bread, shampoo, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en: Celerina is 45 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. Celerina owns and operates a food selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as pork, beef, chicken and drinks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as pork, beef, chicken and drinks

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lerma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Lerma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, spices, soft drinks, can goods, etc. to sell at her general store business.

Teresita has been in this business for 3 years. Teresita earns more income from the retail of gasoline and the buying and selling of charcoal.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, spices, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamjav is 42 years old and lives with his wife and 4 daughters in a ger in the Ih toiruu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Tungalag, age 42, helps her husband to run their small grocery store. His daughters Densmaa, age 18, Nansalmaa, age 16, Namuunbileg, age 14 and Nomingoo, age 3 go to local schools and kindergarten. 

Mr. Nyamjav has been running his grocery store with his wife since 2007. He has gained lot of experience in business and built a close relationship with suppliers over the years. He is now planning to create an organic vegetables section in his store and is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of organic vegetables to sell in his store to local customers. He is hardworking, friendly and a positive man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Jumabek

texts.ru: Жумабеку 28 лет. Он женат и у него двое маленьких детей. Жумабек со своей семьей живет в районе Вахш. Он занимается земледелием и в основном выращивает арбуз. Так как сейчас сезон посева, Жумабек обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит для приобретения семян арбуза и минеральных удобрений. Он надеется получить богатый урожай. В будущем Жумабек хочет создать свое дехканское хозяйство. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане.
texts.en: Jumabek is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. He and his family live in the Vakhsh region. He grows crops for a living, in particular watermelon. As it is now sowing season, Jumabek is seeking a loan so he can purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer. He is hoping for a very plentiful harvest. In the future, he wants to establish his own "dekhkan" farm, an agricultural system unique to Tajikistan whereby small individual or collective private farms are set up to be worked by a few people, and where the main crops grown are cotton, wheat, or vegetables, which account for 60% of irrigated land use in the country.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ochiroo

texts.en: Mr.Ochiroo is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger (or traditional Mongolian tent) in Uvs province. His wife Enhtuya works at home as a cobbler. His daughters Anuhatan, age 5, and Manduuhai, age 3, go to a local kindergarten. The borrower and his wife have been working for a private shoemaker for years while they also run a cobbler service at home. His wife quit recently to go into business on her own as a shoemaker. Mr. Ochiroo is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 MNT to buy a large amount of leather and other items to run their business. He and his wife are both hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of leather and other items to run his business.

loans.name: Sara Cecilia

texts.es:
Sara, decide solicitar un nuevo préstamo por la facilidad de pago y porque le genera producción en la siembra de hortalizas. Le servirá para comprar semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas, insecticidas y así poder sembrar pipianera.
Con el crédito anterior el efecto que tuvo fue mínimo, porque le genero problemas la seca de agua que impacto al país. Las circunstancias cambiaron en la familia, espera que la esta producción de pipián sea mejor.
texts.en:
Sara decided to request a new loan in order to make it easier to pay for things needed when planting and producing vegetables. She will use the money to buy seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides so that she can plant pipian.

Her previous loan had minimal impact because of the overall impact of drought throughout the country. These circumstances changed her family, so she hopes that this production of pipian will be better.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: John Rey

texts.en: John Rey is 30 years old, married and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transportation business which serves people in the local community. He has been in his business for more than five years and earns 17,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP to repair his vehicle so that he can provide better service. His goal for the future is to expand his business.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 57 años es una mujer trabajadora. Enviudó hace 8 años, tubo 6 hijos, pero ahora solo vive con su hijo Antony y su nieta Adriana, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 38 años. 
Desde hace 5 años emprendió el negocio de crianza de cerdos, posee 10 ejemplares todos robustos y de buena raza, “Los crío en campo abierto como son grandes no los puedo tener en mi casa, además de esa manera crecen más sanos y robustos”, afirma. Cuando tiene gordos a sus animales los comercializa en carne o vivos, “todo depende de los clientes”, menciona Doña Marcelina. Asimismo desea construir un espacio más acogedor para sus animales por lo que ya está pensando en mejorar el establo. Ahora desea engordar numerosos ejemplares, pues ya tiene pedidos para la festividad del día de la madre.
Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero ya que podrá lograr sus objetivos, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Marcelina, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus cerdos.
texts.en:
57-year-old Marcelina is a hard-working woman.  She became a widow eight years ago and has six children.  She currently lives with her son Antony and her granddaughter Adriana who she cares for in the house that she bought 38 years ago.

Five years ago, Marcelina set up a business raising pigs.  She has 10 animals which are all healthy and a good breed.  "I raise them in the open fields.  I can't raise them at home because they are too large.  Anyway, they grow healthier and stronger that way", she says.  When Marcelina's animals have grown, she sells them either alive or as meat: "It all depends on the customer", she says.  Marcelina would like to create a better space for her animals and so she is planning to improve her barn.  She would like to fatten a number of animals as she already has orders for Mothers' Day.

This is Marcelina's first loan from Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support as it will enable her to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  Marcelina will invest the 1,000 soles she has requested in buying nutritionally-balanced feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced pig feed

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 54 años de edad ,vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo Eduardo en la casa que compraron hace 10 años. Su esposo es contador de profesión, juntos abrieron un estudio contable, donde brinda sus servicios , a pesar de no haber estudiado para el ejercicio, sabe mucho del tema, pues ayuda a su esposo en lo que pueda pero Nancy se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio y productos de librería, en un espacio que acondicionaron al costado de la tienda. Ya tiene 16 años dedicándose a ello, no cuenta con un lugar propio, pues alquila la oficina y tienda, que se encuentran en un lugar céntrico y estratégico para poder desarrollar su negocio en todo este tiempo. Además de confiar en su hijo, quien quiere estudiar la misma carrera de su padre, como es una mujer empeñosa y muy segura de sí misma, sabe que podrá trabajar y orientar a su hijo a estudiar una carrera profesional que le ayude en el futuro . Nancy invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de productos para su librería tales como hojas bond, cuadernos , lapiceros , entre otros ya que desea tener lo necesario para sus clientes .
texts.en:
Nancy, 54, lives together with her husband and her son Eduardo in a house they bought ten years ago. Her husband works as an accountant. They both opened an office offering accounting services, and even if she did not study accounting, she knows a lot about it and helps her husband as much as she can.

Nancy sells office supplies and stationery in a space they set up next to the office. She has been doing this for sixteen years now, renting a space in a central and strategic location. Nancy trusts her son, who wants to follow his father’s steps. Since she is a hardworking and confident woman, she knows that she will be able to work and influence her son to make a good decision for his future.

Nancy will invest the 2000 soles [PEN] in buying stationery items, such as paper sheets, notebooks, pens and other supplies in order to have what her customers need.

loans.use: to buy stationery items such as paper sheets, pens and notebooks.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: DON FREDY ES ORIGINARIO DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE Y ES PROPIETARIO DE UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO EL CUAL ES MUY FRECUNTADO POR SUS VECINOS Y MUCHOS NIÑOS YA QUE ESTA UBICADA EN CERCANIA DE UNA ESCUELA. DON FREDY  ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE. EL SUEÑO DE DON FREDY ES SURTIR MAS SU TIENDA PARA PODER OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES PRODUCTOS SURTIDOS Y DE BUENA CALIDAD. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE AZUCAR, JUGOS GASEOSAS Y PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECECIDAD
texts.en:
Don Fredy is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. He is the owner of a general store that is frequented by his neighbors and several children who attend a school nearby. Don Fredy is a friendly individual. His dream is to restock his store with more products so that he can offer his customers available items that are of good quality.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy sugar, juices, sodas, and basic necessity products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, juices, sodas, and basic necessity products.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, solicita un crédito por la necesidad de surtir más la tienda con productos nuevos, agregar más pedidos por la temporada. Este le permitirá comprar más  galletas, pan, gaseosas y otro tipo de bebidas, productos de la canasta básica.
El préstamo anterior le permitió  realizar compras de los productos necesarios para la tienda y aportar para su familia. Las condiciones del hogar han mejorado y su deseo es comprar su casa para que puedan tener una mejor estabilidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
María is requesting a loan because she needs to add new products to the inventory of her store, thus generating more orders this season. The money will allow her to buy more cookies, bread, sodas, other types of beverages, and basic household products.

Her previous loan enabled her to buy necessary products for her store so that she could provide for her family. The conditions of her home have improved and her wish is to buy a house so that they will have better stability.

loans.use: to buy more cookies, bread, sodas, other types of beverages, and basic household products.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Cristo Rey está en su ciclo número tres del programa de comité donde todas se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Ellas tienen gran esperanza de mejorar sus vidas es por eso que se unieron para mejorar.
Dominga es una de las miembros, quien con mucho esfuerzo ayuda a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de harina de maíz que ella misma procesa, es un trabajo duro, pero lo hace con mucho entusiasmo ya que mediante eso su familia tiene un sustento.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de maíz, para poder procesarlo y seguir con sus ventas. Ella es una persona con muchas ansias de crecer y lo demuestra día a día.
texts.en:
The communal bank Cristo Rey is in its third loan cycle with the program, and its members are striving to get ahead. The women have great hopes of improving their lives and have come together to reach this goal. 

Dominga, one of the members, works hard to help her family. She sells corn flour that she produces, a difficult job, but one she does enthusiastically because it provides income for her family. She has applied for a loan to buy corn to process and sell. She wants to grow and shows it day after day.

loans.use: to buy whole corn to make corn flour to sell.

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умеду 29 лет. Он женатый человек. Умед живет в районе Вахш. Умед в течение трех лет работал экономистом. Последние 5 лет он занимается животноводством. Он покупает крупнорогатый скот, откармливает его несколько месяцев и затем продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль Умед запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Umed is 29 years old and married. He lives in the Vakhsh region. For the past 3 years, he has been working as an economist, and for the last 5 years, he has been raising cattle. He buys livestock, fattens them for a few months, then sells them for a profit at the cattle market. Umed is seeking a loan so he can expand his business and earn a good profit through the purchase and sale of more cattle.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Sumber Kelapa Group

texts.en: The members of the Sumber Kelapa group are requesting a loan to buy supplies for their various businesses. Some will also use a portion of the loan to buy merchandise to sell in their small kiosks. Hasunah, who leads the group, will use her portion to buy raw materials such as wood and coconut shells.  She hopes she can finish her craft orders on time and that she can use her profits to renovate her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Erdenetuul

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenetuul is 40 years old, supporting her two daughters in the Govi-altai province of Mongolia. Her daughters, Oyuntogm (age 16) and Demberel (age 15) go to the local secondary school. Mrs. Erdenetuul has been running a tailoring service at her home since 2007. She has built close relationships with her regular customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory. She is a hardworking, strong woman who says, "My daughters will soon be university students and I have tuition fees to pay in the near future, so I need to work even harder."

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Eufrosina

texts.es: Eufrosina tiene 65 años de edad y habita de  Arjona un municipio del departamento de Bolívar, donde tiene el negocio de alquilar motocicletas, actividad que hace 5 años inició, cuando observó que se incrementaron el número de estos vehículos en esta población. Sus principales clientes son los propietarios de motocicletas que ofrecen el servicio de transporte en Arjona, a quienes   les ofrece el servicio de lavado y engrase desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. En la actualidad ha recibido 1 financiamiento  de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual logró incrementar el número de sus clientes y hoy quieren comprar 2 lavadoras más; pero como  su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para cubrir esta expectativa, está aplicando a un crédikiva, mediante el cual  comprará los equipos de trabajos que   requiere, pues su meta es continuar incrementando sus ingresos y ordenar sus cuentas para controlar efectivamente su negocio.  Eufrosina cuenta con 2 trabajadores que lavan las motocicletas y ganan el 50% de la utilidad que se produce diariamente.
texts.en:
Eufrosina, 65, lives in Arjona, a city in Bolívar department, where she runs a motorcycle rental service. She started the business five years ago when she noticed that the numbers of motorcycles in the area had increased. Her main clients are motorcycle owners who offer transport service in Arjona. She offers them wash and wax service form 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. 

She previously received a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which helped her increase her client base. She now wants to buy two more washing machines, but she lacks the capital to do so. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy the equipment she needs to meet her goal to increase her income, to balance the accounts, and to effectively manage the business. Eufrosina employs two people to wash the motorcycles, and they earn 50% of the profit they produce daily.

loans.use: to buy two motorcycle washers.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 60, a widow, and lives in Silang, Cavite Philippines. She earns a living by running a transportation business. She rents her vehicle to drivers who use it to carry up to four passengers at a time, and then share their earnings with her. She makes a minimum of PHP 500 every day. She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her income from the loan. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
This is Merla. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business, but even in her family. She was able to buy all the needed products for her grocery store. She has been in this business for five years. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merla dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes that her children will all have a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. At these meetings she also draws strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Islomidin

texts.ru: Исломидин житель района А.Джоми. Ему 58 лет. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Его сыновья находятся на заработках за пределами страны. У Исломидина среднее техническое образование. Он работал шофером в течение 20 лет. Одновременно все эти годы он занимался животноводством. Сейчас Исломидин запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота. За счет прибыли он хочет отремонтировать свою машину.
texts.en: Islomidin lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 58 years old, married, and has 4 children. His sons are migrant workers in a foreign country. Islomidin has a vocational high school education. He worked as a driver for 20 years, and during all those years, he also raised livestock. He is now seeking a loan for the purchase and sale of cattle. He wants to use the profit generated by this loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
This is Dante. He previously took a 19,000 PHP loan to purchase larger amounts and a greater variety of the grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help towards their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Dante would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Dante dreams that his variety store will be a grocery store. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week. At these meetings he draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Tsagaanhuu

texts.en: Mrs.Tsagaanhuu is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Borgih, helped his wife to start her own butcher shop. Her sons, Batbold, age 17 and Battuvshin, age 7, go to local schools. Mrs.Tsagaanhuu worked in South Korea until 2010 with her husband as a contract worker. She has run a small grocery store, and ran an animal pelt and meat trading business from 1994 to 2008. She has a lot of experience in business. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat products for her butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat products for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy good-quality pants to sell in rural areas.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La Señora Magda es de la Ciudad de Concepción en donde tiene su negocio, ella es comerciante hace 4 años  cuenta con clientes tanto  en la ciudad de Concepción y alrededores, también cuenta con ventas de ropas, mercería ,comestibles ,y tiene el servicio de maxi y mini carga como ventas de tarjetas y demás accesorios de celulares entre otros, comenzó con venta de comestibles donde con el día a día fue cargando su local en donde hoy cuenta con buena cantidad de productos para su venta 
Desea que con el tiempo pueda llegar a cumplir su sueño de ser dueña de una casa comercial en donde pueda vender variedades de cosas  por lo que trabaja duro 
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas y tarjetas para poder reponer lo que ya vendió. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Magda lives in Concepción, where she has a business. She has been a merchant for four years and has clients in Concepción and the surrounding areas. She sells clothing, notions, food items, and prepaid cellular cards and accessories. She began by selling food and gradually added more stock, and today she offers a broad selection.

She is working hard to achieve her dream of owning a larger store where she could sell a variety of things. She has applied for a loan to buy clothing and cards to replenish her inventory. She is a hardworking, enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cards to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothes and sweaters for a thread-making business

loans.name: Khujaqul

texts.ru: Хучакул житель района Шахритус, расположенный в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Ему 42 года. У него жена и трое детей. Один его сын работает за пределами страны. Сам Хучакул вместе с женой работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане. Сейчас Хучакул хочет начать свой бизнес и для этого выбрал животноводство, так как это прибыльное дело и не требует тяжелой работы. С этой целью Хучакул запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Khujaqul lives in the Shahrituz region in the south-western part of Tajikistan. He is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. One of his sons is currently working abroad. Khujaqul and his wife work in the "dekhkan" farming sector, which is an agricultural system unique to Tajikistan whereby small individual or collective private farms are set up to be worked by a few people, and where the main crops grown are cotton, wheat, or vegetables, accounting for 60% of irrigated land use in the country. Now Khujaqul wants to start his own business in the area of animal husbandry because this field is profitable and does not require a great deal of physical labour. With this aim in mind, he is now seeking a loan for the purchase and sale of cattle.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beads, thread, etc. for decorative embroidery business.

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
This is Hermosa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the gardening materials that she needed, thus generating more income. She has been in this business for six years. As a single woman, she works hard for her daily needs and to help her relatives as well.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets, seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Hermosa dreams that her business will expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
This is Maria Theresa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed gardening materials for her garden and she was able to help her family as well. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets, seeds and fertilizer. Her profits will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Theresa dreams that her business will continue to grow and expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Iijuu

texts.en: Mr. Iijuu, 57 years old, lives with his family in the Kherlen district of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been providing taxi service to the local people and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. As both he and his wife have reached retirement age, they decided to plant vegetables on their land as a food source. In order to grow vegetables, he needs 1,000,000 MNT. He is requesting the money to purchase a large quantity of potato seeds. As a result, he will be able to harvest his potatoes in autumn and sell them later to potato brokers in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with six children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell at her store.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Merdeka Utara 2 Group

texts.en:
Tanisem has two children, both of whom are school-age. She is married to a brick layer with an uncertain income. In order to supplement her husband's income, she produces various kinds of cake and fried snacks. Every morning, she starts making cakes at 1 AM until midday. She then sells her products in the nearby market. She is skillful in producing various kinds of traditional cakes. Tanisem will use this loan to buy ingredients (eggs, flour, butter, sugar) for her cakes and fried snacks. The additional income from the business will be spent on her children's school fees and also to pay their rent. She already has her own customers so competition is not a challenge for her; however, the seasonal floods are. Since she lives in a densely populated area near the river bank, floods might come 3-4 times a year.

Her goal is to be able to send her son to the maritime academy.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo raises hogs in his village. He raises three sows and grows rice. Romeo has been raising hogs for ten years and growing rice for 15.

Romeo is married and blessed with three children. He aims to make his hog business profitable and become a successful entreprenuer someday. In this way, he could educate his children, cover all their household expenses and improve his living conditions. For him to attain his goal in life, he is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to make his hogs healthier. Romeo will use his loan to buy hog feed and essential vitamins. By raising his hogs with the necessary livestock supplies, he hopes to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for his livestock business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 23 años esta casada con Edner, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Wilian y Franco; a los cuida con mucho amor en la casa que compraron hace 6 años. Hace 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de alverja, papa y habas, los cuales siembra en sus terrenos propios en la localidad más cercana a su hogar, pero en campañas agrícolas alquila algunas tierras para poder tener mayor producción. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar sus cosechas en los mercados de su pueblo en donde consigue buenos compradores. Además de ver crecer sus sembríos, ya que es un pronóstico de buena cosecha. Dentro de pocos meses comenzará la recolección de alverja, por lo que está pensando sembrar papa para obtener cosechas consecutivas para cada temporada agrícola. Este es el cuarto préstamo con KIVA, por ello promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Nancy, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Nancy, 23, is married to Edner, with whom she has two children, Wilian and Franco.  She lovingly takes care of them in the house they bought six years ago.

She has earned her living in agriculture for five years.  Her main crops are peas, potatoes, and beans, which she plants on her own plots of land in the town closest to her home.  She rents some land during the planting season, though, so she can have a bigger crop.

What she likes most about her job is being able to sell her harvests in her town markets, where she gets good buyers.  She also likes to see her fields grow because it's a sign of a good harvest.

In a few months she'll begin to harvest the peas, so she's thinking about planting potatoes to get good consecutive crops in each farming season.  This is her fourth Kiva loan and she promises to be punctual with her payments.

Nancy will invest the 1000 soles [PEN] in organic fertilizer to spread on her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, 46, manages a cacao farm with his wife Rosa and children in the beautiful village of Pueblo Viejo. The village is located in the southernmost part of Toledo district in the country of Belize, with no access to electricity and alongside an under way highway to Guatemala. The couple has raised nine children, six of whom currently live in. 

Thomas started his cacao farming with the assistance of a local association. He manages a farm with 400 productive cacao trees, and 300 newly planted seedlings – cacao trees raised in a bag before transplanting. Besides cacao, the family cultivates the traditional Maya package of corn, beans and rice for home use and extra income. Cacao is his favorite crop, says Thomas, because it is both a cash crop and a staple at home. Most Mayan families use some of their cacao for making cacao drink – stone ground beans that are mixed with water and used as an alternative to coffee. 

The family puts a lot of focus on their children’s education. Four of the kids are currently enrolled in either primary or secondary school. Farming alone hasn’t been sufficient to pay school fees, so Thomas has been doing jobs in construction and security to offset the cost. In the future, Thomas hopes to expand his farm to grow it for the future generations in the family. 

The family is requesting this loan to hire help with cleaning the 300 newly planted trees. Cleaning plays an important role in the cacao industry, as “if you don’t clean, you can’t get nothing from that tree. If it’s not clean, it won’t bear, “ Thomas told Maya Mountain Cacao in perfect English, his second language after Maya Mopan. Newly planted seedlings need space and sunlight to grow and prosper, and therefore require extra diligent care. The job at hand will require and create 12 days worth of work in the community.

loans.use: To clean around newly planted cacao trees.

loans.name: Leamor

texts.en:
Leamor is 36 years old and lives in Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Angelo, a worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leamor operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling retail. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Leamor hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Akadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme ALIZETA est responsable du groupe AKADI. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans et le moins âgés à 16 ans. Deux (02) vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend du jus et de l’eau fraiche depuis plus d’une année. Elle s’approvisionne aux marchés de son secteur. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de sucre, 01 sac de petit mil, 01 sac bissaps.
 Elle veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne acheter une moto et mieux scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. ALIZETA is the official of the group AKADI. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 24 years old, and the youngest is 16. Two go to school. She has five persons to support. 

Ms. ALIZETA has been selling juices and cold water for over a year. She gets her supplies at the markets in her sector. Her customers are the inhabitants of her district. 

She wants to purchase a bag of sugar, a bag of pearl millet, and a bag of bissaps (dried hibiscus flowers). 

She wants to bolster her business with her profits. Her ambition is to purchase a motorbike and to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase suga, pearl millet, and bissap

loans.name: Saidboi

texts.ru: Саидбой житель района Шахритус, расположенный в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Ему 42 года. У него жена и пятеро детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане. Сам Саидбой занимается земледелием. Однако сейчас Саидбой намерен начать новый бизнес. Его интересует животноводческая деятельность, так как это прибыльное дело и не требует тяжелой работы. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Saidboi lives in the Shahrituz region in the southwest of Tajikistan. He is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife works on a “dekhan farm.” The term “dekhan farm” means a small individual or collective private farm employing a small number of people; mainly, such farms produce cotton, wheat or vegetables (which take up 60% of arable land in Tajikistan). Saidboi is a produce farmer, but he plans to launch a new business. He is interested in raising livestock as this line of business is profitable and not physically demanding. With this goal in mind, he is requesting a loan to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy catte for resale.

loans.name: Roxana Cristel

texts.es:
Roxana, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita comprar más pollos de engorde, concentrado, vitaminas,  insumos agrícolas, abonos, herbicidas, insecticidas y preparar la tierra para la siembra.
El crédito anterior le permitió comprar pollos los cuales ya vendió; además ha comprado más desde esa fecha, ya que su deseo radica en la ampliar su granja. La familia se ha mantenido, sus ingresos han mejorado.
texts.en:
Roxana is requesting a new loan because she needs to buy chickens for fattening, as well as concentrated feed and vitamins. She will also buy farming supplies, compost, herbicides, and insecticides so that she can prepare her land for planting.

Her previous loan allowed her to buy chickens, which have already been sold. She has bought more since then since she wishes to expand her farm. Her family remains steady and her income has improved.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening, concentrated feed, vitamins, farming supplies, compost, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Hendra

texts.en:
Hendra runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur and has three persons living in his house. 

Hendra joined Ruma five months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He still feels really excited to expand his business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, Hendra has had around $40/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Rusmaria

texts.en:
Rusmaria runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. She is a housewife and has four people living in her house. 

Rusmaria has already been with Ruma for almost two years because she wants to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers.

For the last three months, Rusmaria has had around $100/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, she needs more working capital loan in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a business, making and selling native mats, in the Philippines.

Helen successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her mat-making business. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan funds to purchase materials for making mats, for her business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making mats

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Primavera está en su ciclo número 3º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Rosa es parte de este grupo, quien se dedica al reciclaje de todo tipo de materiales, como ser cartones, aluminio, papeles y demás. Ella comenta que todos los días sale desde muy tempranas horas a recolectar estos artículos. Ella los recolecta y los revende, y a veces compra dichos materiales y los revende en cantidad y así tiene mejores ingresos. Es una persona muy sacrificada que se esfuerza mucho por dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de aluminio, cartones, papeles y demás insumos para poder revenderlos y de esa forma poder tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
The group called Primavera is in its third cycle with the women's committee program. Each of its members is very eager to get ahead and help out her family.

Rosa belongs to this group and works recycling all kinds of materials, such as carboard, aluminum, paper, and others. She says she goes out very early each day to collect these items. She collects them and resells them, and sometimes she purchases these materials and resells them in bulk in order to obtain higher earnings. She is a very selfless person and works very hard to give her family what they need.

She is requesting this loan to purchase aluminum, cardboard, paper, and other supplies in order to resell them so that she can have a greater profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum, cardboard, paper, and other supplies.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana de 25 años de edad, habita de  Arjona un municipio del departamento de Bolívar, donde tiene una peluquería y desde ella ofrece servicios de corte, peinado tratamientos capilares de salud y de belleza, además de  comercializar productos para mejorar la imagen  de sus clientes. Su negocio inició hace 3 años, cuando al terminar de estudiar salud y belleza, sus padres la apoyaron para que emprendiera una actividad generadora de ingresos. Su sueño  y el de su cónyuge, es lograr la educación exitosa de su hijo de tres años de edad, para que tenga muchas oportunidades de bienestar futura. Su meta es lograr su crecimiento empresarial y por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, porque con el comprará productos de belleza, que solicitan sus clientes después de su asesoría y productos capilares de consumo en su salón de belleza. Su mayor potencial es su capacidad de trabajo y la efectiva calidad con la que lo hace, además de su ubicación física, pues está rodeada de escenarios deportivos y sociales, que potencializan el incremento de su clientela y esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Eliana is 25 years old and lives in Arjona, a town in the department of Bolívar, where she has a hair salon offering services like haircuts, hairdos, and halth and beauty hair treatments. She also sells products to improve her customers' looks. She started her business three years ago after finishing beauty school. Her parents supported her decision to start her own business venture in order to generate an income. 

Her goal is for her business to grow, so after consulting with her customers she is requesting a Kiva loan in order to purchase the beauty supplies that they want. She will also buy hair products to be used at her beauty salon. Her greatest potential lies in her work ethic and the effective quality of her work, as well as her physical location, which is surrounded by social and sporting event sites. This boosts her customer base and is precisely the reason why her investment has been successful.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is married and has two children. She is a hard-working woman who has been managing her business, selling cell phone accessories and motor parts. Together with her husband, she is working for the family's welfare. They want to earn enough income to secure their future. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. She will use it to buy a variety of cell phone accessories as well as motor parts. Hopefully, with hard work the new inventory will produce good income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cell phone accessories and motor parts

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling recyclable materials in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising livestock. Lorna is borrowing PHP 19,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to buy more recyclable materials to sell, like glass bottles, cans, and plastic bottles, for her recyclable materials business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell, like glass bottles, cans, and plastic bottles

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing.  Lorna is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres En Acción está en su ciclo número 20º del programa de comités, como se puede ver es un grupo muy trabajador y es por ello que ya están en ese ciclo. Tienen mucha fe de seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus familias.
 A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación. Una de ellas es la Sra. Ylda, quien se dedica a vender ropas, ella tiene siempre todo tipo de prendas, y así es como siempre tiene muy buena venta. Ella es muy trabajadora y quiere poder seguir creciendo para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita del crédito para la compra prendas, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, shorts y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres En Acción, or Women in Action, is in its 20th cycle of program committees. As you can see, it is a very hard working group and is therefore already in that cycle. They have much faith in continuing to grow and help their families. Through strength, continuous work, and the application of vital characteristics of a successful woman, they are improving their situation. One of the women is Mrs. Yida, who sells clothes for a living. She always has all types of clothes and so always has very good sales. She is very hardworking and wants to be able to continue growing to helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy clothes such as pants, shirts, t-shirts, short and additional items to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, shorts and other items.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is forty two years old and lives in Grang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  Maricel is married and has five children. 

Maricel is a farmer and grows palay, beans, and vegetables for a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her crops.
 
Maricel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her living conditions through her business profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for palay, beans, and vegetables

location.town: Tangub - Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 51-year-old Jefferson from Chitungwiza. He is married with two children, both attending school. He also cares for two dependents. Jefferson runs a retail business selling bedspreads, seat covers, ladies' costumes, men's and kids' wear. He is also into the cross border business.The business has been in operation for 10 years. He says the main challenge faced is that competition is high. Jefferson has requested a loan of $500 to buy more stock for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in payment of school fees. In the future Jefferson plans to open a shop of his own.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: J.nepo

texts.en:
J. Nepo is a 26-year-old man from Rwamagana District, in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a second top-up loan of $50, which he will use to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights. He will resell the lights to people who are without electricity, in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him, to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. J. Nepo started selling lights in June, 2011, and he has sold 160 lights to date, providing clean energy to 800 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to rural households that are without electricity

loans.name: Rocío Evelyn

texts.es:
Rocío tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad. Durante 25 años presto servicio militar en el campo y desde hace 15 años esta desempeñando el cargo de secretaria de archivo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar teja, puertas, construir un muro ya que la casa esta ubicada al lado de una quebrada, la casa esta muy deteriorada, ya que en invierno se moja y puerta principal se encuentra en mal estado. Lo que más desea es que su casa este segura y cómoda, para estar tranquila.
texts.en:
Rocío is 47 years old and has two adult children. She served in the military in the field for 25 years and has worked in her current position as a filing clerk for fifteen years.  

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to purchase roof tiles and doors and build a wall, since her home is located next to a stream and the house is very deteriorated, so it gets wet in the winter and the front door is in bad condition. What she would like the most is for her home to be safe and comfortable so that she can live in peace.

loans.use: to purchase roof tiles and doors and build a wall.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina, de 47 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo Héctor con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que educa en la casa de material rústico que compró hace 7 años.  
Desde muy joven aprendió a cuidar a los animales mientras cuidaba de sus sembríos, pues proviene de padres agricultores. Justina gusto mucho de dedicarse a este negocio, pues las ganancias son diarias y seguras, “todo depende de cómo cuidas a tus animales”, comenta. Posee 6 vacas lecheras de raza, las cuales le proporcionan varios litros de leche que diariamente comercializa a los ganaderos de la zona. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos y renovar el ganado que posee para mejorar la calidad de leche, pues depende mucho de ello, las ganancias que puede obtener en el futuro.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero pues necesita mejorar su ganadería ,además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Justina, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de un vaca nueva, pues necesita renovar su ganado.
texts.en:
Justina, age 47, is a cheerful woman who lives with her husband Héctor. They have three children who they teach in the home made of basic materials that they purchased seven years ago.

From a young age, Justina learned how to care for animals and look after the crops since her parents were farmers. She greatly enjoys this line of work because the income is steady and generated daily. “Everything depends on how you care for the animals,” she says. Justina has six dairy cows that supply several liters of milk per day that she can sell to ranchers in the area. Now she wants to increase her income and replace the cows that she has in order to improve the quality of the milk. This is a great determining factor in how much profit she will earn in the future.

This is her first loan with Kiva. Justina is grateful for the financial support because she needs to improve her livestock. She promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Justina will invest 3,000 PEN in the purchase of a new cow since she needs to replace her herd.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a hog raising business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Erlinda would like to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jeovanny Omar

texts.es:
Jeovanny, solicita un nuevo préstamo  porque necesita más capital de trabajo y por la buena atención que se le brinda. Este le ayudara para invertir en la compra de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas para el cultivo del maíz y frijol.
El crédito anterior le ayudo para comprar insumos agrícolas y con los ingresos obtenidos aporto a su familia. Las condiciones del hogar han mejorado, ya que le ha permitido apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Jeovanny is requesting a new loan because he needs more operating capital and he enjoys the good service that is offered to him. The money will help him to invest in the purchase of compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides for his corn and bean crops.

His previous loan enabled him to buy farming supplies and the profits helped to provide for his family. The household conditions have improved and he is able to support his children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 60 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. She operates a cafe in Malindi for a living. She earns a monthly income of about KES 7,700. Fatuma was introduced to KADET LTD. by a credit officer. 

She has applied a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase additional stock of food ingredients like wheat flour and sugar, and additional serving spoons. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children. 

Fatuma intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will come to own a well-established hotel in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of wheat flour and sugar, and additional serving spoons

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 58 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Merlinda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries. 


She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional stock to resell in her store, like shampoo, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries.

Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to resell in her general store, like shampoo, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 40 years old, married, and he supports a family of four. He runs a retail shop this has been his income-generating business for the last five years, where he gets an average monthly profit of KES 7,000. 

He has borrowed a loan of KES 25,000, this being his fourth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), after successfully paying his previous loans. With this loan, Musa intends to purchase for his retail shop more stocks of sugar, tea leaves, washing powder, bar soap, and utensils, among other items. 

He anticipates getting profits which he will use to pay school fees for his children. The remainder he will use to expand his business. Musa hopes to improve his living standard and be financially stable; he also hopes to save money to enable him to pay school fees for his children as well as to expand his business into a general wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase for his retail shop more stocks of sugar, tea leaves, washing powder, bar soap, and utensils, among other items.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio tiene 45 años, está casado desde hace mucho tiempo con la señora Perla y viven en su propia casa de la ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor Rogelio y su esposa son dueños de un Minimercado en su casa, se dedican a esto desde hace varios años ya que empezaron con una pequeña despensa que luego ha ido creciendo poco a poco hasta convertirse en lo que es ahora. Además de esto el señor Rogelio hace servicios de flete con su vehículo. También tienen departamentos y habitaciones para alquilar.  Tienen  mucha clientela en la zona debido a la variedad de sus productos, por lo cual es concurrido constantemente. Gracias a estas actividades ellos han podido salir adelante, hacer crecer su negocio, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto que se le presente.
El señor ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, verduras, productos a granel, ya que quiere ayudar a su hija y quiere montarle un kiosko para que de esa forma la familia pueda crecer más.
texts.en:
Rogelio is forty-five years old and has been married to Perla for a long time.  They live in their own home in the city of Encarnación.

Rogelio and his wife are owners of a mini-market that they run out of their home, and they have been making a living this way for several years.  They began with a small store that has grown little by little into what it is today.  In addition to this, Rogelio provides charter services with his vehicle.  They also have apartments and rooms for rent.  They have many customers in the area since they offer a wide range of products, and so they are constantly busy.  Thanks to these activities, they have been able to move forward, to grow their business, to maintain their home, and to handle whatever unexpected expense that comes their way.

He has requested this loan in order to buy sweets, carbonated beverages, juices, vegetables, and bulk products.  He wants to help his daughter in setting up a snack bar; in doing this, the family business will be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy sweets, carbonated beverages, juices, vegetables, and bulk products so that he can set up a snack bar for his daughter.

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Kuña Katupyry está en su primer  ciclo, donde ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse las unas a las otras. Kuña Mbarete quiere decir mujer fuerte en guaraní, y estas señoras lo son, ya que luchan tenazmente por sus familias y para darles lo que necesitan.
Celia es la presidenta, ella se siente con una gran responsabilidad de ayudar y guiar a sus compañeras, ya que confiaron en ella. Por su parte Celia se dedica a la costura y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que es conocida en el barrio por hacer excelentes trabajos con los que sus clientes siempre están conformes.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, para poder seguir con su costura y con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Katupyry is in its first cycle. Its members are learning how to work together and help each other. In Guaraní, kuña mbarete means "strong woman", which all of these ladies are, since they fight tenaciously for their families in order to give them what they need.

Celia is President and feels she has a great responsibility to help and guide her fellow members because they have put their trust in her. Celia works as a seamstress and says she has a very good customer base, because she is known in the neighborhood for her excellent work and her customers are always satisfied.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fabric and thread in order to continue sewing and keep up her work.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti runs a small stall, which sells mobile phone airtime credits. She is a housewife and has six people living in her house. She joined Ruma 15 months ago because she wanted to increase her income and still feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, she has around $39 /day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues,  she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transaction on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital needed to process transactions on the weekend

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 42 years old, married, and has already two children, 15-year-old and 5-year-old sons. His 15-year-old son goes to school. This son will be a doctor. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income for the family. Rashid has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border.

This is Rashid's third loan from Kiva. Rashid has been in business, selling fruits and vegetables, for 10 years. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy aubergines, apples, cucumbers and onions, to resell at local bazaars and deliver by car. Rashid wants to use the money from his larger business to help his family.

In the future, he wants to have his own store in the bazaar. This will be more profitable for his business. Rashid is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables in greater quantity

loans.name: Mindo

texts.en:
Mindo farms for a living. He and his wife nurture their land and grow rice to sell. 

He is 45 years of age and does his best to keep the farm productive. He has been working in this kind of business for ten years. Due to his desire to have a better way of life, he applied for a PHP 31,000 loan for his family's farming business. He will use the funds to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farming necessities.

With this loan, both the farm yield and his income will increase. He hopes that his loan request will be granted.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farming necessities

loans.name: Emakina S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Emakina S.h.g Group is a group of 13 farmers in Teso District, represented by Richard. The group has six women and seven men.  Richard is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant 0.5 acres of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum. Richard is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed, fertilizer, and the best input prices.

Richard thought his harvest last year was poor. He hopes that, as a One Acre Fund farmer, he can have an excellent harvest. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and to repair his home. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive on credit 0.5 acres of agricultural inputs. In total, Emakina S.h.g Group will receive 6.5 acres worth of inputs.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Yrupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Yrupe tiene 13 miembros, todas ellas mujeres que quieren tomar las riendas y luchar por sus familias. Están actualmente en su séptimo ciclo, donde todas han puesto un grano de arena para salir adelante.
Una de estas mujeres luchadoras es Apolinaria, quien a través de la venta de queso, busca tener un mejor ingreso para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella sabe que la única forma de tener lo que uno quiere es trabajando y esforzándose por luchar.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de quesos, ya que esta cerca la semana santa y es cuando más pedidos tiene y quiere poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
The group called “Yrupe” has 13 members. All of these women want to take charge and strive on behalf of their families. They are currently in their seventh loan cycle. All of them have done their bit in order to get ahead.

One of these determined women is Apolinaria, who sells cheese. She is looking to earn more income so that she can provide what her family needs. Apolinaria knows that the only way for this to happen is to work and persevere. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of cheeses. Since Holy Week is approaching, she will have more orders and will need to fulfill them.

loans.use: to buy cheeses to sell.

loans.name: Catarina Armida

texts.es:
