Catarina, tiene una tienda en la cual hay variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Ella vive con su familia, es decir su esposo y sus hijos, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El negocio lo aprendió en su familia hace cinco años, ya que este es el tiempo en el cual lo ha estado realizando. 
El préstamo que ella requiere lo invertirá en la compra de productos tales como gaseosa, frijoles, arroz, pan, jugos, papel higiénico entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara para incrementar su negocio y tener diversidad de productos para ofrecerle a los clientes.
Su sueño es cambiar su situación de vida con la obtención de mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Catarina has a store where she sells a variety of essential goods. She lives with her family, that is, her husband and children. She doesn't have relatives abroad. She learned the trade from her family five years ago, and has been in business ever since.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of products like soda, beans, rice, bread, fruit juice, toilet paper, and other items. This investment will help her increase her business and have an assorted array of products to offer her customers.

Her dream is to change her life situation by obtaining a better income.

loans.use: to buy soda, beans, rice, bread, fruit juice, toilet paper, and other items.

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.en:
Mary is a member of Amkeni Group, in Teso District. Amkeni Group is comprised of the 11 One Acre Fund farmers in the picture, 8 women and 3 men. Mary is standing on the right, with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Mary first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Mary joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, and use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Mary described her last year's harvest, as a One Acre Fund farmer, as excellent. She hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Amkeni Group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business selling rice and feeds in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Myrna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to buy additional sacks of rice and feeds to sell.

Myrna would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice and feeds to resell

loans.name: Erli

texts.en: Erli runs a small stall, which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Recently, she worked as a shopkeeper and has five people living in her house. She joined Ruma four months ago because she wanted to add another source of income and was offered the opportunity to became a RUMA dealer by one of Ruma’s field agents. She still feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for her customers. For the last three months, she has around $127 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Ada Patricia

texts.es:
Ada, posee una tienda de granos básicos. Ella vive con su familia, su esposo de 26 años y su hijo de 1 años de edad, dependiente de su compañero de vida y del negocio.  Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, lo lleva acabo todos los días de 6:00 am a 8:00 pm.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos básicos para el hogar tales como: bebidas, churros, frijol, arroz, azúcar, sal, entre otros, esto le ayudara para que exista variedad de mercadería en la tienda. Este le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos y la clientela satisfecha.
Su sueño es poder comprar un lote de tierra para vivir en lo propio.
texts.en:
Ada has a general store. She lives with her family, which includes her 26-year-old husband and their one-year-old son. Ada is dependent on her life companion and her business. She has been in business for three years and works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of basic household products such as beverages, donuts, beans, rice, sugar, salt, and other items. This will help provide variety to the existing merchandise in the store. As a result, she will have more income and satisfied customers. Her dream is to buy her own plot of land where she can live.

loans.use: to buy beverages, donuts, beans, rice, sugar, salt, and other items.

loans.name: Luz Nelly

texts.es: Luz vende verduras y carnes en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, al norte de Colombia. Su negocio inició hace 8 años, cuando observando la necesidad en su barrio se ideo vender carne de res, de ave y pescado, además de verduras variadas. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos del barrio y de otros sectores, a los cuales ha ido conquistando poco a poco con la calidad de sus productos y el buen servicio que presta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará verduras, y especialmente pescado, pues se acerca la semana santa, época en la cual los creyentes católicos, hacen abstinencia alimentaria, de pollo y de carne y consumen todo sus comidas a base de pescado. Esta es la razón por la cual su credikiva,  proyecta ser una inversión de éxito; su meta inmediata es continuar el crecimiento ascendente de su negocio, para aumentar el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida familiar y de bienestar. Para ello Luz le pone muchas ganas y toda su experiencia para continuar adelante con su meta de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Luz sells meat and vegetables in the city of Cartagena de Indias in the northern part of Colombia.  She started her business eight years ago. When she observed that there was a need in her neighborhood, she got the idea to begin selling meat, poultry, fish and vegetables.  Her main customers are from her neighborhood as well as surrounding areas, which she has conquered little by little by virtue of the quality of her products and the good service she provides.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy vegetables, and especially fish.  Holy Week is approaching, and during this time Catholics abstain from eating meat and chicken, and they base their diets entirely on fish.  She projects that this will be a successful investment.

Her immediate goal is to continue to grow her business so that she can improve her family's standard of living and well-being. To this end she applies all of her effort and experience so that she can keep moving toward her goal of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, and especially fish.

loans.name: Irwan

texts.en: Irwan runs a small stall where he sells phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur and has four people living in his house. He joined Ruma three years ago because he wanted to add another source of income and feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for his customers. For the last three months, he has around $114/day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain more capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo se unieron para formar el grupo llamado 12 de junio, hoy ya están en su ciclo 9, y es gracias a que todas están trabajando y se ayudan, están optimistas y tienen un gran espíritu de lucha y quieren salir adelante.
Claudia forma parte de este grupo, y cuenta que ella vende zapatillas bordadas, que ella misma hace. Desde siempre tuvo mucha creatividad para ello y lo está utilizando hoy para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de esto. Ella es una persona con muchas ansias de crecer en la vida. Quiere seguir con su trabajo y es por eso que solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de zapatillas, hilos, lentejuelas, agujas y demás para poder seguir con sus bordados y sus ventas.
texts.en:
15 women from the city of Coronel Oviedo got together to form the group called "12th of June," and today they are already in their 9th loan cycle. This is thanks to the fact that they are all working and helping one another. There are optimistic and have a great fighting spirit, and want to get ahead in life.

Claudia is a part of this group, and says that she sells embroidered sandals, which she herself makes. She has always had a lot of creativity and is now putting it to use to be able to help her family. She is a person with a strong desire to grow in life and she wants to continue with her work. It's for this reason that she is asking for this loan, so that she can invest it in buying sandals, thread, sequins, needles, and on top of that, to be able to continue with her embroidery and her sales.

loans.use: To buy sandals, thread, sequins, and needles so that she can continue to embroider the sandals she sells.

loans.name: Yuni

texts.en: Yuni runs a small stall where she sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. She is a housewife/entrepreneur and has four people living in her house including her son (shown in the picture).  She joined Ruma more than a year ago because she wanted to increase her income and feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for her customers. For the last three months, she has around $66 /day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transaction on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Ganchanga

texts.en:
Mr. Ganchanga, 46 years old, lives with his wife and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His elder son has graduated from his university, specialized in electricity, and is currently staying at home, looking for a job. Ganchanga's eldest daughter studies at an agricultural university, and his other three children go to high school. He and his wife raise livestock and currently have 25 cattle.

Ganchanga is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase three more cows for dairy purposes. Because during this period of time, the price of milk increases greatly, buying additional cows will help him to generate more income for his family.  In the near future, his younger three children will study at the university, and he needs to pay their tuition and fees. The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase three more cows for his dairy business

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a native bag-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy materials for making native bags.

Nelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her native bag-making business.

Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. is re-listing Nelyn's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to make native bags

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 41 years old. a good wife who is full of dreams in life especially for her children’s future. She focuses on her business where she gets all the expenses for their everyday living. She also helps her parent financially and that’s why she needs to earn more. Presently, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 as additional funds to rotate in her cell phone and accessories business. It will be use to purchase new models of cell phones and phone accessories. She hopes to earn a higher income this time for the financial security of her business and family.

loans.use: to purchase new models of cell phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: Jaliee

texts.en:
Jalie is 32 years old.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jalie has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Jalie requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to souse and dry for sale.

Jalie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jalie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to souse and dry for sale

loans.name: Ma. Nelly

texts.en:
Ma. Nelly is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business, making and selling salted, dried fish, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from retailing soft drinks.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF, which she will use to purchase fish to brine and dry, and then sell. 

Ma. Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to brine and dry, and then sell

loans.name: Lolayne

texts.en:
Lolayne is a 37-year-old woman, who is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. Lolayne works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Lolayne has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, sugar, and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more groceries to resell in her store.

Lolayne would like to save enough money to expand her business, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell in her store.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina is 54 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a transportation service to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 8 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Mukangu Group

texts.en:
Hadson is a member of the Mukangu Group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers: 5 women and 5 men. Hadson is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Hadson is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and will use his increased profits to send his children to school.

Hadson thought his harvest last year was poor. He hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer he can have an excellent harvest. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Hadson’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Francisca works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store.  Francisca is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Sr. Silvio tiene 37 años, está casado con la Sra. Fátima hace 9 años, tienen dos hijos juntos Axel  y  Milena, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
El Sr. Silvio es comerciante hace ya más de 11 años, comenzó como macatero (vendedor ambulante) con pequeñas cajas de Remeras, camisas, short, medias, calzas, juguetes, cosméticos, otros y de apoco fue creciendo. Ahora tiene su local en un lugar muy estratégico de la ciudad, el cual es un lugar muy concurrido donde atiende su esposa la Sra. Fátima, mientras que él sigue haciendo sus ventas ambulantes en su vehículo propio, con buena cantidad de productos. Comenta que es muy sacrificado el trabajo pero que vale la pena, ya que de esta manera pudo conseguir para su casa propia y mantener a su familia.
Solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de Remeras, camisas, short, medias, calzas, juguetes, cosméticos, otros para que así siga teniendo buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvio is 37 years old and has been married to Fatima for 9 years. They have two children together, Axel and Milena, and live in the city of Coronel Oviedo. 

Silvio has been working in sales for more than 11 years now. He started as a street vendor with small boxes of knit tops, t-shirts, shorts, hosiery, toys, cosmetics, and other products. His business grew from this small start. Now he has his business in a very strategic location in the city, which is very busy. His spouse Fatima works there, while he continues to work as a traveling salesman in his own vehicle, with a good amount of products. He says that the work is very demanding but that it is worth the effort, since it is in this way that he was able to get his own home and support his family. 

He is asking for this loan to invest it in buying knit tops, t-shirts, shorts, hosiery, toys, cosmetics, and other products, so that he continues having a good variety of products to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy knit tops, t-shirts, shorts, hosiery, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 66 years old. She is married and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gleceria has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. for her dressmaking business.

Gleceria has been in this business for 40 years. Gleceria would like to save enough to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Elite Group

texts.en:
Praxidese’s group has 11 farmers and is located in Teso District. Praxidese is pictured on the right of Elite Group, with her hand raised. Praxidese is pictured amongst the two men and nine women of her group. 

She will receive input loans capable of planting 0.5 acres with sorghum, millet, and sweet potato. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Praxidese’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to grow enough food for the family and to use increased profits to send her children to school.

Praxidese described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Elite Group members will take input loans of 0.5 acres each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine, 37 years old, supports five members of her family. She is still operating her tailoring business and now earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000. She has asked for a loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD to purchase a new sewing machine and textile materials for her business.

Irine hopes to educate her children to greater levels.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and textile materials.

loans.name: Bidii Women Group

texts.en:
Roseline is a member of Bidii Women Group, in Chwele District. She is pictured among the 14 One Acre Fund farmers who are group members, 10 women and 4 men. Roseline is standing on the right, with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Roseline first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Roseline joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, and to use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Roseline was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund, during the Long Rains 2012 she harvested 21 bags per ½ acre. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to buy cattle. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs, on credit. Bidii Women Group will receive 7 acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gracia

texts.en:
Gracia is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Both of her children are in school.

Gracia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Gracia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional livestock.

Gracia has been raising livestock for six years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gracia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca Rosa es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora. Ella sola ha sacado a sus hijos adelante ya que su esposo falleció hace más de 5 años por un trágico accidente. Y para poder cubrir los gastos de la casa inicio con un negocio de papelería y mercería y comenta que le ha ido muy bien. Ella desea estar más cerca de sus hijos y de su casa, es por eso que requiere ayuda por medio de kiva para poder adecuar la papelería y  mercería en su domicilio
texts.en: Blanca Rosa is an enterprising and hardworking woman.  She has cared for her children on her own since her husband died in a tragic accident over five years ago.  In order to cover the household expenses, she started a business selling stationary and accessories. She reports that it is going very well.  She wants to be closer to her children and her home.  For this reason she is seeking a loan through Kiva so that she can open a store in her home where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to open a new location for selling stationary and accessories.

loans.name: Pedro Adolfo

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene un charlet y pupuseria. Él está casado, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 17 años, todos dependen de él; no tiene familiares en el extranjero. 
La raíz de su negocio inicio como sustento para la familia, lo realiza de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm. El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá para comprar mercadería tales como churros, sodas, galletas, dulces, entre otros productos. Este le ayudara para mejorar sus ventas, brindar un mejor servicio a la clientela.
Su objetivo es mejorar el local del negocio para que los clientes se sientan satisfechos por las instalaciones y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro has a food stall and pupusa stand. He is married and has two children (ages 16 and 17) who are dependent on him. Pedro does not have any relatives who live abroad.

The reason why he started his business was so that he could support his family. He works from 6:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as donuts, sodas, cookies, candy, and other products. This will help improve his sales and enable him to provide better service to his customers. His goal is to improve the location of his business so that his customers will be satisfied with the facilities, which will increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy donuts, sodas, cookies, candy, and other products.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is 42 years old and married to Nderitu, who contributes to the family income. She has been running her business for a period of about four years and earns an income of KES 90,000 a month.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD, after having successfully repaid the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy more airtime cards and to increase the float [cash that her business has available, for serving customers with electronic money transfers].

She hopes to open another Mpesa shop and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to increase the float and buy more airtime cards.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is 44 years old and lives in Ijevan city with his wife, three children, and his retired parents. Hayk works in an Ijevan mineral water factory as a supplier, while his wife is engaged in clothes trading. Hayk and his wife work day and night to take care of his retired parents and provide for their children's needs.

His son is still a pupil, and his daughters are promising students: one of them studies at the Ijevan Branch of Yerevan State University in the faculty of history, another at the same University in the faculty of Armenian language and literature. Hayk is requesting a loan from Kiva to pay his daughter's tuition fees for the semester.

loans.use: To pay his daughter's tuition fees for the semester.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is a merchant from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. 

Amanda is engaged in tobacco sales. She needs a loan for additional capital. In addition, she will use the loan to pay for the school fees of children and to buy food for the family's consumption. With this loan, she will be able to continually support her children's education. In the future, Amanda dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the school fees of children and to buy food for the family.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Bidii is a group of 26 farmers (23 women and 3 men) in Kakamega North District represented by Violet. Violet is on the right in the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Violet first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Violet joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices.

Violet reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 2 bags of maize per 1/2 acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 8.5 bags per 1/2 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Violet’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 13 acres of land.

The field officer is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato.

loans.name: Remilda

texts.en:
Remilda is 42 years old, married, with two children. With two children currently in school, Remilda works very hard to provide for them.

Remilda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like shampoo, noodles, cooking oil, and bread.

Remilda has been in this business for 11 years and she sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles, cooking oil, and bread.

Remilda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Remilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like shampoo, noodles, cooking oil, and bread.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 54 años de edad , esta casada con Humberto con quien tiene 4 hijos , pero solo vive con uno de ellos: Nelson a quien educa en su casa propia.Yolanda se dedica al cuidado de ovejas, las cuales cuida con mucho esmero y alimenta constantemente, pues depende de ello, su venta en el mercado de la ciudad. “Con la venta de carne obtengo más ingresos, además me gusta mucho”, afirma Yolanda, quien también abrió una tienda de comestibles en su casa, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, “ahí el dinero no circula, tienes que comprar alimentos que se venderán en 2 o 3 días”, afirma, por ello necesita dinero para poder capitalizar su negocio, no puede mezclar los ingresos ya que según sus propias palabras, cada negocio tiene su propio capital de trabajo. Yolanda invertirá los S/. 1500 soles en la compra de productos comestibles para la tienda que tiene en su hogar tales como: arroz, azúcar y bebidas de todo tipo , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en:
Yolanda, 54, is married to Humberto, with whom she has four children.  Only one lives with them, however: Nelson, whom she raises in her own house.

Yolanda earns her living raising sheep.  She looks after them very carefully and feeds them constantly because she depends on selling them in the city market.  "I get more income selling meat.  Besides, I like it," says Yolanda, who also opened a grocery store in her house where she sells basic necessities.  "The money doesn't flow there," she says.  "You have to buy food that will sell in two or three days."

She needs money to be able to strengthen her business.  She can't mix the incomes because, as she herself says, each business has its own working capital.

Yolanda will invest the 1500 soles [PEN] in food products for the store she has in her house, such as rice, sugar, and all types of beverages.

 Also, she's committed to making her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beverages, and other food products

loans.name: Nonik

texts.en:
Nonik runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. She is a student and still living in her parents’ house with five people living in it. 

Nonik joined Ruma 13 months ago because she wanted to get additional income. She still feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, Nonik has had around $60/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, she needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Anelia de 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Villa Elisa es casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Anelia es una señora muy emprendedora, y se nota en ella sus ganas de trabajar ya que su microempresa principal es de una Librería , Bazar, y Mercería Fotocopiadora,  aparte de eso los fines de semana realiza ventas de comidas como Sopa Paraguaya, Milanesas, Pastas para vender por porciones, también cuenta con Servicios de alquileres de Vajillerias y Cubiertos.
Ella comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero hoy en día ya tiene una gran microempresa que la ayuda a poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  cuadernos, lápices, mochilas, medias, buzos para colegios, calzados deportivos para poder surtir su local y seguir dando todo lo que necesitan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Anelia, age 52, lives in her own house in the city of Villa Elisa.  She is married and has two children.

Anelia is a very enterprising woman.  Her desire to work is evident because her primary small business is a Variety Store with goods like stationery products and small wares and photocopying.

Aside from this, on the week-ends she sells food like ‘Sopa Paraguaya’ [Paraguayan soup], ‘Milanesas’ [fried meats], and Pastas to sell by the plate.  She also has a service of renting tableware and cutlery.

She says that she started with very little.  However, now she has a great small business that helps her to be able to give her family what they need.

She is requesting this loan to buy notebooks, pencils, backpacks, socks, tracksuits for school, and athletic shoes.  She will do this in order to be able to stock her place and continue giving her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, backpacks, socks, tracksuits for school, and athletic shoes.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy de 50 años tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende cervezas desde hace 15 años, cuando observaba a sus vecinos trasladarse hasta muy lejos a comprar esta bebida,  los fines de semanas y festivos. En la actualidad tiene un local donde vende cervezas, refrescos y productos alimenticios empacados o mecatos diariamente desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 2 de la mañana. Su meta es lograr el crecimiento de su negocio en forma ascendente, pero su incipiente capital de trabajo, es su mayor desafío para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cervezas por cajas, pues se acercan temporadas que tienen pocos días hábiles y el consumo de bebidas se incrementa, convirtiéndose en la razón de éxito de su inversión. Mas adelante espera tener suficientes recursos para comprar un mayor número de sillas, ofrecer  una mejor presentación y confort a su clientela, porque espera ahorrar para superar sus necesidades y aumentar el bienestar   de su familia conformada por su esposa y su hijo de 23 años de edad.
texts.en:
Fredy is 50 years old and has had a business selling beer for the last 15 years.  He started the business when he observed that his neighbors were travelling long distances to buy this beverage on the weekends and during festivals.

Currently he has a shop where he sells beer, soft drinks, cakes and packaged foods.  He works daily from three in the afternoon until two in the morning.  His goal is to keep growing his business, but obtaining initial working capital is his biggest challenge.

For this reason he is seeking his first loan through Kiva from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the funds to buy beer by the case.  The season is approaching when there are fewer work days, and during this time, the consumption of this beverage increases, so his investment should be successful.

Further down the road he hopes to have sufficient resources to buy more chairs, offering a more attractive and comfortable environment to his customers. He hopes to be able to save money after covering his family's expenses and providing for their well-being.  He is married and has a 23-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy beer by the case.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Liberty works hard to support her family.

Liberty has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods and raising livestock. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Liberty has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está empezando a trabajar, todas están con mucho ánimo para crecer y salir adelante, son jefas de familia, que vieron en el programa de comité de mujeres una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias.
La Presidenta  es la Sra. Marcelina ella es limpiadora en una casa de familia y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de lencerias, y bijouterie que va a empezar ahora ya que su quiere poder tener un poco más de ingresos para poder dar a su familia un poco más.
Es una persona que quiere trabajar y salir adelante, lucha y se esfuerza por mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called Kuna Guapa is beginning its work. All the members have much desire to grow and get ahead. They are heads of families who see in the Committee of Women Program a great opportunity for them and their families.

The president is Marcelina. At present, she cleans family homes. The loan she solicits will enable her  to buy lingerie and ornaments which she will now begin to sell. She wishes to generate a little more income in order to offer her family a bit more.

Marcelina is a person who wishes to work and advance. She will struggle and put forth great effort in order to improve.

loans.use: to buy ladies underwear and ornaments to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Yolanda

texts.es:
Gloria es una señorita de 19 años quien es soltera y vive en Sololá. Tiene 5 hermanas y 4 hermanos a aun vive con sus padres.  

Ella actualmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, eligió este tipo de negocio ya que su papa cuenta con experiencia, por lo que ya lleva un año de tenerlo viendo que obtiene ganancias aceptables par aportar a la economía de la familia. También elabora ropa típica  que utilizan en su comunidad de donde obtiene más ingresos.

Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 4,200.00 para poder aumentar su negocio comprando más productos y ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. De esta manera obtendrá mejores ganancias y seguir creciendo como pequeña empresaria.

Uno de sus sueños es tener otra tienda de abarrotes para seguir apoyando el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 19 year old young woman.  She is single and lives with her parents in Solola.  She has five sisters and four brothers.

She has a grocery store and decided to start this type of business since her father had experience in it.  She’s had it for a year and earns enough to support the family finances.  She also makes typical clothing like that used in her community and she earns an additional income.

She is asking for a loan of Q4,200 to be able to grow her business by buying more products and offering better service to her customers.  In this way she can obtain a better income and can continue as a small businesswoman.

One of her dreams is to have another grocery store so that she can continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married, with eight children. Evelyn is 54 years old and lives in Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

Evelyn sells palay grains to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 (fourteen thousand pesos) to buy more palay grains for her buy-and-sell business.

Evelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for six years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy more palay grains for her buy-and-sell palay business.

location.town: Tangub - Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store as well as food-vending and e-loading businesses in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Lorelie successfully paid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. NWTF is re-listing Lorelie's business profile, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.fr: Amélévi est une dame de 43ans qui se bat chaque fois pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer. Elle a pour mari un couturier et maman de 05 enfants dont 03 à l’école. Coiffeuse de profession, Amélévi revend aussi des produits cosmétiques et des mèches dans son atelier qu’elle a ouvert en 2008. Avec son troisième crédit, elle va s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut assurer la stabilité de son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en:
Amélévi is a woman, 43 years of age, who is working hard to help her spouse pay for their household expenses. Amélévi's husband works as a dressmaker, and the two have five children, three of whom attend school.

Hairdresser by profession, Amélévi also sells cosmetics and hair extensions in her studio, which she opened in 2008. With her ​​third loan, Amélévi plans to purchase the supplies she needs to better meet the demands of her customers. Amélévi wants to ensure the stability of her business and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for resale

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 59 years old, married, and has seven children.

Rufina is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional livestock to sell.

Rufina has been buying and selling livestock for ten years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Imara Group

texts.en:
Imara Group is a group of 23 farmers in Chwele District, represented by Alice. The group has 14 women and 9 men. Alice is on the right of the photo with a blue scarf on her neck. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to Alice on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant 0.5 acres of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum. Alice joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Alice joined One Acre Fund, so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Alice described her last year's harvest as excellent and, as a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to repair her home. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive on credit 0.5 acres of agricultural inputs. In total, Imara Group will receive 11.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 29-year-old man. He describes himself as honest, faithful, and focused. 

Vincent operates an electrical retail store, selling electrical appliances.  He has been involved in this business for two years; his business is located in a good and viable business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy electrical appliances to sell; his business goal is to expand his business within five years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM;  he successfully paid the initial loan of KES 20,000.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances to sell.

loans.name: Sharyn

texts.en:
Sharyn works hard to support her two children. She is married and has a hog-raising business in the Philippines.

Sharyn requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Sharyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 41-year-old teacher who is married to Noni, a 44-year-old teacher. They are blessed with five children, namely: Desky, 21, in the fourth semester of nursing high school; Elen, 17, in the first grade of senior high school; Andre, 11, in the fifth grade of elementary school; Friska, 9, in the third grade of elementary school; and Jenira, 7, in the second grade of elementary school.

Five months ago, in order to earn more income, Sarah bought a used “bemo” (public transport). The bemo operates every day. Sarah has planned to replace  the tires and the accumulator, as well.  She requested a loan of IDR 12,000,000 from Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation (TLM).

loans.use: to purchase new tires and an accumulator for her vehicle.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina's business is direct-selling, and a retail store. She is 61 years old, yet she is a business-oriented woman.  She has devoted 11 years of hard work and perseverance to her direct-selling business.  

She is thankful because two of her children are already working, while the other four are married and have their own families.

Marcelina aspires to have a stable source of income, so she's doing her best to get ahead. She wants to increase the stock of cosmetic products and merchandise she offers within her village, but she struggles with a shortage of capital.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000.  She hopes this loan amount will enable her to make both her store and direct-selling business profitable someday.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cosmetic products and grocery items for her direct-selling cosmetic business and her retail store.

loans.name: Ziporah

texts.en: Ziporah is a 39-year-old single woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a committed woman. She operates a retail business selling water. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable business area. She describes her biggest business challenge as high transportation costs. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy water to sell. Her business goal is to have a good means of transporting water to sell to customers within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, after managing to repay her previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy water for resale to customers.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business selling banana in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. She also earns income from direct selling of Avon and Natasha products.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more bananas to resell in her banana business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, chicken, drinks, corn, vegetables and plates

loans.name: Wazekese Youth Group

texts.en:
Hellen is a member of Wazekese Youth Group in Chwele District. The group, pictured above, is comprised of 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 6 women and 4 men. Hellen is standing on the right, with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Hellen joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Hellen joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Hellen described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to buy a cow. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs, on credit. Wazekese Youth Group will receive five acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren, 44 years old, lives with her son in Erdenet, the third-largest city in Mongolia. Her elder son studies at university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her younger son goes to high school and, this year, he will take the university entrance exam.

Dolgorsuren herself has been selling clothes to local people since 2006 and before this business she worked at a private business entity. She travels to Ereen city--a border city between Mongolia and China--in order to bring her goods.

The apartment they live in has been deteriorating over the years and in winter time, the strong wind and storms seep through walls and chills the family members down to their cores. So she is requesting a loan of 3,100,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiber glass, bricks, planks and cement. As a result, she and her son will be able to live in comfortable and warm place, preventing heat loss through the walls and window. After losing her husband to an industry accident, Dolgorsuren is working so hard to raise her sons well.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiber glass, bricks, planks and cement.

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en:
Julieto is a tricycle driver from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years now. His wife works as a teacher.

Julieto is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. With this loan, he will be able to improve and maintain the good working condition of his vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 45-year-old, married man. He has eight children, with ages ranging from 7 years to 23 years. He describes himself to be a hard-working man. 

He operates a vehicle repair service where he provides vehicle repair services. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a potential business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to expand the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vehicle spare parts. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Alba Enix

texts.es:
Alba, tiene una venta de pupusas y tortillas. Ella vive con su esposo en casa propia y no tiene hijos. El negocio nace a raíz de la necesidad de tener más ingresos para aportar a la familia y así dar una mejor calidad de vida.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, preparativos para las pupusas, leña, gas, entre otros. Esta compra le ayudara  a darle un mejor servicio a los clientes además con las ganancias le permitirá realizar remodelación en la vivienda.
Su sueño es mejorar cada día su hogar, colocarle piso de ladrillo y afinar las paredes de la casa.
texts.en:
Alba has a business selling pupusas and tortillas.  She lives with her husband in her own home and doesn't have any children.  She set up her business as she needed to make more money for her family so that she could give them a better quality of life.

Alba needs this loan to invest in buying corn, ingredients for making pupusas, firewood, gas, etc.  This purchase will help her to provide a better service to her customers.  The profits she makes will allow her to remodel her home.  Her dream is to continue improving her home, lay a brick floor, and plaster the walls.

loans.use: to buy corn, other ingredients for making pupusas, firewood, gas, etc.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la  necesidad de invertir en el negocio de productos básicos para el hogar. Este le permitirá comprar productos tales como: cereales, aceites, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior  le permitió invertir en la tienda y satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes ya que posee variedad de mercadería. Los ingresos económicos han aumentado.
texts.en: Roberto is requesting a new loan to invest in his business selling basic household products.  This will allow him to buy products such as cereals, oils, etc.  His previous loan allowed him to invest in his store and meet his customers' needs as he bought a range of merchandise.  His income has increased.

loans.use: to buy products such as cereals, oils, etc.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 36 years old, married, and supports a family of four. She runs a quarry-mining business serving Koitebes Village in Baringo County. This has been her income-generating business for the last five years, and she gets an average monthly income of 6,000 KES. 

She has borrowed a loan of 16,000 KES. With this loan, she intends to pay wages for casual workers in her mines. She anticipates getting profits which she will use to expand her business by increasing the number of workers in the quarry, increasing building block production to meet customer demand.

Peninah hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business by mechanizing the mining processes.

loans.use: to pay the wages of casual workers in her mines.

loans.name: Hututu Group

texts.en:
This is Hututu Group, and the group's representative, Eliud, is pictured on the right, with his hand raised. The 20 of them, 15 women and 5 men, are farmers in Chwele District. Farming inputs will be delivered to Eliud on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet and sorghum. Eliud first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Eliud joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and access the best farm input prices.

Eliud reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 3 bags of maize per acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 25 bags per acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, the Hututu Group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 10 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Nasiraka Group

texts.en:
Stephen’s group has 25 farmers and is located in Chwele District. Stephen is pictured on the right of Nasira Group with his hand raised. Stephen is pictured amongst the 8 men and 17 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum and millet. Stephen joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Stephen joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family and gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Stephen was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize per ½ acre, but, after joining One Acre Fund, he was able to harvest 13 bags per ½ acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Stephen’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 12.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 57 years old and married, with two children. Pilar works very hard to provide for them.

Pilar runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Pilar has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, snack foods, noodles, and seasonings. In the future, Pilar would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas son muy humildes y quieren trabajar para poder mejorar sus ingresos y las de su familia.
La señora María es presidenta del comité, ella cuenta con una pequeña despensa en su casa, donde tiene todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad que ofrece a sus clientes, como ser verduras, leche, productos a granel, carnes y demás. Ella está trabajando duro por mejorar su negocio para así tener un poco mas de ingresos.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de productos a granel, carnes y demás para que así pueda tener bien surtido su negocio y siga con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The 13 members of this group are women from the city of Caacupé.  They are all very humble and want to work to be able to improve their income for their families.

María's the president of the group.  She has a small store in her house where she has all types of basic necessities to sell to her customers, including vegetables, milk, bulk products, meat, and others.  She's working hard to improve her business so she has a bit more income.

She's requesting this loan to buy bulk products, meat, and other things so her business is well stocked and she can continue with her sales as she is doing now.

loans.use: to buy bulk products, meat, and other items

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business--pig fattening--in the Philippines. Teresita requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times from NWTF in the past to sustain it.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old, married, and has three children. With one child currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, a business that she has been in for five years. She sells a variety of items, such as soap, noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, etcetera. 

She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Teresita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 34 años es una valerosa madre soltera de 3 hijos, a los que sacó adelante. Ahora solo vive con Rocío su hija menor. Juntas viven en la casa que compró hace algunos años. 
Desde niña ayudó a su mamá en la venta de sopas en un espacio que acondicionó por su casa. Ahí aprendió todo lo necesario. Cuando murió su madre, ella continuó con el negocio, además de la crianza de animales y la elaboración de artesanía llamada “damasitas”  (madera en forma de paleta que se utiliza como juguete para niños). Pero a pesar de las constantes actividades que posee, su principal trabajo es la agricultura, por está razón siembra maíz, papa y otros productos en los terrenos que le fueron heredados de parte de sus padres, durante todo este tiempo demostró constancia en su trabajo y cada año obtiene buenas ganancias. 
Luz, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos y a su vez agradece el apoyo financiero que le permitió concretar sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas .
texts.en:
34-year-old Luz is a courageous single mother who has brought up three children.  She now lives alone with Rocío, her youngest daughter.  They live together in a house that she bought some years ago.

Luz helped her mom to sell soups in a specially equipped space in their house since she was a little girl.  That is where she learned everything she needed to know about the business.  When her mom died, she kept the business running.  In addition, she also raises animals and makes handicrafts called 'damasitas' (little wooden dolls for children).  However, in spite of all the businesses she owns, her main work is farming.  She grows corn, potatoes and other crops on land that she inherited from her parents.  Over the years she has persevered in her work and every year she makes good profits.

Luz will invest 1,500 soles in buying some organic fertilizer with which to feed her crops.  She is grateful for the financial support as it allows her to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nabuloli Adult Group

texts.en:
Everlyn is a member of Nabuloli Adult Group, in Chwele District. She is pictured with 11 One Acre Fund farmers, ten women and one man. Everlyn is standing on the right, with her hand raised. 

She is receiving an input loan for 0.5 acres for sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Everlyn first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Everlyn joined One Acre Fund in order to be assured of reliable input delivery and to grow enough food for the family.

Everlyn described her last year's harvest as very good, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Nabuloli Adult Group members will take input loans of 0.5 acres each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, noodles, bread and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Virginia has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns additional income from an eatery.

Virginia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, noodles, bread and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Amka Group

texts.en:
Janet is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Amka Group members. The 18 of them, 11 women and 7 men, are farmers in Kakamega North District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of millet and sorghum. Janet joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Janet joined One Acre Fund so that she could use increased profits to send her children to school and grow enough food for the family.

Janet described her harvest last year as good, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Janet’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 9 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Ma.theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her fishing business.

This time, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing gear and supplies.

NWTF is listing Ma. Theresa's business profile again, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and supplies

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, tiene una tienda; él vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de edades de 17 y 27 años, son una familia unida y trabajadora.  Rafael se dedica a la venta de productos básicos para el hogar, esto lo realiza desde diez años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá invertir en la compra de bebidas, churros, frijol, arroz, azúcar, sal, otros gastos. Esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio y ayudarle a sus hijos para que salgan adelante.
Su sueño es tener mayores ingresos para darle una mejor estabilidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael owns a store.  He lives with his wife and his two children who are 17 and 27 years old.  They are a united, hard-working family.  Rafael's business is selling basic household products.  He has been in this line of work for 10 years.

Rafael needs this loan to invest in buying drinks, churros, beans, rice, sugar, salt, etc.  This investment will help him to strengthen his business and provide for his children.  His dream is to make more income so that he can enjoy better stability in life.

loans.use: to buy drinks, churros, beans, rice, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 27 años es soltero, vive con sus papas en la ciudad de Itá, se encuentra trabajando en su propio negocio de equipamiento para vehículos, anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa que hacía lo mismo de la cual salió para poder tener su propia microempresa. Hoy día tiene una buena cantidad de clientela conformada gracias a los diversos servicios que siempre ofrece a sus clientes.
 El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de repuestos para su negocio ya que esta con mayor demanda y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes.
Comenta Juan que su objetivo es llegar a culminar sus estudios universitarios a pesar de los diversos obstáculos que existen.
texts.en:
Juan, 27, is single and lives with his parents in the city of Itá.

He works in his own auto-supply business.  Previously he worked for a company that did the same thing; he left to be able to have his own small business.  Currently he has brought together a good number of customers thanks to the various services he always offers them.

The loan he's requesting is to buy spare parts for his business because he has more demand and he wants to be able to comply with his customers.

Juan says his goal is to finish his university education despite the various obstacles that stand in his way.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dress-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

She requested a new loan, in the amount of PHP 11,000, through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase materials, like fabric, thread and needles, for making dresses. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her dress-making business.

Elma's goal for the future is to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase materials, like fabric, thread and needles, for making dresses

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a 35-year-old, married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from two years to 12 years. He describes himself to be hard-working. 

Mathew operates a retail store where he sells maize. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a potential business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a poor road network. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy cereals to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM) after managing to successfully pay a previous loan of KES 20,000.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Vena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Vena works hard to support her family. She has a sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines and earns additional income by farming and raising pigs.

Vena’s business has been thriving with the help of her past eight loans from NWTF and, more recently, Kiva. She is now applying for a 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock like sugar, shampoo etc. to sell in her store.

Vena is determined that her hard work will help her increase her profits and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her sari sari.

loans.name: Lilia Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lilia Lucila es originaria al igual que su familia, Ella trabaja para un empresa de productos de belleza para dama desde hace un años y su esposo es realiza trabajos de construcción, con los ingresos que generan solventan los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos, dos estudian las primaria y uno la secundaria.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la colocación del piso de concreto al frente de su casa y los acabados del exterior, ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y que su esposo se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a sus trabajos de albañil.
Con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo es para pagar el crédito y que con el ingreso de los trabajos de su esposo son para los gastos familiares y escolares.
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y que tengan un patrimonio seguro y en las mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Lilia Lucila is a native, as is her family.  She has worked for a women's beauty products company for a year and her husband works in construction.  With the income they generate they pay the family expenses and the educational expenses of their three children.  Two of them are in elementary school and one is in secondary.

She's requesting a loan to put in the concrete pad in front of her house and to put the finishing touches on the exterior.  At the moment she doesn't have the necessary money to buy the materials.  Her husband will be responsible for doing the improvements in addition to his jobs as a bricklayer.

The salary from her job is to repay the loan and her husband's income is for the family and school expenses.

They want their children to have a better quality of life and a safe inheritance in the best condition.

loans.use: to put in the concrete pad and to finish the exterior

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 28 years old and married to Julius, who works as well to support their three children. She has been running her beauty shop for about six years now and making 10,000 KES a month.

Florence is applying for a loan of 50,000 KES, her fourth from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. She wants to use the loan to buy more beauty products and hair extensions. She’d like to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and hair extensions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some improvements to her house, where she has a grocery store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Grace works hard to support her family. She raises hogs to sell and makes money operating a chainsaw.

Through her past seven loans from NWTF Grace has been able to sustain her businesses. She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now applying for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Grace’s ambition is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mulembe A Group

texts.en:
Mulembe A is a group of eleven farmers, two women and nine men, in Chwele District and is headed by Cleophas (seen on the right with his hand raised). Enough seed and equipment to farm half an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum will be given to each farmer on credit so that together the group will receive enough supplies to farm five and a half acres in all.

Cleophas joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 season and is now enrolling for Long Rains 2013. He joined the fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer at the best prices. He described his harvest as good last year but believes he can have an even better one this year.

Cleophas hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and repair his home.

loans.use: to farm a half an acre through the Long Rains 2013 season.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luís tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero. Vive junto a sus abuelos desde la edad de cinco años, ya que su madre lo dejo con ellos. Estaba estudiando; pero se le presento la oportunidad de trabajar en la Alcaldía y opto por trabajar para ayudar a sus abuelos con los gastos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cerámica para el piso de la casa, comprar puertas y ventanas, para la casa que esta construyendo. Él manifiesta que le gustaría continuar estudiando los fines de semana, para no dejar de trabajar.
texts.en:
Luís is 23 years old and single.  He has lived with his grandparents since the age of five when his mother left him in their care.  

He was studying, but he was presented with an opportunity to work for the city.  Luís chose to work so that he could help his grandparents with the expenses.  The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy ceramic floor tiles, doors, and windows for the house that is being built.  He says that he would like to continue his studies on the weekends, but he is not able to stop working.

loans.use: to buy ceramic floor tiles, doors, and windows.

loans.name: Benito Ramón

texts.es: Benito de 46 años, soltero, padre de 4 hijos, tiene un negocio de joyería de nombre “ JOYERÍA GRANADOS” donde se dedica al acopio de oro, vende oro formado como: pulseras, anillos, cadenas, aretes, entre otros. También es propietario de un molino para procesar tierra de minería  y producir oro, compra la tierra en una mina de su localidad por tonelada. Hace 31 años inicio este negocio con ayuda de su papa, el señor era propietario de otra joyería donde aprendió Benito el negocio ya que por problemas económicos no siguió estudiando pero sí pudo iniciar su propio negocio. Él es muy conocido en su zona por su actividad económica. Benito  solicita este crédito para compra de oro, platas,  acero y mejorar su maquinaria. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva la ayuda que les brindan a los comerciantes pequeños de países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en:
Benito, age 46, is single and has four children.  He has a jewelry business called “Joyería Granados” where he devotes himself to procuring gold.  He sells gold in the form of bracelets, rings, chains, and earrings, among others.

He also has a grinding mill to process mined earth and produce gold.  He buys the mined earth by the ton at a mine in his area.  He started this business 31 years ago with help from his father.  He was the proprietor of another jewelry business where Benito learned the business.

Due to financial problems, he did not continue his education, but he was able to start his own business.  He is well known in his area for his business activity.

Benito is requesting this loan to buy gold, silver, and steel.  He will also use the loan to improve his machinery.  He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they provide to small businesspeople in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy precious metals (gold, silver, and steel), and to improve his machinery.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is 24 years old and married with two children. For the past three years she has successfully run a shop where she sells cooking oil, flour, milk, bread, sugar and rice, among other items.

Celestine previously took out and repaid a loan with KADET. She now is applying for a 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of the same sort to sell in her shop.

Celestine hopes to see her business grow so that she can open a wholesale shop and make more money. Her goal is to be able to provide for her family’s daily needs and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 66 years old, married and blessed with six children.  Five of her children are married, while the other one is searching for a job. Leonila manages 21,000 square meters of rice field, a motorcycle transport business and a tailoring business.

Leonila started her tailoring and rice farming businesses in 1971.  Her income from her rice field and tailoring goes toward their daily necessities and savings and is used for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle transport.  At her age, she aims to have a viable source of income because she is getting old.   She is seeking additional capital of PHP25,000 which will allow her to buy garments and thread, in addition to paying the salary of her one helper.  She hopes that her tailoring business will continue to improve so she can earn a greater amount of income. She hopes it will take care of her family's needs and provide savings for emergency purposes if she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy garments and thread, and to pay the salary of her one helper in her tailoring business

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 55 years old.  She is married and has four children, one of whom is in school.  Jovita raises hogs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs and to purchase an additional pig for her business.

Jovita has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Jovita would like to save enough money to buy farm land.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs and to purchase an additional pig

loans.name: Soso

texts.en:
Soso is 31 years old and is from the small village of Mtskheta district.  He is married and lives with his wife and two children (9 and 11 years old).
