Soso requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success.  His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Soso’s wife milks the cow and produces cheese for selling. They also have three pigs. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence-poor category. 

Soso requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of a business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor.  These people do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers”  because of low income. Soso plans to start his own business.
The place in which he lives is very conducive to opening a fast food stall, where he will sell Doner (similar to kabobs). With the received credit, Soso will purchase the stock of raw materials to make doner and a refrigerator for juices. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a fast food stall and sell Doner

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 24 year-old married man. He has three children whose ages range from 6 months to 6 years. He describes himself to be a humble and caring man. He operates a restaurant where he sells tea and snacks. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a viable business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital for expanding the business. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the restaurant and buy food ingredients. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM, after managing to pay a previous loan of Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the restaurant and buy food ingredients

loans.name: St Anthony Biddi Group

texts.en:
Juma’s group has ten farmers and is located in Chwele District. Juma is pictured on the right of St Anthony Biddi Group with his hand raised. Juma is pictured amongst the 2 men and 8 women of his group. He will receive a loan to enable him to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potatoes. Juma joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Juma joined One Acre Fund so that he could learn good farming techniques and gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Juma was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 22 bags per ½ acre. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Juma’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Amukeni Group

texts.en:
Hellen is a member of Amukeni Group in Kakakmega North District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 6 women and 4 men. Hellen is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of millet and sorghum cultivation. Hellen joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Hellen joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Hellen reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about one bag of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested four bags per 1/2 acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a cow and send her children to school. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Hellen’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lucia has been in this business for 27 years. She earns more income from hog raising.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Shindeva Group

texts.en:
Shindeva is a group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District represented by Rose. The group has 9 women and 3 men. Rose is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half acre of millet and sorghum. Rose joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Rose joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Rose described her harvest as good last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Rose’s group members will take input loans of a half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Enid has been working hard to manage her fresh food business, where she sells sells fresh food like matooke, beans, and tomatoes.

To help expand her business, Enid has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy fresh food like matooke, beans, and tomatoes to sell, and will help Enid to generate greater profits and boost the business and increase their income. Enid hopes that in the future she will be able to be more productive. 

Enid is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy fresh food like matooke, beans, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a shells crafting business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making and selling nipa (palm leaves). Cornelia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials like shells, nylon and paint for her shells crafting business.

Cornelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like shells, nylon and paint.

loans.name: Amka Group

texts.en:
Magret is a member of Amka Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 3 men. Magret is standing at the back of the photo raising a One Acre Fund Post. She is receiving an input loan for a half acre of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Magret joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Magret joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school. 

Magret reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 5 bags of maize per 1.5 acres, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 12 bags per 1.5 acres. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Magret’s group members will take input loans of a half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a 30 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. She describes herself as an honest and ambitious woman. She operates a clothes retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of clothes for selling. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eden Group

texts.en:
Joshua is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Eden Group members. The 15 of them, 9 women and 6 men, are farmers in Kakamega North District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half acre of millet and sorghum. Joshua is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Last year, Joshua harvested 15 bags of maize on an acre of land. He is excited to improve his harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive a half acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Joshua’s group will receive 7 1/2 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a 24 year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be an honest and ambitious woman. She operates a food stall where she sells roasted maize. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located near a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy maize for roasting. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy maize for roasting

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is engaged in a retailing business. She is a married woman and a mother of four children, ages eight, five and three.  She buys and sells bamboo. Bamboo is used as skewers and firewood.  Her husband works as farmer. 

Marites is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo to sell.  Also, she will use it to pay for the school expenses of her children. In the future, Marites hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Daniel’s group has 19 farmers and is located in Kakamega North District. Daniel is pictured on the right of Bidii Group with his hand raised. Daniel is pictured amongst the 8 men and 11 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting half an acre with sorghum and millet. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Daniel’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Last year, Daniel harvested 1 1/2 bags of maize on an acre of land. He is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. Daniel’s group members will each receive input loans of a half acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 9 1/2 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en: Emilly is a 36 year old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 19 years. She describes herself as an innovative woman. She operates a hardware where she sells items such as fork jembes, shovels, slashers, machetes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock for selling. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy hardware items such as fork jembes, shovels, slashers, and machetes, etc. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hardware items such as fork jembes, shovels, slashers, machetes, etc.

loans.name: Rakhim

texts.en: Rakhim is 23 years old, married and has a child, a 1-year old son. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. Rakhim has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, with his family, which is close to the occupied border. This is Rakhim's first loan from Kiva. He has been in the food and detergent selling business for a years. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy shampoo, soap, powder, butter, tea, rice, and flour, etc. Rakhim wants to use the money from his new business to help his family to raise his son. In the future, he wants to have big shop to sell food and detergent products. This will be more profitable for his business. Rakhim is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 30 years old father of one child and an electrician in Kangundo town. His wife runs a salon business and therefore supports the family with the income she makes. He does electrical installation and wiring for new buildings and businesses, electrical repairs, as well as sells electrical goods.

This is his second loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more electrical materials for use in his business.These materials include circuit breakers, sockets, screwdrivers, electric wires, as well as bulbs. This will enable him to serve many customers in a shorter time and generate more income that will enable him to provide for the needs of his family.

He hopes to grow his business by opening an electrical shop and thereby selling more electrical goods and making more income.

loans.use: To buy electrical materials and gadgets for his business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jesús es originario de esta ciudad así como su esposa la señora Maria. El señor Jesús es empleado de una empresa trasportista como chofer de un camión de carga y la señora Maria se dedica al cuidado de sus tres hijos, la mayor estudia la universidad, uno la primaria y el más pequeño estudia en una escuela especial.
 Solicita un préstamo para la instalación de cable de electricidad, porque el que tiene esta en malas condiciones y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidente de incendio en su vivienda y arriesgar la vida de su familia.
Con una parte del sueldo que reciba de su trabaja pagar el crédito ya que es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
Desea mejor el patrimonio de sus hijos y que estén en un lugar seguro y cómodo.
texts.en:
Jesús comes from this town, as does his wife Maria. Jesús works as a cargo truck driver for a transportation company, and Maria takes care of their three children - the eldest one is in college, another one goes to elementary school and the youngest one goes to a special school.
He requests a loan in order to install electrical wiring, because the wiring he has now is in bad condition. He's afraid there could be an accidental fire in his house, which could put his family's life at risk.
He'll repay the loan by using part of the salary he receives for his work, since it's his only source of income for his family.
He wishes to provide his children with a better heritage and a safe, comfortable place.

loans.use: to install electrical wiring in his house.

loans.name: Scorpion Group

texts.es:
Ellas se nombraron Scorpion, se reconocen como un grupo de carácter y decidido a salir a delante. Su líder es Maria Cristina, mujer, esposa y madre. Entrega a su faena diaria y determinada a cumplir al frente del grupo. A ella nada la detiene, y como ella dice: “Vendo lo que sea… me gusta sentirme útil y ser un ejemplo para mis hijos”.
Ella está encargada de la cooperativa de la escuela y se ha comprometido con este crédito para resurtir la tienda de mercancía variada y snacks para los niños.
Maria Cristina está convencida que el trabajo y la constancia le permiten  ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para los suyos y propio.
texts.en:
They named themselves Scorpion.  They are known as a group that has character and is determined to get ahead.

Cristina is their leader.  She is a wife and a mother.  She dedicates herself to her daily work, and she is determined to serve as the head of the group.  No one stops her.  As she says, “I sell whatever…I like feeling useful and being an example for my children”.

She is in charge of the school cooperative, and she has pledged to use this loan to restock the store with various merchandise and snacks for the children.

Maria Cristina is convinced that the work and perseverance will allow her to provide herself and her loved ones with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for a snack store.

loans.name: Imbinga Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a member of Imbinga Group in Kakamega North District, is pictured standing on the right with her hand raised, with 14 One Acre Fund farmers, 10 women and 4 men. Elizabeth, a new One Acre Fund farmer excited for the 2013 Long Rains season, is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, use her increased profits to send her children to school, and buy a cow.

Elizabeth managed to harvest nine bags of maize on one acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more! Elizabeth’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for seven acres of millet and sorghum.

The field officer is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 37 year-old married man. He has four children whose ages range from 2 years to 8 years. He describes himself to be honest and ambitious. He operates a motorcycle and provides motorcycle transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located at a convenient business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the frequent breakdown of the motorcycle. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to be the best transport provider in his home town within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay a previous loan of Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es:
Clelia, de 53 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos y sus padres en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años decidió generar su propia fuente de trabajo. Fue así que compró una fotocopiadora  y luego alquilo un pequeño espacio en el centro de la ciudad, muy  cercana a varias instituciones educativas  en donde tiene más afluencia de clientes.  Todas las mañanas se dirige  a su espacio para dedicarse a sacar copias de los pedidos que le hacen, de esta manera consigue los ingresos necesarios para su familia, en algunas ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan, afirma que lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que es por horas y además de ser muy rentable  aunque en algunas ocasiones su máquina requiere de  mantenimiento, su meta es tener  una maquina más  efectiva  que le permita ahorrar el tiempo en  el servicio de fotocopiado que brinda .
Clelia, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de hojas por millar y abastecimiento de tinta para la fotocopiadora que tiene , además se siente muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe , el cual le permite crecer su negocio .
texts.en:
53-year-old Clelia lives with her two children and her parents in a house she owns. Five years ago she decided to get a means of livelihood of her own. That's why she bought a photocopier and soon thereafter she rented a small space in the town centre. It is very close to several educational institutions and there she attracts a larger number of customers. Every morning she heads out to her store and makes copies according to the orders she gets, and that's how she earns the income that her family needs. She gets help from her children on occasion. She reports that what she likes about her work is that it's part-time and also very profitable. However, her equipment occasionally requires maintenance. Her goal is to own a more efficient piece of equipment which allows her to save time in providing photocopying services.
Clelia will use the 2000 nuevos soles to purchase paper sheets in units of one thousand and replenish the ink for her photocopier. In addition, she feels very glad to get financial support, which allows her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase printing ink and paper for a photocopier.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir creciendo en el negocio. Este le permitirá comprar tres quintales de harinilla para los cerdos que ya posee y también concentrado lechero para las vacas que tiene, así aumentar la productividad.
El crédito anterior le genero ganancias y debido a esta inversión le ayudo a mantener todos los animales sin tener que venderlos para cubrir la demanda. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y con ello ha logrado darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, alimentación y educación.
texts.en:
Julia is asking for a new loan so that she can continue to grow her business. Her previous loan allowed her to buy three hundred kilos of middling (coarsely ground wheat mixed with bran) for her pigs and also concentrate (food pellets) for her cows. This increases her productivity.
That last loan generated more earnings for her and these earnings helped her to care for all of her animals. She did not have to sell any in order to cover her costs. Her economic conditions have improved and she is able to provide a better quality of life for her children by providing them with food and an education.

loans.use: to buy three hundred kilos of middling (coarsely ground wheat mixed with bran) for her pigs and also concentrate (food pellets) for her cows.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel, a married man, is a hardworking person and has five children.  One is married and the other four go to school. He rents a house with neither electricity nor piped water.

For the last seven years he has been doing farming as a source of livelihood but now he sells boiled eggs in the streets.  With a loan of Kshs40,000, he will buy more eggs for sale and will pay school fees for his children. His customers are travelers and passers-by.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for sale and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio, de 44 años de edad , está casado con Sonia, con quien tiene 5 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia.
Desde muy joven conoció la responsabilidad y el trabajo arduo que le enseño la agricultura , actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 26 años aproximadamente, sus principales sembríos constan de papa ,alverja y habas; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues sabe que cada día es vital para poder tener una buena cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los últimos días del periodo de maduración de sus cultivos, pues ve concretado su esfuerzo. Asimismo cuenta que paralelo a este trabajo se dedica a la crianza de sus 50 carneros, los cuales engorda para después venderlos a un carnicero de la localidad . Por ahora, desea seguir produciendo la tierra y cuidando de sus animales, los cuales realiza con la ayuda de sus 2 caballos que le sirven como trasporte, sus 2 toros que le ayudan en el arado de la tierra y sus 2 vacas que producen la leche que consume diariamente.Este es el séptimo crédito con Kiva y se siente muy contento pues encontró una oportunidad para salir adelante.
Emilio, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembrios en está temporada agrícola.
texts.en:
44-year-old Emilio is married to Sonia. Together they have five children who are cared for in a house he owns.
Ever since he was very young, he has known how to be responsible and work hard, which he learned from agriculture. He has been in this line of business for about 26 years. His main crops are potatoes, peas and fava beans, and he takes great care of them, because he knows that each day is vital for obtaining a good harvest. What he likes the most about his work is the last days of the ripening period of his crops, because he sees his efforts materialized. Besides, he reports that in addition to this work he raises 50 rams, which he fattens for later selling to a local butcher. For now he wishes to continue sowing the land and looking after his animals. She does this with the help of his two horses which serve as transportation, his two bulls which help him to plough the land, and his two cows which produce the milk he drinks on a daly basis. This is his seventh Kiva loan and he feels very happy, because he found an opportunity to get ahead.
Emilio will use the 1000 soles to purchase organic compost in order to nourish his crops during this agricultural season.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor, es un hombre admirable y trabajador de, 57 años; que junto a su esposa Natividad, cuidó con amor y esmero de sus 9 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 4 de ellos en la casa rústica que construyó hace algunos años.Desde muy joven se dedico al negocio de sus padres, “la agricultura”, tiene 30 años de experiencia en el rubro. En todo este tiempo logró obtener sus propios terrenos agrícolas, en donde siembra papa, alverja, oyuco, zanahoria y flor de gladiolo; los que después de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y trabajo, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, pero que en campaña agrícola, los comercializa en la capital del país, donde obtiene mayores ganancias. Pero como buen hombre del campo, Nicanor también se dedica a la ganadería, donde gracias a sus 8 vacas, todas las mañanas saca leche y hace queso. Vendiéndolo a los comerciantes minoristas que visitan la zona; además de cuidar y vacunar a sus animales constantemente. Él está feliz de vivir en el campo por ello está trabajando para mejorar sus cultivos y así obtener mayor rentabilidad.
Nicanor, invertirá los S/.3000 en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembrios y comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en: Nicanor is a hardworking and admirable 57 year-old man. Along with his wife, Natividad, he cares for his nine children with love and care. Out of the nine, four live with them in a rustic house that he built many years ago. Since he was very young, he has been working in the same occupation as his parents, farming. He has been farming for the past thirty years. During this period he has worked to obtain his own agricultural land where he grows potatoes, beans, Peruvian potatoes, carrots and gladiolas. After a lot of effort, dedication and hard work he sells his products in the wholesale market in the capital of his country. This is where he gets the best price. As a good man of the countryside, Nicanor also works as a dairyman. He has eight cows. Every day he milks them and he uses the milk to make cheese. He sells the cheese to small merchants who visit his area. He constantly has to care for and vaccinate his animals. He is glad he lives in the countryside. He is working to improve his crop production and thereby increase his profits. Nicanor will use 3000 soles to buy organic fertilizer for his crops and feed for his animals.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and feed for his animals

loans.name: Santos Isaac

texts.es:
Santos, se dedica a la agricultura, es decir, siembra de maíz y frijol. Él está casado, tiene 27 años de edad y disfruta de dos hijas las cuales tiene 4 y 6 años de edad.
Santos además de realizar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, trabaja como jornalero para mantener su hogar también vende leña en la zona. El préstamo lo necesita para preparar la tierra y para comprar la semilla para la próxima siembra de invierno. La inversión le será de mucha ayuda, le permitirá disponer de la tierra en el momento oportuno y así obtener una buena cosecha.
Su sueño es ayudarle a sus hijas siempre para que salgan a delante y puedan superarse, mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is a corn and bean farmer. He is married, 27 years old and he enjoys his girls who are four and six years old. In addition to growing corn and beans, Santos works as a day laborer in order to maintain his home. Also he sells firewood in his area. This loan he will use to prepare his land and buy seed for the next winter growing season. This investment will be a great help, as it will permit him to use the land at the most useful time and therefore have a good crop.
His dream is to help his daughter’s progress and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to prepare his land and to buy seed.

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene una imprenta. El vive con su familia, su esposa de 60 años, sus dos hijas de 30 y 35 años de edad. La imprenta nace desde hace 30 años, es ahí donde inicia a realizar las labores y lo lleva a cabo todos los días. 
El préstamo que solicita es porque lo invertirá en papelería, tinta entre otros. Esta compra le ayudara ya que le permitirá fortaleces su trabajo. Su objetivo es tener un buen record  en su negocio y sacar adelante  a su familia siempre.
texts.en:
Pedro has a printing press. He lives with his family: his wife, 60, and his two daughters, ages 30 and 35. The printing press began 30 years ago. That is where he started working and continues to work every day.

The loan he is requesting is to buy stationery, ink  and other supplies. This purchase will help him, as it will allow him to build up his business. His aim is to see his business do well, and always help his family to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy stationery,ink and other supplies.

loans.name: Enoc Millan

texts.es:
Enoc, se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería. Él está acompañado; el oficio de la albañilería lo aprendió trabajando  como ayudante y la agricultura con su padre, ya tiene 24 años de realizar dicha actividad. 
El préstamo le ayudara para comprar insumos agrícolas y preparar la tierra para el cultivo. Este le permitirá tener listo el terreno para cultivar y los insumos necesarios para el momento de realizarlo obtener   una buena producción.
texts.en:
Enoc is a farmer and construction worker. He lives with his partner. He learned construction work by working as a helper, and learned farming from his father. He already has 24 years doing this work. 

The loan will help him to buy agricultural supplies and to prepare the soil for the crop. This will allow him to have the land ready to cultivate, and to have the necessary supplies at hand, in order to get good production.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and prepare the soil for the crop.

loans.name: Delmy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Delmy, tiene una venta de lácteos. Ella tiene 65 años de edad y vive en casa propia, ya lleva 10 años de tener el negocio, lo hizo por iniciativa propia para mantener el hogar. 
El préstamo que requiere le servirá para comprar queso, crema, leche entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su mercadería, aumentar la clientela y sus ingresos.

Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio para obtener mejores ingresos y así tener un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Delmy sells dairy products. She is 65 and lives in her own house. She has had the business for 10 years now. She started it on her own initiative, in order  to support the household. The loan she needs will help her to buy cheese, cream, milk and other products. 

This investment will help her add to her merchandise, increase her clientele and her income. Her objective is to build up the business so that she can earn a better income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cheese, cream, milk and other products.

loans.name: Lucinda Menelberta

texts.es:
Lucinda es una mujer de 59 años, se preparó en la escuela secundaria y no tuvo la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios universitarios, por lo que trabajó desde muy joven y luego se casó con José quien ahora tiene 67 años y ejerce su profesión d chofer. Tuvieron un hijo quien ahora es independiente. Lucinda vive en la Parroquia de Río Verde, un lugar histórico de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Lucinda desde hace 3 años emprendió con el establecimiento de una papelería para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, lo atiende paralelamente con los quehaceres de su hogar, pues este local está ubicado en el mismo lugar de su domicilio. Lucinda busca ofrecer variedad de productos y satisfacer a los clientes de todas las edades, es por esto que también ofrece algunos víveres y golosinas para que sus ventas se incrementen. Ella invierte varias horas al día en la atención de su negocio y su crecimiento ha sido estancado debido a la falta de apoyo para el financiamiento. Gracias a algunos amigos con los que hace un tiempo se unió para obtener un crédito grupal, pudo conocer el buen servicio que brinda Fundación Alternativa, por lo que decidió acudir a ellos para solicitar un crédito individual el cual lo ocupará en la compra de productos para surtir su negocio, de esta forma podrá obtener mayor utilidad y así cumplir con su objetivo de tener ingresos estables y un negocio reconocido en su ciudad que le permitan llevar una mejor calidad de vida. Lucinda agradece la intervención de Kiva para obtener este crédito y agradece a todos quienes apoyan sus sueños de ella y muchos emprendedores con su granito de arena.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a 59 year-old woman. She has attended secondary school but did not have the opportunity to continue her studies at the university as she has worked since she was very young and she married José, who is 67 years old and works as a driver. They have one child who lives on his own. Lucinda lives in the Rio Verde area, which is a historic area of Santo Domingo, the capital of the province of Santo Domingo of the “Tsachilas”, a province in Ecuador. In the last few years this area has grown quite a bit. The capital is a city, which is known for its delicious fruits and for the food that is prepared there. There is also a lot of trade, as it is becoming a commercial center for the mountain and coastal regions of the country. Also, there are a lot of tourist attractions as it has a temperate climate. Many local and international tourists visit here. This is why most of the people are business people or they offer services for the locals or the tourists.
Lucinda, three years ago, started a stationary business in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She is able to do this business along with her housework, as this business is located in her house. Lucinda offers a variety of products for customers of all ages. She also sells candies and other fresh grocery items in order to increase her sales. She attends to her customers many hours of the day. Her business is stagnant because she doesn’t have financial support. Thanks to some of her friends who belong to a credit group, she was able to learn about the services offered by the Alternative Foundation. She decided to join them in order to ask for a personal loan in order to buy more supplies for her business. In this way she can develop a better business and therefore reach her objective of have a stable income and a business known throughout the city. This will help her have a better quality of life. Lucinda is thankful for the help of KIVA in obtaining this loan and is thankful to those that support her dreams and the dreams of many small businesspeople with a small grain of sand.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her business.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a 34-year-old married man with two children, ages 2 and 5 years old.  He describes himself to be an honest man.  He operates a motorcycle transportation service and has been involved in this business for 3 years.  His business is located in a busy urban area.  Albert describes his biggest business challenge to be the frequent breakdowns of the motorcycle.  His business goal is to be the best transport service provider within 5 years. 

Albert will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy secondhand clothes in order to start a new business.  This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes in order to start a new business.

loans.name: Hortensia Magaly

texts.es:
Hortensia, se dedica a la venta de ropa; tiene 25 años de edad, vive con sus padres y le ayuda a ellos con el negocio; ya posee tres años de realizarlo, este oficio lo aprendió con una tía, la cual le ayuda con la venta ya que lo lleva a cabo de lunes a viernes.
El préstamo que requiere adquirir le permitirá comprar diversidad de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer más su negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Hortensia sells clothing. She is 25 years old, lives with her parents, and helps them with the business. She has been doing this for three years now. She  learned this occupation from an aunt, who helps her sell, as she carries on her business from Monday to Friday. 

The loan she needs to get will allow her to buy a variety of women's, men's, and children's clothing. This investment will help her to increase her inventory and obtain greater income. Her dream is to build up her business and offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Renelda

texts.en: Renelda is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of five young children.  She is from Bien Unido, Bohol.  She, together with her husband, is engaged in the fishing business for more than 6 years.  Renelda is asking for a loan to buy more fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks.  With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell.  In the future, Renelda hopes of making her business a success and of saving money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fishing  gear (nets, lead weights, hooks, etc.)

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
This is Adora. She previously accessed a loan of 40,000 PHP which she used to buy spare parts and to cover the maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 40,000 PHP to buy more parts and to cover the maintenance costs of her computer shop. The profits from her business will help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adora dreams of having a good future and hopes to expand her business, all by the grace of God. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week where she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Khaka Group

texts.en:
Khaka is a group of 17 farmers in Chwele District. It is represented by Catherine. The group has 14 women and 3 men. Catherine is on the righthand side of the photo with her hand raised. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half-acre of millet and sorghum. Catherine is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined the One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and benefit from other top-ups like solar lights.

Last year, Catherine harvested 7 bags of maize on one acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Catherine’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8 half-acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is a nurse with many years of work experience. She graduated from Vanadzor State Medical College and now works as a nurse in the Neurology Section of one of the hospitals of Vanadzor city. She has a good reputation and many of her citizens know her as a good specialist. Besides working in the clinic she also conducts private therapy in her own house. She has all the necessary tools for this activity. Her clients are very pleased with her and in case of any problem with their health they immediately ask for her help. 

Seda is 50 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. She is a widow and lives with her only daughter. Seda has had a very hard life. After the death of her husband she worked day and night in order to sustain the life of not only her daughter, but also to help her clients with health problems. Besides this she has always been engaged in self-learning to improve her knowledge. The citizens of Vanadzor city know her and love her.

Seda needs the support of Kiva Lenders. She needs a loan of 400,000 AMD to buy some medical tools and a new computer in order to research new methods of treatment.

loans.use: to buy some medical tools and a new computer in order to research new methods of treatment.

loans.name: Joy Group

texts.en:
Jane is pictured on the right, with her hand raised, amongst her fellow Joy Group members. The 12 of them - eleven women and one man - are farmers in Kakamega North District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant one half-acre of millet and sorghum. Jane joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Jane joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use the increased profits to send her children to school. 

Jane described her harvest last year as good as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Jane’s group members will take input loans of one half-acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Richard is a member of Tumaini Group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured as one of the 10 One Acre Fund farmers: three women and seven men. Richard is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for one half-acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Richard’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Richard managed to harvest 7 bags of maize on one and a half acres of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer he hopes to harvest even more! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Richard’s group members will take input loans of one half-acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés de 55 años de edad, era un humilde campesino dedicado a labrar la tierra para generar el sustento para su familia, compuesta por su esposa y cuatro hijos. Desde hace 14 años reside en la ciudad de Medellín, debido a que fue desplazado para las fuerzas armadas.
Sin experiencia y dinero, debió abandonar lo que construyó con su esfuerzo y años de trabajo. Cuenta que en la ciudad conseguir un empleo se convirtió en una utopía debido a su carencia educativa, por lo cual buscó otras alternativas para generarle a su familia vivienda y alimentación. De esta manera inicio con la venta de dulces y tinto de manera ambulante en las calles de la ciudad. Gracias a esta actividad, Andrés ha logrado salir adelante y ofrecerles a sus hijos educación.
Su mayor sueño es comprar una vivienda para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Andrés is 55 years old and was a humble farmer dedicated to working the land to make a living for his family, which consists of his spouse and four children. For the past 14 years he has lived in the city of Medellín due to displacement by armed forces. 

Without experience and money, he had to abandon all that he had constructed with his effort and years of work. He says that finding work in the city seemed like a utopia due to his lack of education, which made him search for other alternatives to bring his family a home and food. In this way he began with the sale of sweets and drinks walking along the streets of the city. Thanks to this activity, Andrés has managed to move forward and offer an education to his children.

His big dream is to buy a home to bring his family better living conditions. That is reason he is asking for this loan, which he will invest in the purchase of products with the goal of increasing his sales.

loans.use: to purchase products (sweets, coffee)

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es:
Fredy, se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias. Él tiene 33 años  de edad, vive con su mama y posee   casa propia; tiene 10 años de realizar el trabajo propio, ya que se dedica al cultivo de maíz  para obtener ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar,  este oficio lo aprendió con sus padres y lo lleva acabo de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12:00.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar 6 sacos de abono, 3 sacos de formula y 3 sacos de sulfato; dicho préstamo le ayudara a aumentar la productividad  de granos básicos e incrementar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones económicas y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, fortalecer la inversión que realiza.
texts.en:
Fredy dedicates himself to farming. He is 33 years old, likes with his mother, and has his own house. He has spent ten years on his own work, dedicating himself to the cultivation of corn to earn an income and cover home expenses. He learned this trade with his parents and performs it from Monday to Saturday from 6:00 to 12:00.

This loan that he needs will permit him to buy six bags of fertilizer, 3 sacks of plant formula, and 3 sacks of sulfate. He says this loan would help him to increase his basic grain crop and increment his sales.

His dream is to improve his economic condition and thus provide a better quality of life to his family, strengthening the investment he is making.

loans.use: to purchase 6 bags of fertilizer, 3 bags of plant formula, and three bags of sulfate.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 55 years old. He lives in Khoni District with his 50-year-old wife Mzia and retired mother. Tengiz requested loans from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

His family owns a small plot of land where they grow kiwi and sell it locally at the markets. Tengiz’s wife Mzia is a teacher of biology. She has private students and gets a small monthly salary. In addition they have income from Tengiz’s mother’s monthly pension.

Tengiz requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Tengiz wants to purchase counters and anti-parasite drugs. He has a shop where he plans to sell the products. As tilling season is starting soon and people will start cultivating their land, Tengiz hopes his product will be demanded from the locals. As he will work the shop himself and will not have to pay rent, the business will be more profitable. He will reinvest part of the profit into the same business and use the rest for his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase counters and anti-parasite drugs to sell from his shop.

loans.name: Central Group

texts.en:
Mebo is a member of the Central Group in the Kakamega North district.  She is pictured with 24 One Acre Fund farmers, 19 women and 5 men.  Mebo is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation.  Mebo first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Mebo joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer in order to grow enough food for the family.

Mebo reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 1 bag of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 3 bags per 1/2 acre!  She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Mebo’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 12 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Umoja Group is located in Kakamega North District. It is a group of 8 women and 2 men led by Felistus who is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for a half-acre of millet and sorghum cultivation. Felistus joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Felistus joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for her family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Felistus was only able to harvest three and a half bags of maize per half-acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 9 bags per half-acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Felistus’s group members will take input loans of one half-acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en: Mzia is 57 years old. She is from Sagarejo district, West Georgia. She lives with her son and daughter-in-law. Her daughter-in-law teaches at the local school and gets a monthly income. Mzia has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. She milks the cow and produces cheese to sell at the local markets. Besides this she has a greenhouse. Mzia is very hard working woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and for renovating the greenhouse. After the greenhouse is renovated, she will sow different kinds of vegetables to sell. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Mzia awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a greenhouse and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: This is 44 year-old Issa. He is married and has three children who are aged twelve, eight and two years. In 2003, Issa established his lubricant and inner tires business. He began his business to be self reliant. Working six days a week and thirteen hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Issa requires a loan in order to buy drums of engine oil and motor bicycle spare parts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 900,000 SLL. In the future, Issa plans to rent a shop in the centre of the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drums of engine oil and motor bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 22 años de edad es una mujer soltera, trabajadora y joven. Vive en compañía de sus padres a los que cuida en la casa que ellos construyeron. Desde los primeros rayos de sol se dirige a nutrir sus sembríos y esparcir las nuevas semillas que brotaran en los terrenos agrícolas que le heredaron sus padres ,“Me siento feliz de comenzar de manera independiente en la agricultura”, afirma. Sus principales sembríos constan de alverja, papa, habas y demás productos agrícolas, los cuales vende en la ciudad de Tarma de donde obtiene buenas ganancias, comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar una carrera técnica, por lo que su mayor sueño es estudiar en la universidad. Ahora desea seguir trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para continuar ayudando a su familia y a su vez lograr sus objetivos.  Éste sería su primer crédito con KIVA y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Nancy, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Nancy, 22 years old, is a woman who is single, hardworking, and young. She lives in the company of her parents, caring for them in the house they constructed. From the first rays of sun she works on caring for her crops and spreading new seed which will sprout in the land which she inherited from her parents. "I feel happy to become independent in agriculture," she affirms. Her principal plants are peas, potatoes, beans, and other agricultural products which she sells in the town of Tarma where she gains good earnings. She comments that thanks to her effort she was able to study a professional degree, and her biggest dream is to study in the university. Now she wants to continue working hard to keep helping her family and also gain her objectives. This would be her first loan with Kiva and she promises to pay her quotas in a punctual manner. Nancy will invest the 1000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to feed her plants.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik is 50 years old and lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and their only son. Rafik is a mechanic. He had many years of work experience as a mechanic in some factories of Vanadzor city but after the collapse of the Soviet Union many factories in Armenia were closed, and many Armenian specialists such as Rafik lost their jobs. 

Rafik didn't stay unemployed for long. He soon started to engage in a new activity, which brought him many successes. He delivers eggs, hens, chicken, and cocks to shops, markets and other trading centers in the Lori region. He obtains this merchandise for delivering from poultry farms in Armenia. Rafik is the main deliverer of such goods in the Lori region.

Rafik is seeking from Kiva lenders a loan of 500,000 AMD to increase the quantities of eggs, hens, chicken and cocks he delivers. Rafik anticipates receiving more profit and he would be pleased with the support.

loans.use: to increase the quantities of eggs, hens, chicken and cocks he delivers.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo, porque requiere de más dinero para invertir en la productividad de granos básicos y así aumentar sus ingresos. Este le permitirá cancelar el alquiler del terreno, compra de insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.
Con el crédito anterior aumento la producción  y sus utilidades las invirtió en los gastos del hogar. Las condiciones económicas han mejorar ya que los ingresos incrementaron con la inversión que realizo.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan because he needs more money to invest in the production of basic grains to help increase his income. This allows him to pay for renting land and for the purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides to cultivate corn and beans.

With the earlier loan he increased the production and invested his profits in home expenses. His economic condition has improved and now his income is increasing with the investment he made.

loans.use: to rent land and buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 44 años de edad, se encuentra radicado en el municipio de Sonsón, Colombia, en donde se dedica desde hace catorce años a la elaboración de herraduras en un pequeño taller ubicado en su vivienda. Gracias a su actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y brindarle mejores oportunidades de vida, pues sus hijos se encuentran estudiando, y como familia humilde no carecen de los servicios básicos.
Carlos es un hombre lleno de sueños, los cuales espera convertirlos en realidad y uno de ellos es poder ampliar su negocio e incrementar su nivel de ventas, convirtiéndose en el mayor distribuidor de herraduras en su municipio. Razón por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de materia prima (hierro, caucho, plástico y cuero). 
Espera que con dicha inversión pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y cumplir su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old, and lives in the municipality of Sonsón, Colombia, where, for the past fourteen years, he has dedicated himself to the creation of horseshoes in a little workshop located in his house. Thanks to this activity he has managed to move his family forward and offer them better opportunities in life. Now his children are studying, and because the humble family does not find itself lacking in basic services.

Carlos is a man full of dreams which he hopes to make into reality, and one of them is to be able to expand his business and increase his level of purchase, changing into the largest distributer of horseshoes in the municipality. This is the reason he is asking for this loan which will be used for the purchase of raw materials (iron, rubber, plastic, and leather).

He hopes with this investment he would be able to improve the quality of life for his family and achieve his big dream.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (iron, rubber, plastic, and leather).

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has three children who are 19, 15 and 12 years old. In 2008, Isatu established her groundnut business. She began her business because she wanted to be gainfully employed by herself to meet her daily needs and wants. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan to buy more bags of groundnuts. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000. In the future, Isatu plans to save enough money to enhance the quality of education for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candy, cookies, chocolate, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs, feed for them, and vitamins.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, tiene una granja de pollos. Él vive con su familia, su esposa e hijos de edades de 4, 6 y 9 años de edad, no tiene familiares en el extranjero.  El oficio lo aprendió por medio de una  asociación de (MAG – PRODEMORO estatal) quien les apoya con capacitación técnica, les donaron una encubadora para procrear pollos, esto lo realizan desde hace un año. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá para comprar concentrado para pollos y para el fortalecimiento de la granja. Esto le ayudara a crecer en el negocio, ya que la demanda es bastante a nivel de la zona oriental.
Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen académicamente, para que en el futuro sean profesionales y personas de bien; también  mejorar el negocio.
texts.en:
José has a poultry farm. He lives with his family, which consists of his wife and children (ages 4, 6, and 9). José does not have relatives who live abroad. He learned his trade from the MAG – PRODEMORO Assocation, which provides support through technical training and a donated incubator for raising chickens. This support is provided for one year.

The loan José is requesting will be used to buy concentrated feed for the chickens, which will strengthen his farm and help grow his business. Demand is quite level in the eastern region. His dream is for his children to be prepared academically so that they will become professionals and well-rounded people in the future. He also wants to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Diana Alexandra

texts.es:
Diana de 30 años de edad, es una guerrera, que ha tenido que luchar incansablemente para sacar adelante a su hija de doce años, pues su cónyuge nunca se hizo responsable de la paternidad. Lo cual no fue impedimento para que esta mujer dejara sus sueños a un lado y por el contrario convirtió a su hija en el mayor aliciente para querer cumplir su proyecto de vida y ofrecerle mejores condiciones.
Gracias al apoyo de su familia que le ayudaron a cuidar a su hija mientras ella trabajaba y estudiaba, esta mujer logró terminar un curso en cosmetología y a los seis meses siguientes tomó la decisión de invertir sus ahorros en el montaje de su propio negocio e inició con un spa ubicado en su vivienda. En la actualidad labora diariamente de lunes a sábado de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche. 
Diana asegura que su mayor deseo es adquirir un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de mercancía ya que su negocio se encuentra en crecimiento y desea poder suministrarles a sus clientes una buena calidad en el servicio.
texts.en:
Diana is 30 years old and a fighter. She has had to fight tirelessly to move forward with her 2-year-old child. Her husband never took responsibility of his fatherhood. That was not an obstacle for this woman to leave her dreams aside and, to the contrary, make her daughter be the greatest incentive to want to complete her life project and offer her better conditions. 

Thanks to the support of her family who helped watch her daughter while she worked and studied, this woman successfully completed a course in cosmetics, and 6 months later she made the decision to invest her savings in setting up her own business. She started with a spa located in her home. Currently, she works daily from Monday to Saturday, from 8 in the morning to 8 at night. 

Diana is sure that her greatest desire is to acquire a loan that she will invest in the purchase of merchandise. Her business is in a period of growth and she wants to be able to provide her customers with a good quality of service.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (kit of wooden massage tools, towels, and gel)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ladies' bags to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Mwenda Pole Group

texts.en:
Jacklyne is a member of the Mwenda Pole Group in Kakamega North District. She is pictured with 11 One Acre Fund farmers, nine women and two men. Jacklyne is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of millet and sorghum cultivation. Jacklyne first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Jacklyne joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Jacklyne described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to buy a cow. Jacklyne’s group members will each receive input loans of half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 5.5 acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of  millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Luvuro Farmers Group

texts.en:
Isaya’s group has 25 farmers and is located in Kakamega North District. Isaya is pictured on the right of the Luvuro farmers Group with his hand raised. Isaya is pictured amongst the 15 men and 10 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting half an acre with sorghum, millet and sweet potatoes. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Isaya’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices. 

Isaya managed to harvest five bags of maize on 2 acres of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Isaya’s group will receive 12.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira lives in Gugark village in Lori region. She is a hairdresser and works in one of the beauty salons of Vanadzor city. She has many customers in her village. In the past, she has also worked in different beauty salons of Vanadzor city as a hairdresser. She performs only women’s hairdressing. Over the years, she has become experienced in her profession, and now she is able to provide good hairdressing services to the women and girls of her village.

Naira is only 30 years old and lives with her parents and sister. Her sister works in a shop as a seller. Her parents don't work, and now Naira and her sister are working very hard in order to sustain their family.

Naira just finished cosmetology courses, which she liked very much. She now intends to start performing cosmetics services too, as in the Lori region, there are few professional cosmetologists. Her big dream is to have her own beauty salon, and she hopes that in the future, her dreams will come true.

Naira needs a loan amount of 500,000 Armenian drams to run her new cosmetic activity and to buy tools and cosmetics.

loans.use: To run her new cosmetics activity and to buy tools and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has a grocery business in Emali town, where she sells and supplies tomatoes to several markets and customers. She sells the tomatoes in crates, and this has been profitable for the past 13 years that she has been in this business. She is 42 years old, married and has three children.

This being her second loan term with KADET LTD, she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of tomatoes to sell. This will enable her to have enough stock of tomatoes to supply to her customers. She also anticipates making more profits, with which she will pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business by buying a lorry (truck) to help her supply tomatoes to other towns, and hence, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Barkat

texts.en:
Barkat is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He started a small café business, and when he accumulated an amount of money, he thought to open a small grocery store.

He is a hardworking man who strives to offer his family a good life. Many people prefer his grocery store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish. 

Recently, he couldn't restock his business due to the lack of money, which is why he is asking for a youth loan of 100,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to stock his business with more grocery products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.use: to stock his business with more grocery products.

loans.name: Kibuga B Bataka Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
Dinah is a hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer but also operates a retail shop in order to raise money for her family. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations are her major hardships; however, she has a vision of paying school fees for her children to higher levels of education and becoming one of the model farmers in the area.

She is a member of the above mentioned group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing the loan. Dinah intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and chemicals.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and chemicals.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his relatives in Hodeida, Yemen. He is a person who hires out motor transports for customers. He started his business with a small amount of capital. He has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport service, from which he earns a monthly profit. 

He applied for a youth loan of 120,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB. He is going to buy a motorbike to use for hiring to customers. He will use the profits to continue growing his business. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to use for hiring to customers.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Joseph’s group has 17 farmers and is located in Kakamega North District. Joseph is pictured on the right of Mwangaza Group with his hand raised. Joseph is pictured amongst the four men and 13 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting half an acre with sorghum and millet. Joseph first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains season, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Joseph joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Joseph reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about three bags of maize per half acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 8 bags per half acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Joseph’s group will receive 8.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 38 years old. She lives in Kobuleti district with her 43-year-old husband Edward, retired mother in-law and an infant child. 

Madona has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Madona’s husband Edward is an artisan and works on private orders to get a small monthly income. Their additional income is Edwards’s mother’s pension. 
 
Madona has requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the credit received, Madona will purchase all the equipment required for a beauty salon. She has rented a commercial space and will hire professionals to start a business. The rented space is in a crowded area and Madona hopes that it will attract good numbers of clients and will bring a good profit. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase all the equipment required to open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline used the previous loan to buy clothes and cosmetics to sell. She is a married woman with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For four years, she has been operating a salon and a boutique shop. With the income earned, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and buy land for farming. She has always had a passion for fashion and this drove her to start the business. Inadequate capital is affecting business growth. Her plan is to set up a fashion school and expand business to new areas. Jacqueline is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell and cosmetics to sell ahead of the Easter season when she expects increased sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 23 years old. She lives in Lagodekhi District with her 26-year-old husband, Abram, and an infant child, Nikoloz (3 years old). Maka requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the small monthly salary of Abram. He is an artisan. Abram gets private orders on renovations to paint walls and spread the floor.

Maka requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Maka will purchase a milk cow. She will milk the cow to make dairy products to sell locally at the markets. This will increase the family income, and Maka will be able to provide better living conditions for her husband and child.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with three children, all of whom attend school. She is also looks after another family member (a younger brother).

She has been operating a small eating place from the market for three years, working six days a week. She has no other source of income.

Esther has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to be able to purchase ingredients such as salt, cooking oil, dried peas and beans and to replace some worn out utensils. Her challenges include seasonality, defaulters and transportation. Esther's dream is to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a piece of land and build premises where to operate from.  She joined MCDT because of low interest charged on loans. Esther rents a house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business, such as cooking oil, dried peas and beans, and also to replace used utensils.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 35 years old and lives at Paynesville south in Montserrado County the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is married with three children between 12 and 2 years old who are in school and live at home. She is a high school graduate. For the past five years, she has been running a shop in her community where she sells rice, oil, milk, tomatoes, butter, bread cubes, flour, etc, She started this with sell pay (the Liberian ways of doing business where you  take the goods from the supplier, sell it, keep the profit and return the principle to the supplier). She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, milk, tomatoes butter, bread cubes and other items for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman. She says nothing makes her smile like her business.

loans.use: to purchase more  rice, oil, milk, tomatoes, butter, bread, etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 53 years old, married and a father of five children. He operates a primary school as his main business in Malindi, where he earns a monthly income of about KES.25, 000.
