Julius was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and has applied for a loan of KES. 100,000. He has applied for the loan to purchase additional items such as school desks, chalk and writing boards for use in the school.

Julius intends to continue growing his school and hopes that one day he will turn it into a reputable boarding school in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as school desks, chalk and writing boards for use in the school that he operates.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child.

She has been selling sweets, biscuits and cigarettes in the market at retail prices for the last three years, working seven days a week. Scovia does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to purchase stocks of chewing gum, lollipops, toffees and biscuits to sell. 

Scovia's challenges include transport. Her dream is to open a shop. She joined MCDT because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.
					4

loans.use: to buy more stocks of chewing gum, lollipops, toffees and biscuits to sell at the market.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 43 years old and married to Catherine who contributes to the family income. He has been in the business for a period of about 12 years with an income of KES 50,000 a month.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans.  He wants to use the loan to add stock of sugar, rice and cereal. 

He hopes to open a wholesale business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cereal

loans.name: Andrijana

texts.en:
Andrijana is 28 years old and is recently married. She lives in a minority community in Kosovo. To earn a living, she cooks in a restaurant and her husband works as a technical worker in a primary school with a very low salary.

Their existing house is very old and damaged; and the furniture is old and uncomfortable. They are planning to have a beautiful house. Unfortunately, they can only see the things that need immediate renovation work. Their salaries are only enough to support basic family needs and she would like to improve their living conditions. 

Now, for the first time, Andrijana is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to renovate her toilet and rooms. With this loan, Andrijana will be able to renovate her house. The family's living conditions will be improved and they will be able to live in a comfortable environment. Andrijana’s goal is to have children and to have a better life. Andrijana is grateful to all Kiva lenders for improving the family's living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for renovating the toilet and other rooms in their house.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is 51 years old, and is married to Justus, who contributes to the family income. She has been running her retais shop for a period of about three years, with a monthly income of approximately KES.20,000.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD, and she wants to use it to buy stocks of baking flour, matchboxes, sugar and rice. Mwikali hopes to have a stable and well financed business and to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy stocks of baking flour, matchboxes, sugar and rice.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 61 years old, married and a father of five children. For the last three years, he has earned a living by renting rooms for residents of Malindi. He earns a monthly income of KES. 26,000 from the business. 

James was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his fourth loan. He has requested a loan of KES. 80,000 to repair his rental rooms for his business, with a view to making them more likable and appealing. James will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his young children.

His goal for the future is to keep on growing the business by building more rooms so that he may improve the financial stability and living standards of his family.

loans.use: to repair his rental rooms, with a view to making them more likeable, so as to attract more customers.

loans.name: Nyati Group

texts.en:
David’s group is made up of 18 farmers and is located in Teso District. David is pictured on the right, with his hand raised. He is pictured amongst the nine men and nine women of his group. 

David will receive an input loan capable of planting ½ an acre of land with sorghum, millet, and sweet potatoes. 

He first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. David joined One Acre Fund in order to rest assured of reliable input delivery and grow enough food for the family.

David reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 1 bag of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 10 bags per ½ acre! 

He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to repair his home and perhaps save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, David’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on nine acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Achileo

texts.en:
Achileo is 41 years old, and is married with two children who both attend school. He is in a transport business where he generates money to look after his family and pay school fees. Achileo has an additional source of income from cattle rearing.

In order to give his family modest accommodation, Achileo is borrowing UGX.1,500,000 to buy building materials to complete the construction of a residential house for his family. One of the challenges he faces is the increasing cost of the construction materials. 

Achileo's dream is to buy his own vehicle to operate a taxi serve, rather than working for someone. This will help him save more and help him to adequately meet all the household requirements.

loans.use: to buy building materials to construct a home for his family.

loans.name: Dinora Cecilia

texts.es:
Dinora, quiere invertir en el nuevo proceso de siembra, realizando el alquiler del terreno donde se dispone a sembrar hortalizas, para esto deberá también comprar fertilizantes, semilla y quiere aprovechar para la compra de queso fresco para la venta.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior , logro tener ganancias del negocio, con estas ganancias a iniciado un nuevo negocio que es la venta de queso.
texts.en:
Dinora wants to invest in the new sowing process – renting land which she can prepare for vegetable sowing. For this she will also have to buy fertilizers and seed, and she wants to take the opportunity to buy queso fresco [fresh cheese] to sell.

The previous loan had a positive effect. She managed to get profits from the business. With these profits she started a new business selling cheese.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seed, and queso fresco [fresh cheese].

loans.name: Gloria Magdalena

texts.es:
Gloria de 53 años de edad, vivió la mayor parte de su vida en el campo, su esposo era mayordomo en una finca de la región. Desde hace catorce años fueron desplazados por la violencia y se trasladaron a la ciudad, pero la situación económica se convirtió en el dolor de cabeza para esta familia, por lo cual doña Gloria comenzó a elaborar arepas con  el fin de ayudarle a  su esposo con los gastos de hogar y la educación de sus siete hijos, ya que el costo de vida era muy elevado y por la falta de educación el salario no alcanzaba a cubrir las necesidades básicas.
En la actualidad trabaja diariamente desde su casa de tres a diez de la mañana, elaborando su producto y luego lo comercializa entre las vecinas del sector y algunas tiendas cercanas.
Su mayor sueño es poder convertir su negocio en una microempresa, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y convertirse en una generadora de empleo en su barrio. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de un fogón a gas, pipeta, parrillas y cuerpo de secadores de arepas, elementos que le permitirán mejorar e incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old and spent the biggest part of her life living in the countryside.  Her husband was a butler in a country house but fourteen years ago, they were displaced from their home due to violence violence and they came to the city.  However financial problems became a real headache for the family so Gloria started to make corn cakes in order to help her husband with the household costs and to pay for their seven children's education.  The cost of life in the city was much higher and with little education they were unable to earn enough to pay for basic necessities.

Now Gloria works at home from 3am to 10am every day.  She makes the cakes and then sells them onto neighbours and some nearby shops.

Gloria's biggest dream is to turn her business into a real micro-enterprise in order to improve her family's standard of living and to be able to provide work to others in her area.  For this reason she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy gas, a pipette, grills and a set of driers for the corn cakes - these items will allow her to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy gas, a pipette, grills and a set of driers for corn cakes.

loans.name: Irma Cristina

texts.es:
Irma, se dedica a  la agricultura y ganadería lo cual le gusta mucho. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y él tiene 37 años; también tiene tres hijos. 
Tiene toda su vida de dedicarse a la siembra de granos básicos y a la ganadería, lo cual lo aprendió  en su familia. El préstamo que requiere es para comprar vacas para engordarlas.
Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su inventario y generar ingresos para aportar a su hogar. Su objetivo es fortalecer su negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Irma works in agriculture and has cattle.  She really enjoys this work.  She is 35 years old and married to a man who is 37 years old.  They have three children.  All her life Irma has worked sowing basic grains and with cattle, having learned the trade in her family.  She needs this loan to buy cows to fatten up.

This loan will help her to increase her inventory and generate more income to support the household.  Irma's objective is to strengthen her business and offer her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten them up.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo de 34 años de edad, se ha caracterizado en su localidad por ser un hombre emprendedor y visionario. Cuenta que desde niño le apasionó el mundo de los negocios, razón por la cual le ayudaba a su padre un una tienda de alimentos. Cuando cumplió los 18 años de edad, su padre le regaló un capital de trabajo para que comenzara con la venta de ropa; de esta manera inició con la creación de su negocio y hoy lleva 16 años dedicado a esta actividad, la cual le ha permitido generar el sustento para su familia, compuesta por su esposa y su hija de tres años de edad.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de mercancía con el propósito de  aumentar sus ventas y cumplirle a sus clientes con los pedidos solicitados. Espera que con dicha inversión mejore su calidad de vida y pueda garantizarle a su hija el acceso a la educación.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 34, has been described by locals as an enterprising and visionary man. He says that ever since he was a kid, he liked the business world, so he helped his father in his food store. When he became 18, his father gave him some capital to start selling clothing. He started this line of work and has been doing it for sixteen years, something that has helped him support his family, composed of his wife and their three-year-old daughter.

Guillermo is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, with the intention to increase his sales and be able to deliver his customers’ orders. He hopes to improve his quality of life with this investment, and to be able to guarantee his daughter access to education.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other items.

loans.name: Gloria Antonia

texts.es:
Gloria, se dedica a la venta de joyas y tortillas para salir adelante. Ella tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y el tiene 24 años;  también tiene una hija de tres años. Ella aprendió el negocio con una hermana y lo realiza de lunes a sábado.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de joyas y maíz, aportando para los dos negocios, para posteriormente vender. Esta compra le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y el inventario. Su objetivo es fortalecer su negocio  y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria works selling jewelry and tortillas to get ahead. She is 22 years old. She is married and he is 24. She also has a three year old daughter. She learned the business with a sister and works Monday through Saturday.

She will invest the loan in buying jewelry and corn, to later sell,  investing in both businesses. This purchase will help her increase her income and inventory. Her objective is to fortify her business and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and corn to later sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials (corn) and to do some improvements on his locale.

loans.name: Sulma Patricia

texts.es:
Sulma, tiene un negocio de venta de comida mexicana. Ella está casada pero su esposo reside en otro departamento, con la ventaja que le ayuda, actualmente vive con una hermana y su hija en casa propia. 
Le nacimiento de este actividad surge por la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos, esto lo aprendió por una amiga que le enseño. El préstamo que requiere le permitirá invertir en la compra de preparativos para la comida como lo es carne, chiles, tomates, pollo entre otros. 
Esta obtención del prestamo le ayudara a tener una mejor clientela, mayores productos y además una mejor calidad de vida para su hija, ya que su sueño radica en ofrecerle educación para que sea una profesional y se mantenga con salud.
texts.en:
Sulma has a business selling Mexican food. She is married but her husband lives in another department, and he does help her. Right now, she lives with a sister and her daughter in her own home. 
 
This activity was born out of the need to improve her income. She learned it from a friend who taught it to her. The loan that she needs will allow her to invest in buying ingredients for her food, such as meat, chile peppers, tomatoes, chicken and more. 

Obtaining this loan will help her have more customers, more products, and a better quality of life for her daughter, since her dream is to give her an education so she can have a good career and stay healthy.

loans.use: to buy meat, chile peppers, tomatoes, chicken and more.

loans.name: Emuyukwe Group

texts.en:
Emuyukwe is a group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District represented by Protus. The group has 7 women and 4 men. Protus is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet and sorghum. Protus joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Protus joined One Acre Fund so that he could access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Protus described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to repair his home and save for the future. Protus’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5 1/2 acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of  millet  and sorghum.

loans.name: Buchwanga Group

texts.en:
Annah’s group has 23 farmers and is located in Kakamega North District. Annah is pictured on the right of the Buchwanga Group with her hand raised. Annah is pictured among the 1 man and 22 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet and sweet potatoes. Annah joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Annah joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices. 

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Annah was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 10 bags per ½ acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Annah’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 11.5 acres of land.   

Saida, one of the farmers of the Buchwanga Group, chose to drop out of the program after the Kiva photo was taken. He is still pictured above.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Jairo Ramón

texts.es: Jairo de 59 años de edad, laboró por más de 15 años como empleado en diferentes negocios de la ciudad, tras quedarse sin empleo y con la obligación de su casa a cargo este hombre, tomó la determinación de auto-emplearse y comenzó a vender de manera ambulante relojería. Desde hace 13 años la Alcaldía de Medellín, Colombia lo reubicó en un local del centro de la ciudad en donde sigue con su actividad de manera más formal. Con esta, ha logrado mejorar su condición económica y ofrecerle a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de surtido (relojes, radios y controles para equipos de sonio y televisión) con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Jairo, 59, worked as an employee for different companies in the city for more than fifteen years. When he lost his job, and aware of his obligations at home, he decided to start his own business and sell watches as a street vendor. Thirteen years ago, the City Hall of Medellín, Colombia, relocated him in an establishment in the city’s center, where he now offers a more formal kind of service. With this activity, he has been able to improve his economic condition and offer his family better life opportunities.

Jairo is requesting a loan to stock his business: watches, radios and remote controls for sound systems and TV sets. His intention is to increase his sales and his income to support his family.

loans.use: to stock his store with watches, radios and remote controls for sound systems and TV sets.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 43 years old, married, and a father of four children. For the past three years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of about KES 13,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for KES 91,100, his third loan, to purchase a new motorbike.

His goal for the future is to continue growing his transport business by owning and operating a fleet of motorcycles so that he could improve the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Mwito Moja Group

texts.en:
Cornel’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Teso District. Cornel is pictured on the right of Mwito Moja Group with his hand raised. He is pictured among the 4 men and 6 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet and sweet potatoes. Cornel first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Cornel joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and will use his increased profits to send his children to school.

Cornel reports that before One Acre Fund he was able to grow about 5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 11 bags per ½ acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to clothe his family. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Cornel’s group will receive a total of 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Jose Aquilino

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo,  porque necesita más capital para realizar la compra de abono y herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya que se encuentra iniciando la siembra de la temporada.
El comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitió comprar insumos agrícolas, para trabajar en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con las ganancias de la cosecha a podido ayudar a su familia, esto le ayudara a mejorar su aporte a los hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he needs money to buy compost and herbicides for his corn and beans plantations, now that the sowing season has started.

José says that with the previous loan, he could buy agricultural supplies for his corn and beans plantations. With the profits from the harvest he has been able to help his family. This will help him improve his contribution to his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Mr. Hussain is 55 years old and a very hardworking man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He has two sons and four daughters. All of them are students. 

Since 2000 Hussain has been selling milk. This business is the only source of income for his family. Currently, he has one buffalo and he sells her milk door-to-door and in the main market as well. His wife also helps him in the business. She takes care of the buffalo and Mr. Hussain carries out the activities of selling milk. 

One buffalo is not enough for their daily household expenses. Therefore he is interested in purchasing two calves in order to grow his business. By doing so he will be able to increase his monthly net income. For that he has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his family and his business. He is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase two calves for his milk-selling business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a lady of forty-seven years, married to Maina and the mother of three children. She sells children's clothes in Nairobi city center and has been in this business for four years. She gets a monthly income of about twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Esther's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to add more stock of new dresses, jeans, ladies tops, etc. to sell. In the future she wants to open another shop.

loans.use: To add  more stock of new dresses, jeans, ladies tops, etc

loans.name: Yasr

texts.en:
Yasr is a 29-year-old single man who lives with a relative in Sana`a, Yemen. He is an employee in the public sector getting a low salary. He works hard and does his best to provide himself with food and clothes.

He intends to buy a home appliance for the house. Unfortunately, the money he makes is really not enough. Therefore, he asked for a youth loan of 150,000 YER. He hopes that will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a home appliance to use in the house.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a clothes retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be an inadequate stock of clothes to sell. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to be the best supplier of secondhand clothes within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Haxhere

texts.en:
Haxhere is a 29-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in the village. Her husband sells wood in their area to earn a living, and Haxhere works in an agricultural business from tradition. She works in agriculture to provide for the family's needs. In this way she provides milk and milk products for her family and she is able to cut expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow. In the future she plans to add more cows to multiply the number of cows she owns. She is aware that without Kiva support her goal will be difficult to achieve. She really appreciates all the support from the lenders!

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess has been running a shop where she sells many items like trousers, blouses, artificial hair, etc. She lives in the area of Grand Bassa County in the capital city, Buchanan, with her two children and husband. Her husband is a driver.

Princess’ business is very supportive to her family and relatives. She is able to keep her children in school, and her plan is to buy another spot to build another shop in the near future. Princess started this business in 2005 by selling to her friends. She is a high school dropout, 32 years old and married. 

Princess is requesting a loan to purchase more trousers, blouses, artificial hair, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more trousers, blouses, artificial hair, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Ufuo Group

texts.en:
Dennis' group has 10 farmers and is located in Teso District. Dennis is pictured on the right of Ufuo Group with his hand raised. Dennis is pictured amongst the 5 men and 5 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potatoes. Dennis first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Dennis joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use his increased profits to send his children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Dennis was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 7 bags per ½ acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Dennis' group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Qajik

texts.en:
Qajik lives in Sarakap village of Shirak region, which is famous for its severe cold climate. Qajik is married with three sons. The best agricultural business for the locals is cattle farming and some limited land cultivation. The family keeps livestock, which currently includes 14 cows, 2 mother pigs, 15 little pigs, 24 chickens, and 6 colonies of bees. Qajik also owns agricultural land where he cultivates wheat.

As Qajik has no sufficient funds to cover the costs of his farm, he has applied for this loan. With the help of the loan, he will purchase barley seeds, fertilizer, and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help him to expand his agricultural activities and gather a higher income. Additional money from the loan will be used to cover fuel costs, which will help Qajik to take the gathered agriculture products to the market to sell.

Qajik is very hardworking farmer and is very excited about developing his farm, earning more income, and ensuring a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds, fertilizer, forage for feeding the livestock, and fuel.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 36 years, married to Mary, and the father of three children.  He is a milk vendor, and has been in this business for 15 years. He gets a monthly income of 30,000 shillings.

This will be Henry's first loan with KADET LTD; he plans to use the entire amount to renovate his milk shop and also to buy milk for sale. 

In the future he wants to be a successful business man.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and also add a stock of  milk.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 38-year-old married man with four children, living in Kagadi Uganda. He operates a retail business which he started with savings from agriculture.

He began this business to improve his standard of living. Tadeo would like to expand his business, and start a new business of motorcycle transport. He intends to use the loan to buy sodas, sugar, and salt to sell.

He dreams of constructing a good residential house, and educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children, 2 years and 4 years old. He describes himself to be a hard-working and warm man. He operates a general store where he sells items such as soap, tea leaves, paraffin, sugar, salt, etc. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a village and his primary customers are local residents. 

Reuben describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of the items. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy  sugar, tea leaves and soap to sell. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Sometimes, Reuben does farming which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves and soap to sell

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus used the previous loan to buy pigs to sell. He is a 48-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a butcher shop that he has run for a period of 12 years. He specifically sells pork and the business is very profitable. He says price fluctuations and inflation are affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. Justus is requesting for a loan to buy pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 53 years old, married, and has two children - a 21-year-old daughter and an 18-year-old son. His daughter goes to university and his son goes to college. Murad's daughter wants to become a teacher and he wants his son to go into business. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. Murad is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. 

This is Murad's second loan from Kiva. Murad started his business 8 years ago to sell drinks and sweets. Now he needs a 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy lemonade, juices and other drinks, wafers, cookies, cupcakes, etc. to sell to local bazaar markets wholesale. He wants to use the money from his new business for his wife because she is ill.  

Murad is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: to buy lemonade, juices and other drinks, wafers, cookies, cupcakes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is a married man with eight children, of which two are in school and the others are married. For the last twenty years, he has been doing farming and, at the same time, doing his business of making and selling shoes as his source of livelihood to support his family.

Kefa is now requesting a loan of 30000 Kenyan shillings to buy inner soles, outer soles, and leather for making the shoes he sells, so that he can get profits to enable him to sustain and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy inner soles, outer soles, and leather for making the shoes he sells.

loans.name: Salima's Group

texts.en:
Salima is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kasese, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Salima has been working hard to manage her art and knitting business, which sells tablecloths. 

To help expand her business, Salima has requested a loan of 700000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more threads for making the tablecloths to sell, and will help Salima to generate greater profits and expand the business, as well as pay school fees for her young brother. 

Salima hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business.

Salima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more threads for making tablecloths to sell.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 40 years old. He lives in the village of Klde, Akhaltsikhe district, with his wife, Shorena, and three children who are going to school. Malkhaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a plot of land. Malkhaz cultivates the land and plants potatoes and maize. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets and the family gets a small monthly income.

Malkhaz requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Malkhaz wants to open a shoe shop. He will rent a space in Akhaltsikhe's local market and purchase shoes at the wholesale price. Malkhaz will be selling shoes himself with a price mark up and earn additional income. He wants to reinvest the profit and develop his new business to have more income. More income will help Malkhaz to have better living conditions for his family and to provide future education for his children.

loans.use: To rent a space and open a shoe shop

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence, aged 36, is a married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a produce business and he started the business with the savings from his salon. He describes himself as hardworking and has a dream of building a house for his family in future and to educating all his children up to university level. Price fluctuations and high license fees are his major challenges while his business plan is to own a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round. Lawrence intends to use the loan to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 33-year-old married man with 6 children living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Due to his passion for agriculture, he started a produce business 12 years ago. With the proceeds he built a house for his family. To supplement his produce business, he has continued farming, and is also involved in alcohol brewing. 

He dreams of educating his children, and buying a lorry to help transport his merchandise to the city. 

Christopher is requesting for a loan to buy maize, coffee, beans, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, coffee, beans, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina thanks her job so much; it has enabled her to go ahead in life. The last Kiva loan helped her to buy more cans for milk storage, and she managed to secure a stall for the sale of milk.

She comes to you again, requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy dairy cows and own her local milk factory so that she can get enough cash to comfortably pay her bills and school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows and own her local milk factory.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 46-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be an honest and warm man. He operates a general store where he sells movie tapes, DVDs and sodas. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a competitive business area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital for expanding the business. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy movie tapes, DVDs and sodas for resale. His business goal is to run a different business of real estate within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy movie tapes, DVDs and soda to sell.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en:
Sonnie is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville North. She’s married, and her husband is a businessman. They have three children between 3 and 20 years old who are in school and live at home. 

For the past five years, she has been selling fish in the local market. She likes her business because it helps her to send her children to school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat and plastic bags for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 30-year-old married man who has four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a retail shop, where he has spent five years. This has helped him to earn income, which he has used to satisfy his family's needs. He also does farming on a large scale. He grows Irish potatoes and maize specifically. He has always reaped tangible benefits, and he even used these profits to start the retail store. He has a challenge of customers not paying on time, while his business plan is to expand to new areas and buy more land for farming. 

Julius is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as soda, beer and soap to sell.

loans.use: to add more capital into his retail store to purchase soda, beer and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. El tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposa de 45 años; también tiene un hijo.
El durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a cultivar la tierra y poseer ganado. Dicha actividad la aprendió con sus padres y esta la realiza todos los días. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semilla, abono y pago del alquiler de la tierra.
La compra le ayudara a incrementar sus cultivos y también obtener más ganancias. Su objetivo es seguir cultivando y lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo works in agriculture and livestock.  He is 55 years old and lives with his wife who is 45 years old.  He also has a son.

Throughout his life he has worked at farming the land and owning livestock.  He learned this activity with his parents and carries it out every day.  He will invest the loan in the purchase of seed and fertilizer and payment of the rent on the land.

The purchase will help him to increase his crops and also obtain better earnings.  His objective is to continue farming and to manage to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer and pay the rent on the land.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and none of them attend school. She does not look after any other family members. 

She has been selling sweet bananas in the market at wholesale for ten years and has no other source of income. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to enable her buy more bunches of yellow bananas to sell. 

Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business to another market. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans. She lives in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 61-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 16 years to 35 years. He describes himself to be a hardworking man. He operates a general store where he sells vegetables, fruits and cereals. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located within a residential area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation. 

David will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy cereals to sell. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of cereals, fruits and vegetables within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
From the small village of Kobuleti district, Irma is 25 years old and lives with her mother, brother and sister-in-law. Irma requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without success. Her requests were rejected due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The family's only source of income is the salary her mother earns picking teas. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, they belong to the subsistence poor category.

Irma requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With this loan, Irma will begin selling clothing which she will purchase from wholesalers and then resell at higher prices. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will increase the income of the family, significantly improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to begin a clothing sales business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married and has one child. He rents a house with electricity but without piped water. For the last three years he has been selling clothes in the interest of earning a living and supporting his family as a father.

He is requesting a loan of Kshs. 25,000 to buy bales of clothes for sale and get money to boost his capital. He appreciates your support to the needy.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for sale

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 71-year-old married man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming alongside teaching as an additional income source. He is facing challenges of unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations. However, he has a vision of expanding his farming and become a large-scale farmer. Amos is requesting a loan to plant onions, Irish potatoes and maize.

loans.use: to buy onions, Irish potatoes and maize to plant.

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben, 28 years old, is single and lives with his entire family. He owns agricultural land. He works in an agricultural business based on family tradition. Arben is a hardworking person and he works a lot to earn a living. He has always worked at planting and growing wheat and corn which he sells in his area. This business is the main source of income for his family. 

Arben is now requesting a loan to buy artificial fertilizer for wheat and corn. The loan will help him to continue to be able to work the land and to reduce costs. Arben hopes in the future to work on wheat cultivation in larger areas. His goal is to have a better life. 

He is very thankful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy artificial fertilizer for wheat and corn

loans.name: Hulda

texts.en:
Hulda is 61 years old and comes from Katito. She is a widow and a mother of five children aged between 21 and 39 years old.

She has a 'posho' mill business and she makes a monthly income of KES. 40,000, she is applying for her fifth loan now which she will use to purchase spare parts for her machine. She will use the anticipated profit to improve her business.

She has a dream of installing electricity so as to stop using diesel as the means of energy for her 'posho' mill.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her 'posho' (cornmeal) mill.

loans.name: Knyaz

texts.en:
Knyaz has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region which is close to the occupied border. He is 52 years old, married, and has three children, 22-year-old and 18-year-old daughters and a 15-year-old son. His daughters goes to university and his son goes to school. 

Knyaz wants his daughters to become a doctors and his son to become a teacher. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. He started his  business nine years ago to raise sheep. Now Knyaz needs a 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy sheep to raise and then resell them. He wants to use the money from his new business to do better by his children's future. In the future he wants to help his eldest daughter to marry. He also wants to have a bigger farm for sheep. This will be more profitable for his business. Knyaz is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: José Edgar

texts.es:
José de 62 años de edad, labora como vendedor ambulante de comidas rápidas en un puesto ubicado cerca a su residencia, en donde comercializa toda clase de fritos, sándwich, gaseosa y tinto. Labora diariamente de cinco de la tarde hasta que termine con la producción del día. Se siente muy agradecido con su trabajo porque gracias a su actividad ha podido mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y generar el sustento diario.
José tiene un gran sueño, expandir su negocio y convertirlo en un gran restaurante familiar, pero sabe que para cumplirlo debe seguir trabajando fuertemente. En la actualidad, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de surtido para aumentar sus ventas, ya que su negocio ha tenido muy buena acogida en el sector. Espera poder crecer dentro del mercado y generar los ingresos suficientes para comprar su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Jose, sixty-two, works as a mobile fast food vendor at a cart located near his home.  He sells all manner of fried foods, sandwiches, soft drinks, and tinto [an espresso-like drink].   He works every day from five in the afternoon until he sells out for the day.  He feels very grateful for his work because thanks to his business he's been able to improve living conditions for himself and his family and keep food on the table every day.  

Jose his a big dream, which is to grow his business and make it into a large family restaurant, but he knows that in order to make that happen he needs to keep working hard.  He is currently seeking a loan that he'll use to buy merchandise to increase his sales because his business has gotten quite a good reception in his area.  He hopes to be able to grow within the market and generate enough income to buy his own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (bread, salsa, soft drinks, coffee).

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Annet has been working hard to manage her fresh food business, in which she sells matooke (a fruit similar to a green banana or plantain) and Irish potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more matooke  and Irish potatoes to sell, and will help Annet to generate greater profits, boost the business and increase the income of  the family. Annet  hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a car. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more matooke (a fruit similar to a green banana or plantain) and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine started this business in 2001. She owns a little shop where she sells home products. She loves her work and works hard to gather high income. Due to her kind attitude towards people, she has managed to gain many loyal customers. 

Now she wants to enlarge her business and increase the sales of the shop. She has applied for this loan to purchase inventory for the shop. This is very important for her to be able to meet current demand and stay competitive in the market.

Armine is alone and lives with her mother who has a with retirement pension. Armine does her best to cover the family's costs and give her mother appropriate conditions for living.

loans.use: to pay for inventory for the shop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old, married to Anne and a father of two lovely children. 

He sells electronics in Kangemi. He has been in this business for seven years now and gets monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This will be James' third loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase radios, flash disks, padlocks, etc. In future he wants to open another shop in Nairobi city centre and employ people to work for him.

loans.use: To purchase more stock like radios, flash disks, padlocks etc

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a 34-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming, alongside a retail business for additional income. He faces hardships of prolonged drought and price fluctuations; however, his plans are to venture into modern farming to boost his output and build a permanent house for residence. Innocent is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 47 years old. She is from the small village of Martvili district. She is married and lives with her husband, mother and two children (17 and 18 years old). Her mother is provided with a retirement pension. Svetlana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, they have 0.3 hectares of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested nuts and cheese locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Svetlana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Svetlana will begin a trade in clothing. She plans to purchase clothing from the wholesalers and then resell it at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothing.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is 58 years old. She lives in the small village of the Martvili district with her 36-year-old son. 

Lamara requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig and 1.6 hectares of agricultural land, where 100 nut trees are grown. Besides, her son works as an artisan and gets a small income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lamara requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the received credit, Lamara will purchase a milking cow. After purchasing the cow, she will be able to produce dairy products for selling. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
María Josefa, tiene 69 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores y trabajan, vive con su esposo en una aldea del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña María Josefa , cuenta con una fuente de ingreso que es un negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como,  harina, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, medicinas, golosinas, productos de abarrotería, además vende refrescos Big cola al por mayor. Ella esta solicitando su tercer préstamo a ODEF por 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos para mantener surtido el negocio como manteca, arroz, frijoles, harina, embutidos, lácteos, productos de limpieza y refrescos Para cumplir con la demanda de los clientes.
Su objetivo es incrementar las ventas para obtener mas ingresos  y  lograr tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Josefa is sixty-nine-years-old and married with five children who are now working adults.  She lives with her husband in a village in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.

María Josefa's source of income is her grocery store, where she sells food products like flour, beans, rice, sugar and butter, as well as medicines, candy,  other grocery items, and wholesale Big Cola soda.  She is seeking her third loan from ODEF for 10,000 lempiras to buy more merchandise to keep her store stocked, like butter, rice, beans, flour, cold cuts, dairy products, cleaning products, and soft drinks, so she can meet client demand.

María Josefa's goal is to increase sales to make more income so she can attain a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Rogers Antonio

texts.es:
Rogers, posee una tienda y realiza viajes en camión. Él vive con su esposa y sus hijos; tiene ayuda de familiares que residen en el extranjero. El negocio lo aprendió en la familia y ya tiene 5 años de poseerlo; la realización de viajes lo lleva acabo desde hace tres años y medio.
El crédito le  ayudara para la compra de maíz, golosinas, galletas, productos de la canasta básica como lo es: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, entre otros; también para adquirir repuestos para el camión. Este le ayudara para tener mayores productos en el negocio para la clientela y así ofrecer un mejor servicio a ellos también para el camión.
Su sueño es incrementar la mercadería para la tienda, mejorar la vivienda  y sacar a sus hijos adelante; si es posible en el futuro agregar otro rubro.
texts.en:
Rogers owns a store and drives a truck, and he also receives help from relatives that live abroad. He lives with his wife and children. Rogers learned about his business from his family, and has had the store for five years. He has been driving the truck for three and a half years.

Rogers will use the loan to buy corn, candies, cookies, essential supplies like beans, rice and sugar and some spare parts for his truck. This loan will help him stock his store and offer a wider variety and a better service, both at the store and with his truck.

Rogers’ dream is to have more merchandise for his store, improve his house and help his children to get ahead. If possible, he would like to add another line of work to his activities.

loans.use: to buy corn, candies, cookies, beans and other supplies for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, maize flour and cereals.

loans.name: Aibe

texts.en:
Aibe is 35 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aibe has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Aibe is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 42 years old and married with three children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

Elvira has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elvira aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old, married, with five children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has an upholstery business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase supplies for her upholstery business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a woman of 29 years, married to James, and a mother of two children. She sells fruits. She has been in this business for 12 years now and gets monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Teresiah's first loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). She plans to use the entire loan to buy different types of fruits to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her business and feed and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits to sell.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina de 35 años, es madre soltera de un niño de un año de edad, el cual se ha convertido en su mayor motivación para salir adelante con el fin de brindarle mejores oportunidades de vida. 
Cuenta que su experiencia laboral la adquirió en la calle como vendedora ambulante de minutos de celular y chance-juegos de azar-. 
Debido al tiempo que le demanda su hijo, Lina optó por destinar sus ahorros a la creación de una pequeña tienda de víveres y productos de la canasta familiar, con el fin de cuidar de su bebe y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de surtido con el objeto de mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ofrecerle a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lina, age 35, is a single mother, and she has a one year old child.  Her child has become her greatest motivation to get ahead.  She wants to get ahead in order to give him better opportunities in life.

She says that she got her work experience on the street as an itinerant seller of cell phone minutes and games of chance.  Due to the time that her child requires, Lina decided to use her savings to create a small store selling provisions and basic food products.  She does this in order to take care of her baby and to generate the income needed to support her household.

She is now requesting a loan to buy stock.  Her objective is to improve her sales and increase her income.  This will allow her to improve their living conditions and to offer her child a better future.

loans.use: to buy basic food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals, sugar, salt, maize flour, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Moises Arahon

texts.es:
Moisés, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere capital para trabajar, ya que inicia la temporada de siembras agrícolas, comprara abono y herbicidas para realizar la siembra de maíz y de frijol.
Considera que el préstamo anterior le brindo los recursos necesarios para comprar los materiales agrícolas y realizar la siembra, él continua trabajando y apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios y la alimentación.
texts.en:
Moisés decided to request a new loan because he requires capital to work, now that the sowing season is starting. He will buy compost and herbicides to grow corn and beans.

He thinks that the previous loan gave him the necessary resources to buy agricultural supplies and to sow. He continues working and supporting his children with education and food.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis de 65 años de edad, es un hombre luchador y esforzado por sacar a su familia adelante, desde hace 31 años, se dedica al oficio de la tapicería, actividad que aprendió por tradición familiar y hoy se ha convertido en el sustento para el y su familia.
Diariamente labora de siete de la mañana a siete de la noche en compañía con un hermano y un sobrino. Agradece a Dios la oportunidad que le ha dado de poder ser una fuente generadora de empleo para su familia y por permitirle crecer dentro del mercado local.
Luis es un hombre lleno de sueños, los cuales espera hacer realidad y para ello trabaja fuertemente porque está convencido que con esfuerzo es posible lograr todo lo que se ha propuesto. 
En la actualidad, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materiales (piel sintética, tela y guata) y herramientas de mano, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de sus productos y generar mayores ingresos que le permita garantizarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
65-year old Luis is a hardworking man who makes a big effort to help his family get ahead. For 31 years he has worked as an upholsterer continuing a family tradition. Now it has become the way he supports himself and his family.

Every day Luis works from 7 am to 7 pm along with his brother and a nephew. With God’s help, the business is a source of employment for his family and allowed him to grow within the local market. 

Luis is a man full of dreams which he hopes to fulfill so he works hard because he is convinced that with effort all is possible. He is now seeking a loan which he will use to buy materials (synthetic leather, fabric, and stuffing), and hand tools in order to improve the quality of his products. Then he will be able to earn more money and provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy materials (synthetic leather, fabric, and stuffing), and hand tools

loans.name: Jofesi

texts.en: Jofesi is a thirty-two-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years now he has been operating a retail shop. He started the business in order to supplement his meager monthly salary. Like most traders he faces challenges of price fluctuation and high license fees while his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Jofesi intends to use the loan to buy toothpaste and powdered soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy  toothpaste and powdered soap to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
Nelson,  se dedica a la comercialización de pan dulce y francés. Él tiene 30 años de edad, está casado y su esposa tiene 28 años de edad, disfrutan de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 2 y 5 años. Nelson, posee 8 años de realizar dicha actividad; también tiene una pequeña panadería que le pertenece a sus padres, por lo cual él les vende el producto.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar pan dulce y francés, luego comercializarlo a sus clientes. Este le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer más su negocio y brindarle una mejer calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson sell pastries and french bread.  He is 30 years old and married. His wife is 28 years old. They have 2 children, ages 2 and 5. Nelson has been involved in this activity for 8 years. He buys his products from a small bakery that belongs to his parents.

The loan he solicits is for purchasing pastries and french bread which he will sell to his customers. This will help him increase his inventory and obtain greater income.

Nelson's dream is to strengthen his business and offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread and french bread to sell.

loans.name: Ibe

texts.en:
Ibe is 27 years old. He is married but has no children. Ibe is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. He currently lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. 

This is Ibe's first loan from Kiva. He started his business of selling fruits and vegetables nine months ago.  Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy potatoes, cucumbers, and onions to sell at the local bazaars. He wants to use the money he earns from his new business to help his family. 

In the future, Ibe wants to have his own store in the bazaar and buy a car to transport the vegetables and fruits. These changes will make his business more profitable. 

Additionally, Ibe and his wife are having fertility problems.  Ibe wants to take his wife to the doctor to treat this issue because he really wants to have children. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. John's main business is selling second-hand clothes alongside farming as an additional income source. He faces challenges of limited capital, however, he has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning and owning a modern boutique. John intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en:
Araz is 40 years old, married, and has three children, an 11-year-old daughter and 15-year-old and 18-year-old sons. His daughter and sons go to school. He wants his daughter to become a geography teacher and his sons to go into business. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Araz has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now Araz lives in Fuzuli region which is close to the occupied border. He started his business three years ago, as a woodworker. He makes foot-lockers, shelves, etc. of wood. Now he needs a 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy electric tools because his electric tools are spoiled and he can't work. He wants to use the money from his new business to help his family. In the future he wants to have his own workroom. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy electric tools

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle. He is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is educating his children and owning at least five motorcycles. He has been operating a retail shop and a motorcycle business for the last eight years despite challenges with high fuel costs. Amos intends to use the loan to buy stock of soap, charcoal and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of soap, charcoal and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 40-year-old married man with four children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He earns his living by selling maize, ice and beans. Like most farmers he faces the challenge of price fluctuations and bad weather. But he is determined to educate his children so that they can attain degrees. Richard intends to use this loan to buy a motorcycle and land to farm.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and land to farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old married man with 5 children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop, along side farming as an additional income. He is facing hardships of price fluctuation and bad weather. However, he has a vision of owning a wholesale shop, since there are many retail shops in the area dealing in the same products. 

John intends to use the loan to buy more stock of sugar and soap, as well as land for farming.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and land for farming.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina de 32 años de edad , está casada y tiene 2 hijas . Vive contenta rodeada de sus padres, hijos y esposo en la casa de sus padres. Desde los 20 años trabaja en las tierras de cultivo por está razón siembra papas, arvejas y habas. “Es rentable sembrar habas y arvejas porque no se invierte tanto como en la papa”, explica.Delfina afirma que el trabajo en el campo es muy cansado, más aún soportando las lluvias y el frío de su zona, pero estos no son inconvenientes para seguir luchando ya que sus hijas valen la pena .Las ventas son mejores en la capital del país, así que viaja con constancia llevando verduras y papas al mercado mayorista.
Ella espera contar con buenos ahorros para adquirir un auto y así trasladarse con facilidad, para ello seguirá trabajando con el mismo optimismo.
Éste sería su octavo crédito con KIVA y da su palabra de ser puntual con el pago de las cuotas mensuales.Delfina invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Delfina is 32 years old, married, and has 2 daughters. She lives contentedly in her parent's house, surrounded by her parents, children, and husband. For 20 years, she has worked in cultivated fields and, for that reason, she grows potatoes, green peas, and beans. “It is profitable to sow beans and green peas because you don't have to invest as much as you do in potatoes,” she explains.

Delfina affirms that farm work is very tiring, and she has to put up with the rains and cold of her region. But such inconveniences do not stop her from continuing the struggle, because her daughters make it worthwhile. Sales are better in the national capital, therefore she travels there constantly, transporting vegetables and potatoes to the wholesale market.

Delfina hopes to be able to save a lot and acquire an automobile to facilitate her transport. And to do so, she will work with that same optimism.

This will be Delfina's 8th loan with Kiva and she gives her word that she will be punctual in making her monthly payments. Delfina will invest the 3,800 sols in purchasing organic manure to fertilize her plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 31 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the densely populated areas in Montserrado County. She is single and she is a university student. She is an easy-going person, business-minded, and a hardworking woman. For the past four years she has been selling charcoal by the bag in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and continue her education.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Fima

texts.en:
Fima is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. All of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fima has a food vending business in the Philippines. Fima has been in this business for twelve years. Fima requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Fima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
Please meet Alusine from Sierra Leone.  He is 34 years old and married with two children, aged 6 and 8.  Both of his children are currently attending school. 

Alusine owns a clothing and accessories business in Waterloo area.  When he was younger, he liked to assist his mother with the business and later also went into business himself.  He has been operating his own business for 10 years.  He works every day of the week from 7am to 7:30pm.  He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more bags, shoes, clothes, sandals and trousers.  In five years, he wants to expand and introduce other merchandise to his business.  He says his main challenge is transportation costs and increasing prices of some goods.  He is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more bags, shoes, clothes, sandals and trousers.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata from Waterloo, Sierra Leone.  She is 34 years old and married with one child, aged 12.  Her husband works two jobs, one as a pastor and one as a private security officer. 

Aminata has been running a provisions shop in town since 2011.  She started her business to help her husband take care of the family.  She works at her shop for 10 hours a day, from Monday to Sunday.  She wants to use the loan to buy more goods to sell, such as drinks, milk and mayonnaise.  She wants expand her shop and sell more goods to her customers.  She says that during the rainy season, business is difficult as there are fewer customers.  She is says thanks to BRAC and Kiva and is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, such as drinks, milk and mayonnaise

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is Salamata from Sierra Leone.  She is 48 years old and married with nine children.  Her youngest child is eight years old.  

Salamata owns a cookery in Waterloo, a suburb outside of the capital.  She initially started in business because her father was sick and she had to drop out of school to help the family.  She chose the food business because it has the most customers and is a profitable business.   She works from 7 am to 7 pm every day.  She is requesting the loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her restaurant, including rice, soft drinks, oil, sesame and tomatoes.  She hopes to see her business expand into a larger space and become more profitable.  She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her restaurant, including rice, soft drinks, oil, sesame and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en: Ibrahem is a 22-year-old single young man. He is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover all his needs. Ibrahem also is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ibrahem to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Ibrahem and improve his living conditions. Ibrahem is photographed in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet's school is running well. She was able to provide desks and chairs from the previous loan. As a result of the increased enrollment, she looks forward to supplying textbooks. 

She is therefore applying for a loan of 43,150 Kenya shillings to buy her school textbooks. Linet believes this will help put the school at par with some of the public schools in the area.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu is 37 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a plumber. They have a 13-year-old child who is currently in school and lives at home. 

For the past thirteen years, she has been selling peanut and palm oil in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more peanut and palm oil for her business. 

Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more peanut and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Aminata from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 8 and 16. Her children are currently attending school. In 2000, Aminata established her grocery business. She began her business because her mother trained her in business management. She works at the business every day from morning to night.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman who desires to educate her children, despite the low purchasing power of customers.  

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy milk, soft drinks, sardines, mayonnaise and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the lives of her family and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Aminata plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk, soft drinks, sardines, mayonnaise and pure water.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis, a resident of Mombasa, Kenya, runs a second-hand textbook stall. He is single. The books are normally purchased by those who cannot afford the cost of new books. The business has been operating for two years.

Dennis was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to order another stock of books. His ambition is to complete his studies and he believes the income from this business will help him achieve that.

loans.use: to buy another stock of used textbooks.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a fifty year old lady. She is married to her husband, Joseph, and is a mother of one child. 

She sells beans in Nairobi city centre, She has been in this business for four years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This will be Caroline's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase stock such as beans and green grams. In the future, she wants to sell different types of cereals.

loans.use: to purchase cereals such as beans and green grams.

loans.name: M. Rose

texts.fr:
M. Rose  fait partie du groupe Shikako  et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Elle est cliente de Turame depuis  2009. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Thérence. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de  15 à  22 ans, dont 4 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge sa mère ,  ses 3 petites sœurs et ses 3 petits frères.
